original: mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe 'di ni bden no snyam pa ni shes pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe 'di ni bden no snyam pa ni shes pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: At the time of clear knowledge, the thought ‚ÄúThis is the truth‚Äù is the stage of knowledge.

original: bden pa de'i gong du phyir zhing bdag gis yongs su shes par bya ba nas bsgom par bya ba'i bar du mthong ba ni mthong @283a * //üîΩpa'i gnas skabs so //

translated: The seeing of the truth again and again, from the time of clear knowledge until the time of cultivation, is the stage of seeing.

original: mi slob pa'i sa la bdag gis yongs su shes zin to zhes bya ba nas mngon sum du byas zin to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs so //

translated: The thought ‚ÄúI have known completely,‚Äù up to the thought ‚ÄúI have actualized,‚Äù on the stage of no learning, is the stage of clear knowledge.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mi slob pa'i zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i ye shes dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni shes pa'i gnas skabs so //

translated: Another explanation: The stage of knowledge is the knowledge of destruction and knowledge of non-arising, included in the stage of no-more-learning, and the knowledge of liberation.

original: mi slob pa de nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa de nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The seeing is the right view associated with the knowledge of liberation, in the stage of no-more-learning.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas bzung ste /

original: slob pa'i shes rab thams cad ni mngon par rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩbden pa shes pa'i las dang mtshan nyid ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /

translated: It should be understood that all the wisdom of the learner is realization.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The function and characteristics of the knowledge of the truth should be understood as sixfold:

original: sdug bsngal gang bden pa mthong bas spangs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i thog mar 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal gang dgra bcom pas spangs pa'i sdug bsngal mthar thug pa bya ba'i thog mar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang bden pa mthong bas spangs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i thog mar 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal gang dgra bcom pas spangs pa'i sdug bsngal mthar thug pa bya ba'i thog mar 'gro ba ste /
translated: The first is the beginning of the complete destruction of the suffering that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, and the second is the beginning of the final limit of the suffering that is to be abandoned by the Arhat.

original: nyi ma 'char ba'i skye rengs dang po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ba'i skye rengs dang po dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten na ma rig pa'i mun pa chen po'i gnyen po'i tshul gyis snang ba lta bur sel bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, it is like a light that dispels the great darkness of ignorance in the world by the method of being the antidote.

original: de bzhin du 'di na kha cig bden pa shes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di na kha cig bden pa shes pa la brten nas /
translated: In the same way, here someone, based on the knowledge of the truth,

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs te /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs te /

original: de'i rjes la brjed ngas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i rjes la brjed ngas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur mod kyi /

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe bag yod pa la brten nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa na de bden pa shes pa de nyid kyi rjes thogs su phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur te /

original: de ltar na bden pa shes pa ni byed pa rgya che zhing 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa shes pa ni byed pa rgya che zhing 'bras bu rgya che ba yin no //

original: de la 'das pa'i 'du byed skyes zin pa gang yin pa rnams dang / da ltar skyes pa gang yin pa rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa na skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni kun 'byung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ste /

translated: But the teaching of the TathƒÅgatas, which is endowed with the ƒÅrya truths, should be understood as a demonstration of true superiority, because that superiority is definitely fixed.

analyzed: kha cig 'jig rten pa'i srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi shes pas mkhas pa de dag ni yang dag par mkhas pa ma yin te /

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are not truly wise, for the reasons given above.

original: bden pa shes pas mkhas pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa shes pas mkhas pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i mkhas pa yin te /
translated: Those who are wise through knowledge of the truths are truly wise.

original: bden pa shes pa bzhi las bden pa shes pa dang po ni bden pa rnams rim gyis mngon par rtogs par bya ba la rtsig rmad lta bu'o //
analyzed: bden pa shes pa bzhi las bden pa shes pa dang po ni bden pa rnams rim gyis mngon par rtogs par bya ba la rtsig rmad lta bu'o //
translated: Among the four knowledges of the truths, the first knowledge of the truths is like a wall for gradually realizing the truths.

original: gnyis pa ni rtsig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtsig pa lta bu'o //
translated: The second is like a wall.

original: gsum pa ni bla gab lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bla gab lta bu'o //
translated: The third is like a roof.

original: bzhi pa ni bla gab phyur po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bla gab phyur po lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is like a solid roof.

original: bzhi po de dag ni shes rab kyi khang bzangs chen po'i steng du 'gro ba la them skas kyi them pa bzhi lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni shes rab kyi khang bzangs chen po'i steng du 'gro ba la them skas kyi them pa bzhi lta bu yang yin no //
translated: These four are like the four steps of a staircase for ascending to the great mansion of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i skas rnams kyi skas kyi them pa ni shes pa de dag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i skas rnams kyi skas kyi them pa ni shes pa de dag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These knowledges should be understood as the steps of the staircase of liberation and nirvana.

original: sred pa gsum ni bdud sdig can gyi 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por skyes pa'i srog chags rnams bzung ba'i rtsol ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sred pa gsum ni bdud sdig can gyi 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por skyes pa'i srog chags rnams bzung ba'i rtsol ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The three cravings are like the efforts of the demon Mara to catch the creatures born in the great ocean of cyclic existence.

original: bdud kyi rtsol ba de dag gis kyang sems can rnam pa gsum ni gzung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bdud kyi rtsol ba de dag gis kyang sems can rnam pa gsum ni gzung bar mi nus te /
translated: By these efforts of Mara, three kinds of beings cannot be caught.

original: de dag kyang chung ngu'i ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang chung ngu'i ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: The small ones are the stream-enterers.

original: 'bring ni de ma yin pa'i slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'bring ni de ma yin pa'i slob pa rnams so //
translated: The medium ones are the trainees who are not that.

original: chen po'i ni mi slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: chen po'i ni mi slob pa rnams so //
translated: The great ones are the non-trainees.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa'i lam la zhugs pa dang ; ci dga' mgur byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa'i lam la zhugs pa dang ; ci dga' mgur byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have entered the path that is the opposite of the stream and because they are not free to do as they wish.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag slob pa dang dgra bcom pa'i ni nga rgyal las gyur pa dang / nga rgyal las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyung ngu ni lus phal cher ni spangs so //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag slob pa dang dgra bcom pa'i ni nga rgyal las gyur pa dang / nga rgyal las byung ba'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyung ngu ni lus phal cher ni spangs so //
translated: The person who has seen the truth, the trainee and the arhat, have abandoned the suffering that arises from pride and the suffering that arises from pride, so they have abandoned most of the suffering of the body.

original: nga rgyal las byung ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sred pas bskyed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal yang nyung ngu ni lus phal cher ni spangs te /
analyzed: nga rgyal las byung ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sred pas bskyed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal yang nyung ngu ni lus phal cher ni spangs te /
translated: A small amount of suffering is eliminated, and most of the body remains.

original: dper na rdo'i gseg ma dang gangs ri bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rdo'i gseg ma dang gangs ri bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like a stone with a little snow on it, or a snow mountain.

original: nga rgyal las byung ba ni de tsam zhig lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal las byung ba ni de tsam zhig lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that suffering produced by pride is like that, with a little remaining and most eliminated.üîΩFor example, it is like two or three drops of water fallen in a pond, or like the water remaining in a great lake.

original: dper na rdzing gi nang nas chu'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum phyogs gcig tu bor ba dang / rdzing chen po'i nang na 'dug pa'i chu bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par @287a * //
analyzed: dper na rdzing gi nang nas chu'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum phyogs gcig tu bor ba dang / rdzing chen po'i nang na 'dug pa'i chu bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par @287a * //
translated: The remaining and eliminated suffering produced by craving in the formless realm should be understood in the same way.

original: bya'o ; / dper na mtsho chen po dang lteng ka'i dpes ni snga ma bzhin du gzugs kyi srid pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //üîΩrgya mtsho chen po'i dpes ni snga ma bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / dper na mtsho chen po dang lteng ka'i dpes ni snga ma bzhin du gzugs kyi srid pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o // rgya mtsho chen po'i dpes ni snga ma bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great ocean and the pond are like the former, and the mountain of snow, the mountain of gold, Mount Meru, the great earth, the six kinds of straw, and the lump of clay are like the latter.üîΩThe mountain of snow, the mountain of gold, Mount Meru, and the great earth are like the former, and the six kinds of straw are like the latter.üîΩThe six kinds of straw are like the former, and the lump of clay is like the latter.

original: gangs ri dang / gser gyi ri dang / ri rab dang / sa chen po'i dpe dang / gseg ma'i dpe drug dang / 'ji ba'i gong bu'i dpes ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: gangs ri dang / gser gyi ri dang / ri rab dang / sa chen po'i dpe dang / gseg ma'i dpe drug dang / 'ji ba'i gong bu'i dpes ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: The lump of clay is like the former, and the body, speech, and mind are like the latter.

original: gti mug gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal snga ma bzhin du lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal snga ma bzhin du lus pa dang spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are like the former, and the suffering produced by attachment, aversion, and delusion are like the latter.

original: de ltar na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal phal cher dang bral la nyung ngu lus pa'i phyir don che ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la slob pa'i ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du de ltar thogs na skye ba bdun gyi sdug bsngal lus te /
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal phal cher dang bral la nyung ngu lus pa'i phyir don che ba yin par rig par bya'o // de la slob pa'i ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du de ltar thogs na skye ba bdun gyi sdug bsngal lus te /
translated: Thus, the clear realization of the truths is of great benefit, since one is mostly free from suffering and only a little remains.

original: ngan song gi ni thams cad las 'das so //
analyzed: ngan song gi ni thams cad las 'das so //
translated: The learner who is born in the desire realm and the form realm is born at the most seven times, since he is born seven times at the most.

original: mi slob pa'i ni tshe 'di'i phung po tsam zhig lus te gzhan thams cad las 'das so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ni tshe 'di'i phung po tsam zhig lus te gzhan thams cad las 'das so //
translated: The nonlearner is born only in this life, since he is born in this life alone.

original: lus gang la gnas pas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i lus de yang dkon no //
analyzed: lus gang la gnas pas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i lus de yang dkon no //
translated: The body in which one realizes the truths is also rare.

original: mig dang ldan zhing bden pa mthong ba'i slob pa de dag kyang dkon no //
analyzed: mig dang ldan zhing bden pa mthong ba'i slob pa de dag kyang dkon no //
translated: Learners who have eyes and see the truths are also rare.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang dkon te /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang dkon te /
translated: Wisdom arisen from hearing, wisdom arisen from contemplation and wisdom arisen from meditation are also rare.

original: des na chos 'dul ba 'di go rims bzhin du kun du shes shing /
analyzed: des na chos 'dul ba 'di go rims bzhin du kun du shes shing /
translated: Therefore, this discipline of the Dharma is understood in stages.

original: rnam par shes la rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes la rab tu shes te /
translated: One understands through knowledge.

original: kun shes pas ni yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun shes pas ni yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: One has faith through complete understanding.

original: rnam par shes pas ni mos par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni mos par byed do //
translated: One has devotion through knowledge.

original: rab tu shes pas ni chos rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩbden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshogs su gyur pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab tu shes pas ni chos rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro // bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshogs su gyur pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: One realizes the teachings through thorough knowledge.

original: mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / dge pa bcu'i las kyi lam de dag kyang dkon no //
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang / dge pa bcu'i las kyi lam de dag kyang dkon no //
translated: The wholesome factors with outflows that are the collection for the realization of the truths, such as the ten wholesome courses of action, are also rare.

original: dal ba phun sum tshogs pa yang dkon no //
analyzed: dal ba phun sum tshogs pa yang dkon no //
translated: The perfection of leisure is also rare.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes la thug pa man chad kyi chos bcu po de dag kyang dkon no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes la thug pa man chad kyi chos bcu po de dag kyang dkon no //
translated: Those ten factors, from right view in the world up to the knowledge of liberation, are also rare.

original: slob pa de dag nyid dang mi slob pa de dag @287b nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: slob pa de dag nyid dang mi slob pa de dag @287b nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The learners and the adepts are also like that.

original: de la byas pa gzo ba'i skyes bu'i gang zag ni pha ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i rigs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: de la byas pa gzo ba'i skyes bu'i gang zag ni pha ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i rigs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: The person who is grateful is one who, knowing perfectly well the propriety of honoring one's parents, honors them.

original: de ltar na phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus he is one who holds to the father and the mother.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni dge sbyong dang bram ze yon tan can gzhan dag la yon gnas yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas ci rigs par ri mo byed pa 'di ni dge sbyong du 'dzin
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni dge sbyong dang bram ze yon tan can gzhan dag la yon gnas yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas ci rigs par ri mo byed pa 'di ni dge sbyong du 'dzin
translated: The person who is desirous of his own benefit is one who, knowing perfectly well the propriety of honoring those who are worthy of gifts, such as the virtuous ascetics and brahmins, honors them.

original: pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus he is one who holds to the ascetics and the brahmins.üîΩThe person who is not greedy and not lazy is one who, with regard to his family of children, wife, male and female servants, etc., thinks:

original: brkam chags med pa dang / le lo med pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo la sogs pa bu snad kyi 'khor la 'di dag ni bdag la brten pa ste /
analyzed: brkam chags med pa dang / le lo med pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo la sogs pa bu snad kyi 'khor la 'di dag ni bdag la brten pa ste /
translated: These are dependent on me.

original: bdag dpung gnyen yin pas na bdag gi bde bas ni bde la bdag gis sdug pas ni sdug par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: bdag dpung gnyen yin pas na bdag gi bde bas ni bde la bdag gis sdug pas ni sdug par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du rig nas /
translated: Since the self is the friend, the self is happy when the self is happy, and the self suffers when the self suffers.

original: dus dus su legs par zas dang gos sbyin pa dang / nad kyi gsos sman gyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su legs par zas dang gos sbyin pa dang / nad kyi gsos sman gyis sdud par byed do //
translated: From time to time, he or she provides them with food and clothing and with medicine for their illnesses.

original: de dag gi don gyi phyir bdag nyid kyang spro bar byed cing nyams su len par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gi don gyi phyir bdag nyid kyang spro bar byed cing nyams su len par byed de /
translated: He or she also takes on their work and is enthusiastic about doing so.

original: thams cad gzhan la yongs su mi tshol lo //
analyzed: thams cad gzhan la yongs su mi tshol lo //
translated: He or she does not seek anything for him- or herself from others.

original: bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yang yin no //üîΩdon med par yang longs spyod rnams chud gzon par mi byed do //
analyzed: bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yang yin no // don med par yang longs spyod rnams chud gzon par mi byed do //
translated: He or she is also disposed to share.üîΩHe or she does not waste possessions pointlessly.

original: gnas ma yin par yang sko bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gnas ma yin par yang sko bar mi byed do //
translated: He or she does not appoint someone to a position who is not fit for it.

original: gnas ma yin par yang sko bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gnas ma yin par yang sko bar mi byed do //
translated: He or she does not appoint someone to a position who is fit for it in an improper manner.

original: ches rgan zhing bla ma lta bur gyur pa rnams la yang rjes su mthun par byed do //
analyzed: ches rgan zhing bla ma lta bur gyur pa rnams la yang rjes su mthun par byed do //
translated: He or she also treats with deference those who are very old and who are like teachers.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa'o //
translated: This is the deference that a bodhisattva shows toward the elders of the family.

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi don yang byed de chos bzhin du byed kyi chos ma yin pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi don yang byed de chos bzhin du byed kyi chos ma yin pas ni ma yin te /
translated: He also accomplishes the aims of self and other, but in accordance with the Dharma, not in a way that is contrary to the Dharma.

original: de ltar na don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he accomplishes the aims of self and other, and he accomplishes what must be done.

original: tshe 'di la sdig pa'i las byas na gzhan gyi nyes pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdig pa'i las byas na gzhan gyi nyes pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In this life, he sees the faults of others who have committed evil deeds,

original: gsod pa'am 'ching ba'am chad pas gcod pa'am /
analyzed: gsod pa'am 'ching ba'am chad pas gcod pa'am /
translated: such as killing, binding, beating,üîΩhumiliating, and reviling.

original: dmas pa'am / smad pa yang dag par mthong na so sor brtags nas mi byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten 'di'i kha na ma thob la 'jigs par lta'o //
analyzed: dmas pa'am / smad pa yang dag par mthong na so sor brtags nas mi byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten 'di'i kha na ma thob la 'jigs par lta'o //
translated: He sees that they are to be avoided, and he does not commit them.

original: sdig pa'i kun du spyod pa byas na 'jig rten phyi ma la ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang / gzhan yang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang dag par mthong nas so @288a * //üîΩsor brtags te mi byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i kun du spyod pa byas na 'jig rten phyi ma la ngan song gi sdug bsngal dang / gzhan yang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang dag par mthong nas so @288a * //üîΩsor brtags te mi byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta ba'o //
translated: He sees that the performance of evil deeds leads to the suffering of the lower realms and to other kinds of suffering in the next world.üîΩHe sees that they are to be avoided, and he does not commit them.

original: dus dus su sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang dag par blangs te 'dug go //
analyzed: dus dus su sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang dag par blangs te 'dug go //
translated: From time to time, he takes up and dwells in the meritorious deeds that arise from giving.

original: bsod nams rnam pa sna tshogs kyang byed de /
analyzed: bsod nams rnam pa sna tshogs kyang byed de /
translated: He also performs various meritorious actions.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: For example,

original: nad g-yog bya ba dang / dus la bab na zhal ta byed pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i bsod nams byed do //
analyzed: nad g-yog bya ba dang / dus la bab na zhal ta byed pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i bsod nams byed do //
translated: he serves as a nurse, and when the time is right, he acts as an advisor. He performs meritorious actions of this kind.

original: nyin zhag gcig dang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig dang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: He takes up morality for one day, or as long as he lives.

original: de bas na sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed la bsnyen gnas la gnas shing tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed la bsnyen gnas la gnas shing tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called one who gives gifts and makes merit, who observes the Uposadha precepts, and who takes up morality.

original: las kyi lam bcu las zung dang sum phrugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis spel mar ston te /
analyzed: las kyi lam bcu las zung dang sum phrugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis spel mar ston te /
translated: The ten courses of action are taught in a mixed way by means of the distinctions of pairs, triads, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa gnyis kyis de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'am mang du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa gnyis kyis de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'am mang du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: through hearing and reflection, he has the mental activity associated with them, or he does them frequently.

original: sems can ngan song du skyes pa rnams de nas thar par dka' ba dang / bde 'gror skyes pa rnams myur ba myur bar de dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ni dal ba phun sum tshogs pa dkon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ngan song du skyes pa rnams de nas thar par dka' ba dang / bde 'gror skyes pa rnams myur ba myur bar de dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ni dal ba phun sum tshogs pa dkon par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is rare to find the perfect opportunity because it is difficult for beings born in the lower realms to escape from there, and even those born in the higher realms will soon be separated from it.

original: de la bden pa mthong bas ni spyir na yang dag pa'i lta ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bden pa mthong bas ni spyir na yang dag pa'i lta ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The seeing of the truth in general produces right view.

original: 'das pa'i dus na ni skyes zin to //üîΩde ltar byung ba'i dus la bab pa na ni skyes so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na ni skyes zin to // de ltar byung ba'i dus la bab pa na ni skyes so //
translated: In the past, it has already arisen.üîΩIn the present, it has arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni phyis bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni phyis bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the future, it will be generated later.

original: kun du bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcultivated, developed, and repeatedly practiced‚Äù should be understood as before.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gang yin pa de ni rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gang yin pa de ni rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The mundane is to be protected.

original: slob pa'i gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas te rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas te rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: The learner‚Äôs is to be understood as having the fruit of abandoning the afflictions.

original: mi slob pa'i gang yin pa de ni rang gi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas te mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gang yin pa de ni rang gi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas te mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is not a learner is to be actualized together with its result, which is freedom from one's own afflictions.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o /
translated: The same should be understood for the other members up to the knowledge of liberation, which is like right view.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /üîΩbam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba / bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: The Compendium of Bases in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi

original: spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary:

original: bsdus pa'i don dang gsum bdun bsdus //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don dang gsum bdun bsdus //
translated: The summarized meaning, the three, the seven summaries,

original: rang bzhin tshor ba tha ma yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin tshor ba tha ma yin //
translated: The nature, and the last feeling.üîΩThe summary: The summarized meanings,üîΩThe divisions of their own type,üîΩThe similar subsequent engagement,

original: sdom ni / bsdus pa yi ni @288b don rnams dang // rang gi rigs kyi dbye ba dang // 'dra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang // chol ba gsum ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: sdom ni / bsdus pa yi ni @288b don rnams dang // rang gi rigs kyi dbye ba dang // 'dra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang // chol ba gsum ni tha ma yin //
translated: And the three faults are the last.

original: mdor bsdu na khams ni gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khams ni gnyis yod de /
translated: In brief, there are two realms:

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / goms pas yongs su brtas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / goms pas yongs su brtas pa'o //
translated: The naturally abiding and the one that increases through cultivation.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni ji ltar khams bco brgyad po 'di dag so sor nges par rgyud la yod pa'i sa bon no //üîΩde la goms pas yongs su brtas pa'i khams ni dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos sngon gyi skye ba gzhan dag tu kun tu brten pa gang yin pa de dag yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni ji ltar khams bco brgyad po 'di dag so sor nges par rgyud la yod pa'i sa bon no // de la goms pas yongs su brtas pa'i khams ni dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos sngon gyi skye ba gzhan dag tu kun tu brten pa gang yin pa de dag yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The naturally existing potential is the seed of each of the eighteen elements that exists distinctly in the mind stream.üîΩThe developed potential is the seed that exists in the support, the basis of personal existence, and that is developed by the repeated practice of either virtuous or nonvirtuous dharmas in other lives.

original: da lta sa bon yongs su brtas pa rten la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: da lta sa bon yongs su brtas pa rten la gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is developed in order to bring about the full accomplishment of those virtuous or nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: des na de rkyen chung ngu tsam la yang dmigs nas des bkri zhing des 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de rkyen chung ngu tsam la yang dmigs nas des bkri zhing des 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even when the conditions are slight, one will be led by that potential and will follow it.

original: mdor bsdu na khams bco brgyad po dmigs pa 'di dag ni 'dir khams re re zhing yang las ngang 'gro ba dang sems can sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i bye brag gus tshad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khams bco brgyad po dmigs pa 'di dag ni 'dir khams re re zhing yang las ngang 'gro ba dang sems can sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i bye brag gus tshad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, these eighteen elements that are the objects of observation are to be understood here as the limitless categories of the various types of beings, in terms of each of the elements having its own function.

original: dper na cho lo rnams kyi cho lo'i phung po chen po ni rigs gcig pa'i phyir phung por gtogs pa'i cho lo rnams la gcig tu brjod mod kyi /üîΩcho lo de dag ni tshad med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na cho lo rnams kyi cho lo'i phung po chen po ni rigs gcig pa'i phyir phung por gtogs pa'i cho lo rnams la gcig tu brjod mod kyi / cho lo de dag ni tshad med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the great mass of dice is called one because the dice that are included in the mass are of one type.üîΩBut the dice are not one, because they are innumerable.

original: khams re re zhing yang tshad med mod kyi rigs gcig pa'i phyir re rer bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: khams re re zhing yang tshad med mod kyi rigs gcig pa'i phyir re rer bstan par mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, the elements are innumerable, but they are taught as one because they are of one type.

original: khams de yang mos pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams de yang mos pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And that element is accomplished by the power of aspiration.

original: sngon sdig pa la mos pa ni sdig pa can yin no //
analyzed: sngon sdig pa la mos pa ni sdig pa can yin no //
translated: One who has previously aspired to evil is evil.

original: dge ba la mos pa ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la mos pa ni dge ba yin no //
translated: One who has aspired to good is good.

original: de ci 'dra bar yang dag par 'grub par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: de ci 'dra bar yang dag par 'grub par gyur pa de ni /
translated: And one who is accomplished in that way

original: de dang chos mthun pa pa'i sems can rnams 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig tu spyod cing dga' la gnas par byed pa dang / lta ba mthun par 'dzin pa dang / de la mos par byed de /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa pa'i sems can rnams 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig tu spyod cing dga' la gnas par byed pa dang / lta ba mthun par 'dzin pa dang / de la mos par byed de /
translated: only associates with, delights in, and dwells with those sentient beings who are similar to oneself, who hold similar views, and who aspire to that.

original: de bas na khams kyi sgo nas sems can rnams 'du bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na khams kyi sgo nas sems can rnams 'du bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that beings are gathered by means of the elements.

original: de la tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas dad pa ni dang por brjod do ;
analyzed: de la tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas dad pa ni dang por brjod do ;
translated: In this regard, faith is mentioned first in the context of the pursuit of pure conduct.

original: / de'i 'og tu tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //üîΩde nas bdag dang gzhan la brten te /
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do // de nas bdag dang gzhan la brten te /
translated: After that, one undertakes moral discipline.

original: kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one is ashamed of transgressing in regard to oneself and others.

original: de nas dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //üîΩbyas nas yun ring du lon pa dang smras nas yun @289a * //
analyzed: de nas dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rtsom mo // byas nas yun ring du lon pa dang smras nas yun @289a * //
translated: Then, one strives with vigor to always cultivate virtuous qualities.

original: ring du lon pa yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: ring du lon pa yang mi brjod do //
translated: One does not speak of what was done long ago or what was said long ago.

original: de gnyis la brten nas sems mnyam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de gnyis la brten nas sems mnyam par gzhag go //
translated: On the basis of those two, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows things as they really are.

original: 'di ni dad pa'i sgo nas go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ; lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa'i sgo nas go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ; lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the order in which the three trainings arise through faith: the training in higher morality, the training in higher mind, and the training in higher wisdom.

original: de rnams kyi tshogs kyi lam ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / gtod pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'o ;
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshogs kyi lam ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / gtod pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'o ;
translated: The path of accumulation for these bodhisattvas consists of mundane right view, being easy to nourish, being easy to satisfy, having few desires, being content, and the four means of gathering disciples.

original: / gso sla ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / gso sla ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of being easy to nourish and so on is as follows.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: They are as they appear in the Sravaka Levels.

original: de ni tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the completion of the search for pure conduct.

original: de la tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i khams de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams ni de dang mthun pa rnams 'ba' zhig dang 'dri bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de la tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i khams de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams ni de dang mthun pa rnams 'ba' zhig dang 'dri bar byed kyi /
translated: In this regard, sentient beings who possess the element that searches for pure conduct ask only those who are compatible with it.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i khams dang ldan pa rnams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i khams dang ldan pa rnams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not those who have a different element.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag las kyi //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag las kyi //
translated: The effect depends on the cause,

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu la rag las pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu la rag las pa ma yin te /
translated: but the cause does not depend on the effect.

original: de bas na ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug gi khams la brten nas rten gyi bye brag gis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnams pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //üîΩma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug gi khams la brten nas rten gyi bye brag gis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnams pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo // ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, based on the six elements associated with the element of nescience, various kinds of contact born of nescience occur, due to the specific support.üîΩBased on the various kinds of contact born of nescience, various kinds of feeling born of contact born of nescience occur.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: Based on the various kinds of feeling born of contact born of nescience, craving born of feeling born of contact born of nescience occurs, due to the specific support.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa nas rgyas par sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po'i bar du kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa nas rgyas par sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po'i bar du kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni srid pa tshol ba'i sgo nas khams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa tshol ba'i sgo nas khams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the realms are presented from the perspective of seeking existence.

original: ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug gi khams nyid la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug gi khams nyid la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg par 'byung ngo //
translated: The six sense sources that are connected to the realm of ignorance give rise to the contact of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la brten nas yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la brten nas yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'byung ngo //
translated: Based on the contact of ignorance, there arises the perception that apprehends the signs and indications of improper mental images of objects.

original: 'du shes de la brten nas yul de la @289b 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'du shes de la brten nas yul de la @289b 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: Based on that perception, desire for those objects arises.

original: 'dod pa la brten nas de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la brten nas de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Based on desire, there arises the frequent consideration of phenomena that are in accordance with that.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la mang du rjes su rtog pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on the frequent consideration of phenomena that are in accordance with that,

original: gdung ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid mi bde ba las gyur pa'i lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: gdung ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid mi bde ba las gyur pa'i lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba 'byung ngo ;
translated: and the torment of body and mind that arises from sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and anguish.

original: / de la brten nas yul yongs su tshol ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de la brten nas yul yongs su tshol ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: On the basis of that, the various kinds of searching for objects arise.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa tshol ba'i sgo nas khams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa tshol ba'i sgo nas khams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the realms are established on the basis of the search for pleasure.üîΩThe summary verses: Three, seven, and the summary,

original: sdom ni / gsum dang bdun ni bsdus pa dang // 'du shes 'phags pa sna tshogs gzhag /
analyzed: sdom ni / gsum dang bdun ni bsdus pa dang // 'du shes 'phags pa sna tshogs gzhag /
translated: Perception, noble, various,üîΩInner serenity,

original: nang du yang dag 'jog pa dang // byis pa rnams ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog pa dang // byis pa rnams ni tha ma yin //
translated: And the childish are the last.

original: khams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: khams ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three realms:

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams so //
translated: the realm of form, the formless realm, and the realm of cessation.

original: gzhan yang khams ni bdun te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khams ni bdun te /
translated: There are also seven realms:

original: 'od dang / dge ba dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dang / dge ba dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'o //
translated: light, virtue, the four formless states, and cessation.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams kyis ni 'od dang dge ba bsdus so //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams kyis ni 'od dang dge ba bsdus so //
translated: The realm of form includes light and virtue.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyis ni gzugs med pa bzhi bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyis ni gzugs med pa bzhi bsdus so //
translated: The formless realm includes the four formless states.

original: 'gog pas ni 'gog pa nyid bsdus so //
analyzed: 'gog pas ni 'gog pa nyid bsdus so //
translated: The cessation realm includes the state of cessation itself.

original: de la gzugs kyi 'dod chags ni mthong ba dang myong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams thams cad du 'od dang dge ba'i khams rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi 'dod chags ni mthong ba dang myong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams thams cad du 'od dang dge ba'i khams rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
translated: The form realm is established as the realm of form because attachment to form is distinguished by seeing and experiencing.

original: khams bdun po 'di rnams kyi yongs su shes pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams bdun po 'di rnams kyi yongs su shes pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The complete knowledge of these seven realms should be understood.

original: thob par bya ba'i thabs kyang rig par bya'o //üîΩthob pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i thabs kyang rig par bya'o // thob pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The means of attaining them should be understood.üîΩThe attainment should be understood.

original: gang gi phyir thob pa de yang rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob pa de yang rig par bya'o ;
translated: And the reason for the attainment should be understood.

original: / de la khams de rnams ni rgyu bzhi las yongs su shes te /
analyzed: / de la khams de rnams ni rgyu bzhi las yongs su shes te /
translated: The complete knowledge of these realms is due to four causes:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas dgra zla yod pa dang / chung ngu dang / tshad med pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas dgra zla yod pa dang / chung ngu dang / tshad med pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the existence of enemies and friends through the antidotes to the adverse elements, because of the small and the immeasurable, because of existence and nonexistence, and because of the presence and absence of higher levels.

original: de la mun pa la brten nas 'od yod do //
analyzed: de la mun pa la brten nas 'od yod do //
translated: Light exists in dependence on darkness,

original: mi dge ba la brten nas dge ba dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa la brten nas nam mkha' yod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba la brten nas dge ba dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa la brten nas nam mkha' yod de /
translated: virtue in dependence on evil, space in dependence on form,üîΩand so on.

original: 'di dag ni dgra zla dang bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dgra zla dang bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas 'dogs te /
translated: These are established in relation to their opposites, which are their enemies.

original: de la ltos nas de dag tu blo 'jug par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas de dag tu blo 'jug par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind engages them in relation to those.

original: @290a * // rnam shes mtha' yas ni mtha'i rnam pa chung ngu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas yod do //
analyzed: @290a * // rnam shes mtha' yas ni mtha'i rnam pa chung ngu la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas yod do //
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness exists in dependence on the small aspect of the limit of consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa ni dngos po med pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang med pa ni dngos po med pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The sphere of nothingness exists because of the mere absence of entities.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni srid pa bla na med pa /üîΩsrid pa thams cad kyi rtse mo la brten nas yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni srid pa bla na med pa / srid pa thams cad kyi rtse mo la brten nas yod do //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor nonperception exists in dependence on the highest existence,üîΩthe peak of existence.

original: 'gog pa'i khams ni 'jig tshogs dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa la brten nas yod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams ni 'jig tshogs dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa la brten nas yod do //
translated: The element of cessation exists in dependence on the abandonment of all afflictions associated with the view of the transitory collection.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni srid pa'i nang na bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni srid pa'i nang na bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The summit of existence is the highest of all existences.

original: 'gog pa'i chos thams cad ni nang na bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos thams cad ni nang na bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of all conditioned things is the highest of all conditioned things.

original: 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is called the meditative attainment of the peak of existence.

original: de la khams lnga ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la khams lnga ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The five elements are to be attained by the meditative attainment of the peak of existence, up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du byed kyi snyoms par 'jug pas thob par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi snyoms par 'jug pas thob par bya ba yin te /
translated: They are to be attained by the meditative attainment of the peak of existence, which is a conditioned meditative attainment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'od kyi mtshan ma bzung nas 'od dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'od kyi mtshan ma bzung nas 'od dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //

translated: The sphere of cessation is to be attained by the meditative attainment of the sphere of nothingness, because one enters it through the attention of signlessness, which does not attend to any signs and attends to the sphere of nothingness.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni thob par bya ba yin no //
