analyzed: gal te bslab pa blangs pas dang du blangs na ni de'i lus 'dam bu skam po'i khyim lta bu de la de na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams lta bu'i dge ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag de'i log pa'i 'du shes kyi me btang la gang zag des
translated: If one accepts the precepts, then the wholesome dharmas that are like living beings in that person‚Äôs body, which is like a house of dry reeds, will be burned by the fire of his wrong views.

original: kyang gsad par mi nus pas na /
analyzed: kyang gsad par mi nus pas na /
translated: And since that person is unable to kill them,

original: dge ba'i chos srog chags lta bur 'dug pa de dag tshig par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos srog chags lta bur 'dug pa de dag tshig par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the wholesome dharmas, which are like living beings, will be burned.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dang du mi len pa'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dang du mi len pa'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the benefit of not accepting, and it should be understood that the wholesome dharmas will not deteriorate.

original: de las bzlog pa ni nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i 'du shes yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i 'du shes yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is the perception of renunciation, non-ill will, and non-violence.

original: ci rig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci rig par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is known.

original: de la thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni nag po'i phyogs dang du len par mi 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs dang du len par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni nag po'i phyogs dang du len par mi 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs dang du len par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation does not accept the dark side and does accept the bright side.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum med pa ni nag po'i phyogs dang du len par 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs dang du len par mi 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum med pa ni nag po'i phyogs dang du len par 'gyur ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs dang du len par mi 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the absence of the three kinds of wisdom does accept the dark side and does not accept the bright side.

original: 'di gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin te /
translated: These two are the marvelous and wonderful dharmas of the Tathagatas.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩchos thams cad bdag med par yang ston la sems can rnams kyi rang gis byas pa @294a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos thams cad bdag med par yang ston la sems can rnams kyi rang gis byas pa @294a * //
translated: What are the two?

original: dang ; gzhan gyis byas pa yang chud mi gzon pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; gzhan gyis byas pa yang chud mi gzon pa'o //
translated: They are: teaching that all dharmas are without self, and not wasting the karma of sentient beings whether it is self-made or made by others.

original: de la sems can ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems can ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, sentient beings are, in brief, of two kinds:

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: lay and monastic.

original: de la sems can khyim pa dag gi longs spyod rnams kyi don du thog ma sbyor ba'i phyir ni brtson pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems can khyim pa dag gi longs spyod rnams kyi don du thog ma sbyor ba'i phyir ni brtson pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The element of striving is so called because it is the first application to the enjoyment of the enjoyments of the householders.

original: de la ma thob pa'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi gags lta bu'i rgyu yod du zin kyang sems kyi mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid kyi mthu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma thob pa'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi gags lta bu'i rgyu yod du zin kyang sems kyi mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid kyi mthu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The element of power is the mental enthusiasm which exists even when there are causes for the obstacles of striving, such as the non-attainment of the enjoyments.

original: thob tu zin kyang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu chu rings la sogs pa'i gnod pa brtson 'grus kyi gags lta bus phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa 'di ni dga' ba'i khams te /
analyzed: thob tu zin kyang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu chu rings la sogs pa'i gnod pa brtson 'grus kyi gags lta bus phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa 'di ni dga' ba'i khams te /
translated: The element of joy is the non-retrogression even when there are obstacles to striving, such as the harm of flies, mosquitoes, etc.

original: khams de dag ni rang gi yul nas yul gzhan du mi 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: khams de dag ni rang gi yul nas yul gzhan du mi 'gro ba yin no //
translated: These elements do not go from one's own realm to another realm.

original: 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i khams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i khams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The element of renunciation should be known as the going.

original: sems can de dag nyid gnyis ka la rtag tu gus par sbyor bar sbyor ba mi ldog pa'i rtul phod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sems can de dag nyid gnyis ka la rtag tu gus par sbyor bar sbyor ba mi ldog pa'i rtul phod pa'i khams so //
translated: The element of heroism is the application to the devotion to both of those sentient beings without retrogression.

original: de la rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi rab tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nges par 'dun pa bskyed pa ni brtson pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi rab tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nges par 'dun pa bskyed pa ni brtson pa'i khams so //
translated: The element of striving is the generation of the will for the sake of going forth for those who desire to go forth.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs las brtsams te dge ba'i chos rgya chen po thob par bya ba la spa bkong bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ni mthu'i khams so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs las brtsams te dge ba'i chos rgya chen po thob par bya ba la spa bkong bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ni mthu'i khams so //
translated: The element of power is the absence of timidity in the acquisition of the extensive virtuous qualities beginning with the going forth.

original: gnod byed kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa las byung ba rnams dang / khams 'khrugs pa las byung ba la sogs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni dga' ba'i khams so //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa las byung ba rnams dang / khams 'khrugs pa las byung ba la sogs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni dga' ba'i khams so //
translated: The element of delight is the absence of harm from the various kinds of suffering of those who are hostile, from the fatigue of striving, from the disturbance of the elements, etc.

original: ngan ngon gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ni nges par 'byung ba'i khams so //
analyzed: ngan ngon gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ni nges par 'byung ba'i khams so //
translated: The element of renunciation is the absence of satisfaction with meager virtues.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir ni rtul phod pa'i khams te /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir ni rtul phod pa'i khams te /
translated: The element of heroism is the absence of timidity in the face of the long duration, the many kinds of hardships, and the futility of the practices.

original: de dag thams cad kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: All of these are included in the three trainings:

original: bdag gi khams dang rnam pa ji snyed pa'i khams tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi khams dang rnam pa ji snyed pa'i khams tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: The elements should be understood as being just the same as the self‚Äôs elements and modes.

original: 'di gnyis ni khams rnams kyi khams tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni khams rnams kyi khams tha dad pa yin te /
translated: These two are the distinctions of the elements.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gzhan gyi rigs kyis tha dad pa dang / rang gi rigs kyis tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs kyis tha dad pa dang / rang gi rigs kyis tha dad pa'o //
translated: The distinction of different types and the distinction of the same type.

original: de la gzhan gyi rigs kyis tha dad pa ni mig gi khams kyang gzhan kho na yon la gzugs kyi khams kyang gzhan mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang gzhan yin pa dang / de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi rigs kyis tha dad pa ni mig gi khams kyang gzhan kho na yon la gzugs kyi khams kyang gzhan mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang gzhan yin pa dang / de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The distinction of different types is that the eye element is one thing, the form element is another, and the eye consciousness element is still another, and so on up to the mind consciousness element.

original: @294b de la rang gi rigs kyis tha dad pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i khams de nyid la brten nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum char yang skye ba'o //
analyzed: @294b de la rang gi rigs kyis tha dad pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i khams de nyid la brten nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum char yang skye ba'o //
translated: The distinction of the same type is that the three kinds of feeling, pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant, arise in dependence on the same element of feeling.

original: khams kyi sum phrugs gsum dang nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams gnyis ni rgyu bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khams kyi sum phrugs gsum dang nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams gnyis ni rgyu bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three-fold realm of sense-desire, the three-fold realm of form, and the two-fold realm of the formless are established by four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: phyi rol gyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang / nang gi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang / gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang /üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang / nang gi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang / gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: The external realm of sense-desire, the external realm of form, and the internal realm of the formless; the external realm of the formless, the internal realm of the formless, and the realm of the abandonment of all attachments.

original: de la phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i 'dod chags la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i 'dod chags la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The realm of sense-desire is established on the basis of attachment to the five external sense-qualities of sense-desire.

original: de la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po'o //üîΩrtog pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni bsam gtan gong ma rnams so //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po'o //üîΩrtog pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni bsam gtan gong ma rnams so //
translated: The first meditation of the realm of form is the external realm of form, because it is the abandonment of the external realm of sense-desire.üîΩThe higher meditations are the internal realm of the formless, because they are the abandonment of the external realm of form and the internal realm of the formless, because they are the abandonment of the internal realm of the formless.

original: gzugs dang thogs pa dang tha dad pa'i 'du shes las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang thogs pa dang tha dad pa'i 'du shes las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The formless realm is the realm of the sphere of infinite space, which is the transcendence of the perception of form and the perception of obstruction and the perception of variety.

original: nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni de'i gong ma'i gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni de'i gong ma'i gzugs med pa rnams so //
translated: The formless realm is the transcendence of the perception of infinite space, the perception of infinite consciousness, and the perception of nothingness.

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi skye mched las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni khams gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi skye mched las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni khams gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three realms should be understood as the transcendence of the external sense-spheres.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni nang gi skye mched drug tshang bar yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni nang gi skye mched drug tshang bar yod do //
translated: In the realm of form, the six internal sense-spheres are complete.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs can lnga las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs can lnga las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In the formless realm, one transcends the five with form.

original: yid kyi skye mched lus so //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched lus so //
translated: The mental sense-sphere is the body.

original: 'gog pa'i khams ni drug po thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams ni drug po thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In the realm of cessation, one transcends all six.

original: de ltar na nang gi skye mched rnams las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum po gzhan rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi skye mched rnams las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum po gzhan rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o ;
translated: Thus, the other three realms should be understood as being established as not being a definite emergence from the internal sense spheres and as being a definite emergence from the internal sense spheres.

original: /'dod pa'i rnams las ni gzugs rnams gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i rnams las ni gzugs rnams gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Form is not a definite emergence from the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin du gzugs rnams las gtan tu nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin du gzugs rnams las gtan tu nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the formless realm is not a definite emergence from the form realm.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa ci yang rung ba de las gtan du nges par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa ci yang rung ba de las gtan du nges par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation is a definite emergence from any conditioned state.

original: @295a * // de ltar na gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @295a * // de ltar na gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three realms should be understood as being established as not being a definite emergence and as being a definite emergence.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ched pa yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams lnga dang drug rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ched pa yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i khams lnga dang drug rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five or six elements that are a definite emergence should be understood as being established from the perspective of the complete understanding of the pride of self.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the arising of the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: dge slong nang du yang dag 'jog la dga' zhing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong nang du yang dag 'jog la dga' zhing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: A monk who delights in inner seclusion and is diligent in cultivating serenity and insight will, in brief, liberate his mind in five ways.üîΩHe will liberate his mind from the branch afflictions that are congruent with serenity by means of insight that is supported by a mind that has fully cultivated serenity.

original: zhi gnas yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / lhag mthong yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis zhi gnas la brten nas /
analyzed: zhi gnas yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / lhag mthong yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis zhi gnas la brten nas /
translated: He will liberate his mind from the branch afflictions that are congruent with insight by means of serenity that is supported by a mind that has fully cultivated insight.

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / de gnyis ka phrugs su ldan pa'i sems nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / de gnyis ka phrugs su ldan pa'i sems nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The mind is liberated from the branch afflictions that are in accord with insight.üîΩThe mind is liberated from all the formations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, since the mind is free from the branch afflictions that are in accord with both.üîΩThe mind is liberated from all the formations that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the realm of nirvana that has the remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / phung po'i lhag ma med par phung po'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / phung po'i lhag ma med par phung po'i 'du byed thams cad las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mind is liberated from all the formations of the aggregates in the realm of nirvana that lacks the remainder of the aggregates.

original: 'di gnyis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi chos yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi chos yin te /
translated: These two are the marvelous qualities of the teacher and the disciples in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: lta ba dang tshig tu brjod pa mtshungs pa dang / lta ba dang / tshig tu brjod pa mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang tshig tu brjod pa mtshungs pa dang / lta ba dang / tshig tu brjod pa mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: 1) The view and the expression in words are the same; 2) the view and the expression in words are the most excellent.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang 'di las phyi rol ba rnams la ni med de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang 'di las phyi rol ba rnams la ni med de /
translated: These two are not found among the outsiders.

original: tha dad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different and outside of nirvana.

original: 'di gnyis ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni byis pa rnams kyi byis pa'i rtags yin te /
translated: These two are the signs of a fool for fools:

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa dang / gnas bzhi la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa dang / gnas bzhi la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: 1) they are engaged in harming themselves and others; 2) they are unskilled in the four stations.

original: de la gnod ba sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnod ba sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the accomplishment of harm should be understood as fourfold.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: pha rol gyi bye brag dang / @295b nang gi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / rgyud kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi bye brag dang / @295b nang gi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / rgyud kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they generate four kinds of suffering through the particularities of others, the particularities of themselves, the particularities of time, and the particularities of their own mental continuum.

original: de la mi ma yin pas byas pa'i yams kyi nad gang yin pa rnams dang / mis byas pa'i gnod pa byung ba gang yin pa rnams dang de gnyis 'byung du dogs pa las byung ba da dung ma byung ba rnams kyis 'jigs pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la mi ma yin pas byas pa'i yams kyi nad gang yin pa rnams dang / mis byas pa'i gnod pa byung ba gang yin pa rnams dang de gnyis 'byung du dogs pa las byung ba da dung ma byung ba rnams kyis 'jigs pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering that arises from others is the fear of the epidemics caused by non-human beings, the fear of the harm caused by human beings, and the fear of the epidemics and harm caused by both of these.

original: de la bdag nyid kyi khams 'khrugs pa'i nad kyi rgyu las gyur pa'i nad gang yin pa dang / sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can yin pa de ni 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyi khams 'khrugs pa'i nad kyi rgyu las gyur pa'i nad gang yin pa dang / sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can yin pa de ni 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: The suffering that arises from the disturbance of the elements is the illness that arises from the cause of the disturbance of the elements in one‚Äôs own body, and the mental disturbance that arises from the change of a loved one or from the suffering of poverty.

original: nang gi rkyen gyis byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: nang gi rkyen gyis byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: This is the suffering that arises from internal conditions.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du 'byung du dogs pa las byung ba yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du 'byung du dogs pa las byung ba yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this also arises from the fear of the occurrence of these things in the future.üîΩThe suffering that arises from the disturbance of the elements is the illness that arises from the cause of the disturbance of the elements in one‚Äôs own body, and the mental disturbance that arises from the change of a loved one or from the suffering of poverty.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the suffering that arises from internal conditions.üîΩIt should be understood that this also arises from the fear of the occurrence of these things in the future.

original: da ltar ji lta ba bzhin du de 'das pa'i dus na yang rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur la /
analyzed: da ltar ji lta ba bzhin du de 'das pa'i dus na yang rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur la /
translated: Just as he is now, so he was in the past, suffering with the suffering of all kinds.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang de ltar 'gyur ba 'di ni dus kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang de ltar 'gyur ba 'di ni dus kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: And so he will be in the future. This is suffering in terms of the particularities of time.

original: de log par sgrub pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal bar byed la /üîΩgzhan dag kyang sdug bsngal par byed de de nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa yang /
analyzed: de log par sgrub pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal bar byed la / gzhan dag kyang sdug bsngal par byed de de nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa yang /
translated: He makes himself suffer through the cause of wrong practice.üîΩAnd he makes others suffer through the cause of wrong practice.

original: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyud kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyud kyi bye brag gis sdug bsngal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And he makes himself suffer through the cause of right practice. This is suffering in terms of the particularities of the continuum.

original: de la snga ma rnam pa gsum gyis ni bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la snga ma rnam pa gsum gyis ni bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In the first three of these, he engages in harming himself.

original: tha ma gcig gis ni gzhan dag la yang byed do //
analyzed: tha ma gcig gis ni gzhan dag la yang byed do //
translated: In the last one, he engages in harming others.

original: gnas bzhi po gang dag la mi mkhas she na /
analyzed: gnas bzhi po gang dag la mi mkhas she na /
translated: In what four things is he unskilled?

original: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la'o //
translated: the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, and the possible and impossible.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mkhas pa'i rtags gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mkhas pa'i rtags gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these should be understood as the two signs of the wise.

original: de la gzugs can ma yin pa'i yid kyi skye mched kyi rten dang dmigs pa dang rang gi rigs kyi 'jug pa'i bye brag gis ni khams bco brgyad rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs can ma yin pa'i yid kyi skye mched kyi rten dang dmigs pa dang rang gi rigs kyi 'jug pa'i bye brag gis ni khams bco brgyad rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the eighteen elements should be understood as being established by the support of the mental faculty, which is not form, and by the distinctions of its objects and the distinctions of its engagement in its own class.

original: gzugs can gyi skye mched lnga'i gnas dang / byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni khams drug rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi skye mched lnga'i gnas dang / byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni khams drug rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The six elements should be understood as being established by the method of support of the five sense bases that are form, and by the support of the agent and the instrument.

original: gnas kyi rten gyi tshul @296a * //
analyzed: gnas kyi rten gyi tshul @296a * //
translated: By the method of support of the basis,

original: gyis ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gyis ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: there are the four such as earth.

original: byed pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: byed pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: By the method of support of the agent, there is the element of space.

original: byed du 'jug pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa'i rten gyi tshul gyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: By the method of support of the instrument, there is the element of consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa'i rten gyi don gyis ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams gnyen po dang bcas pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa'i rten gyi don gyis ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams gnyen po dang bcas pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The six elements of desire, malice, violence, and their antidotes are established in the sense of being the basis of the discriminations and concepts that are favorable to the side of affliction and purification.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'i rten gyi don gyis ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / ma rig pa'i khams gzhan drug rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'i rten gyi don gyis ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / ma rig pa'i khams gzhan drug rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The six other elements of pleasure, suffering, joy, sorrow, contentedness, and ignorance are established in the sense of being the basis of the bonds of attachment, hostility, and confusion.

original: de dag kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las ni log pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa 'byung la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las ni yang dag pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las ni log pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa 'byung la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las ni yang dag pa'i 'du shes dang rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, false discriminations and concepts arise from incorrect mental attention, and correct discriminations and concepts arise from correct mental attention.

original: khams gsum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la kun du 'gro ba'i don gyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa ming du gtogs pa'i khams bzhi rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la kun du 'gro ba'i don gyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa ming du gtogs pa'i khams bzhi rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The four name-bases, such as feeling, are established as the realms that are omnipresent in the aspects of defilement and purification of the three realms,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la rnam par dag na rnam par dag par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag nyid kyi rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la rnam par dag na rnam par dag par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag nyid kyi rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the very ones that are defiled when there is defilement and are purified when there is purification, and because they are governed by impurity and purity.

original: snga ma bzhin du phyi rol gyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyi rol gyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: As before, the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness are established as the external realms that are not and are emancipation, respectively.

original: nang gi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis kyang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang / 'gog pa'i khams gzhan gsum rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nang gi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis kyang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang / 'gog pa'i khams gzhan gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The other three realms are established by the meaning of renunciation and non-renunciation, and by the meaning of renunciation.

original: phyi rol dang nang gi gzhi'i nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi gzhi'i nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of that very external and internal basis of renunciation and non-renunciation,

original: dam pa'i chos dang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i gnas kyi gtam gyi gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi don gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig @296b par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i gnas kyi gtam gyi gzhi rnam pa gsum gyi don gyis ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig @296b par bya'o //
translated: the three realms of the past, future, and present should be understood as established by the meaning of the three bases of discourse: hearing the holy Dharma and the unholy Dharma, and proper and improper mental activity.

original: sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa mang po dang 'bring dang nyung ngu yongs su shes pa'i don gyis ni ngan pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa mang po dang 'bring dang nyung ngu yongs su shes pa'i don gyis ni ngan pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The three realms of inferior, middling, and superior are established in the sense of completely understanding many, middling, and few sufferings and afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal chen po dang nyon mongs pa chen po'i khams gang yin pa de ni ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po dang nyon mongs pa chen po'i khams gang yin pa de ni ngan pa yin no //
translated: That realm of great suffering and great afflictions is inferior.

original: sdug bsngal 'bring dang nyon mongs pa 'bring ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bring dang nyon mongs pa 'bring ni 'bring yin no //
translated: Middling suffering and middling afflictions are middling.

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni gya nom pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni gya nom pa yin no //
translated: Little suffering and little afflictions are superior.

original: ngan pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i khams yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: ngan pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i khams yongs su shes nas /
translated: Having completely understood the inferior, middling, and superior realms,

original: de'i rgyu yongs su spong ba'i don dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i don gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yongs su spong ba'i don dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i don gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: the three realms of virtue, non-virtue, and indeterminate should be understood as established in the sense of abandoning their causes and cultivating their antidotes.

original: dge ba bsgom pa des rnam par dag pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dge ba bsgom pa des rnam par dag pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin /
translated: The cultivation of virtue is threefold:üîΩthe training, the nontraining and neither training nor nontraining.

original: mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: By means of the different kinds of purity of that cultivation of the wholesome, the three realms should be understood as being established as the realm of the trainee, the realm of the non-trainee, and the realm that is neither the one nor the other.

original: ril gyis ma bcings pa'i don dang 'ching ba med pa'i don dang / ril gyis bcings pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ril gyis ma bcings pa'i don dang 'ching ba med pa'i don dang / ril gyis bcings pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the meaning of not being bound in its entirety, the meaning of being unbound, and the meaning of being bound in its entirety.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag gi 'bras bu byis pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i don gyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang ; zag pa med pa'i khams gnyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag gi 'bras bu byis pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i don gyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang ; zag pa med pa'i khams gnyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: And by means of the meaning of possessing the dharmas that are mundane and supramundane, which are the results of those trainees and non-trainees, the common and uncommon results for the childish, the two realms of the contaminated and the uncontaminated should be understood as being established.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa de gnyis kyi rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i phyir ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i khams gnyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa de gnyis kyi rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i phyir ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i khams gnyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The two realms of the conditioned and the unconditioned are respectively established as permanent and impermanent, as surpassing and not surpassing, in relation to the mundane and supramundane.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nye bar 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pas na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nye bar 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pas na /
translated: The practice of pure conduct leads to nirvana and culminates in nirvana.

original: de'i phyir de yan chad du na khams rnam par gzhag pa med do //üîΩskye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yan chad du na khams rnam par gzhag pa med do // skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, there is no realm beyond that.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The expertise in the sense bases, dependent origination, and what is and is not possible is as found in the Sravaka Levels.

analyzed: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni mdor bsdu na 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba dang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam las brtsams te /

analyzed: lam de dag thams cad bsdus na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te / ngan pa ni ngan 'gror @297a * //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam gyi mchog la zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa de nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa mchog thob par 'gyur ba yin te /
