analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: The summary verses:üîΩNature, cause, view,üîΩaffliction, person,

original: sdom ni / rang bzhin rgyu dang lta ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs gang zag grol //
analyzed: sdom ni / rang bzhin rgyu dang lta ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs gang zag grol //
translated: liberation,üîΩdistinction, reason,

original: 'jug pa'i bye brag rigs pa dang // zhi dang rtag pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bye brag rigs pa dang // zhi dang rtag pa tha ma yin //
translated: peace, and permanence are the last.

original: tshor ba rnams kyi rang bzhin yang rig par bya //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi rang bzhin yang rig par bya //
translated: The nature of the feelings should be understood.

original: rgyu yang rig par bya /üîΩtshor ba rnams la yang dag par lta ba yang rig par bya /
analyzed: rgyu yang rig par bya / tshor ba rnams la yang dag par lta ba yang rig par bya /
translated: The cause of the feelings should be understood.üîΩThe correct view regarding the feelings should be understood.

original: tshor ba rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The affliction of the feelings should be understood.

original: tshor ba myong ba'i gang zag so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyi khyad par yang rig par bya /
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba'i gang zag so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyi khyad par yang rig par bya /
translated: One should understand the difference between the two kinds of feelings, those that are experienced by the individual and those that are not experienced by the individual.

original: de bzhin @297b du rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i khyad par yang rig par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin @297b du rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i khyad par yang rig par bya /
translated: One should understand the difference between the unliberated and the liberated.

original: tshor ba rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag kyang rig par bya /
translated: One should understand the various aspects of the engagement of feelings.

original: tshor ba gang ci tshor yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang rig par bya /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci tshor yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang rig par bya /
translated: One should understand the reasoning that whatever feelings are felt, all are suffering.

original: tshor ba rnams rnam par zhi ba shin tu sbyangs par yang rig par bya /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams rnam par zhi ba shin tu sbyangs par yang rig par bya /
translated: One should understand the complete pacification of feelings as serenity.

original: tshor ba'i rnam pa thams cad la tshor ba brtag par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rnam pa thams cad la tshor ba brtag par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the investigation of feelings with regard to all aspects of feelings.

original: de la mdor bsdu na tshor ba gsum ni tshor ba rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na tshor ba gsum ni tshor ba rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: In brief, the nature of feelings is threefold.

original: rig pa rnam pa gsum ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rig pa rnam pa gsum ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is threefold.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang ; 'dod chags kyi gnas yin pa dang / 'dod chags ni phyi ma'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal ba yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba mngon sum du gyur ba ni zug rngu ma phyin pa dang 'dra bar gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba ni zug rngu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang ; 'dod chags kyi gnas yin pa dang / 'dod chags ni phyi ma'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal ba yin par blta bar bya'o // sdug bsngal ba mngon sum du gyur ba ni zug rngu ma phyin pa dang 'dra bar gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba ni zug rngu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because pleasant feeling is subject to change, is the basis of attachment, and attachment is the cause of future suffering, pleasant feeling should be regarded as suffering.üîΩBecause manifest suffering has the nature of injury, like a dart, suffering should be regarded as a dart.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba med par gyur ba gang yin pa ni de mi rtag pa yin pa dang / mngon sum du gyur ba yang 'gag pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga 'ang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang mthun pas na sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba med par gyur ba gang yin pa ni de mi rtag pa yin pa dang / mngon sum du gyur ba yang 'gag pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga 'ang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang mthun pas na sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa dang /
translated: Because neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is impermanent and is subject to cessation, since it is manifest, and because it is compatible with the connection of both, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling should be regarded as suffering because it is impermanent and because it is subject to change.

original: 'gag pa'i chos nyid du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos nyid du blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should view the cessation of feeling as the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni tshor ba rnams la yang dag par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba rnams la yang dag par lta ba yin te /
translated: This is the correct view of feelings,

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the entry into the statement: Whatever the feelings are here, they are suffering.

original: bde ba las ni 'dod chags /
analyzed: bde ba las ni 'dod chags /
translated: From pleasure, craving grows;

original: sdug bsngal ba las ni zhe sdang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa las ni ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba las ni zhe sdang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa las ni ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: from pain, aversion; from neither pleasure nor pain, ignorance.

original: 'di ni tshor ba rnams las kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba rnams las kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is the defilement of feelings.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la gnas pa'i ni thams cad ma spangs pas bag la nyal rgyal bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la gnas pa'i ni thams cad ma spangs pas bag la nyal rgyal bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: When one is in a state of pleasure, etc., all the latent tendencies are activated, since all have not been abandoned.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa rang rang gi spyod yul des kun nas dkris pa skyes pa de dag de'i rjes la rgyud de nyid la nyon mongs pa dang 'brel ba gnyid log pa bzhin 'dug pas na bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa rang rang gi spyod yul des kun nas dkris pa skyes pa de dag de'i rjes la rgyud de nyid la nyon mongs pa dang 'brel ba gnyid log pa bzhin 'dug pas na bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: However, when the fetters that arise in relation to the specific objects of those latent tendencies have been eliminated, the latent tendencies remain in the mental continuum as if asleep, associated with the afflictions. Therefore, they are called latent tendencies.

original: de la 'dir tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa ni bag la nyal gzhom pa'i phyir yin gyi /üîΩkun nas dkris pa bsal ba @298a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa ni bag la nyal gzhom pa'i phyir yin gyi / kun nas dkris pa bsal ba @298a * //
translated: Here, the practice of pure conduct is for the purpose of destroying the latent impressions.

original: tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the purpose of removing the entanglements.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba myong ba na shin tu sems ngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba myong ba na shin tu sems ngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The person who is not endowed with the power of discernment, when experiencing painful feelings, becomes extremely exhausted in mind.

original: de ni lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal mngon sum du gyur ba de yang myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal mngon sum du gyur ba de yang myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: He experiences that suffering in actuality, both physically and mentally.

original: de ma yin ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa rnams kyang ma spangs pas ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma yin ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa rnams kyang ma spangs pas ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: He is endowed with the other feelings, pleasant and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, because he has not abandoned them.

original: de bas na tshangs par gnas pa'i tshor ba ni sa'i 'og ces bya ste gting yang mi slebs so //
analyzed: de bas na tshangs par gnas pa'i tshor ba ni sa'i 'og ces bya ste gting yang mi slebs so //
translated: Therefore, the feeling of one who is not abiding in purity is said to be like the bottom of the ocean, which is not reached.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The person who is endowed with the power of discernment should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: tshor ba rnams las sems rnam par ma grol ba ni zug rngu gnyis kyis phog pa'i mis zug rngu gnyis myong ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba tshang bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams las sems rnam par ma grol ba ni zug rngu gnyis kyis phog pa'i mis zug rngu gnyis myong ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba tshang bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that is not liberated from the feelings experiences the three feelings in their entirety, like a person struck by two pains.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kyis sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas ni tshor ba gsum myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kyis sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pas ni tshor ba gsum myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that is defiled by attachment, hatred, and delusion experiences the three feelings.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yang myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yang myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: It also experiences the suffering of birth, and so on.

original: de ltar na de'i tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal chen po dang / tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas de gsum gyis nye bar nyon mongs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal chen po dang / tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas de gsum gyis nye bar nyon mongs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, at that time, he experiences the three kinds of suffering: the great suffering of this life, the defilement of this life, and the basis of suffering in the next life.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sems rnam par grol ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sems rnam par grol ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The mind that is liberated from these three should be understood as the opposite of the above.

original: tshor ba gsum myong ba de gnyis kyi khyad par ni de ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum myong ba de gnyis kyi khyad par ni de ma yin no //
translated: The difference between the two is that the latter does not experience the three feelings.

original: de la tshor ba lus las skyes pa zhig cing med par gyur la mi gnas pa dang / myur du 'gro zhing dus gzhan du 'dra ba'i rgyud kyis mi gnas pa gang yin pa de dag ni rlung gi tshub ma lta bu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba lus las skyes pa zhig cing med par gyur la mi gnas pa dang / myur du 'gro zhing dus gzhan du 'dra ba'i rgyud kyis mi gnas pa gang yin pa de dag ni rlung gi tshub ma lta bu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The feelings that arise from the body, that are transient, non-existent, non-abiding, quickly passing, and not abiding in a continuous series, should be seen as like a whirlwind.

original: 'dra ba'i rgyud kyis cung zad tsam gnas te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyud kyis cung zad tsam gnas te /
translated: Those that abide in a continuous series for a short time,

original: de'i mod la mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ni sdong bu sar glo bur ba'i rigs 'ongs pa lta bur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ni sdong bu sar glo bur ba'i rigs 'ongs pa lta bur bar bya'o //
translated: and do not change immediately, should be seen as like a tree that has suddenly sprouted from the ground.

original: de la de dag gi rnam pa'i bye brag ni rang bzhin dang / rten dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs tha dad pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la de dag gi rnam pa'i bye brag ni rang bzhin dang / rten dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs tha dad pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The differences in their modes should be understood from the differences in their natures, their bases, their defilement, and their purification.

original: de la zang zing dang bcas pa'i tshor ba ni 'jig rten pa'i thams cad do //
analyzed: de la zang zing dang bcas pa'i tshor ba ni 'jig rten pa'i thams cad do //
translated: Among them, the worldly feelings are all those that are accompanied by material food.

original: zang zing med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The supramundane feelings are those that are not accompanied by material food.

original: 'chums pa la brten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po @298b rnams las nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'chums pa la brten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po @298b rnams las nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'o //
translated: That which is based on attachment is the defiled feeling that arises from the five sense pleasures.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa ba'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las 'byung ba'i dge ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa ba'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las 'byung ba'i dge ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is based on renunciation is the feeling that is associated with all the virtues that arise from meditative concentration, from renunciation, and from isolation.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid yin par skye bo thams cad kyi mngon sum du gyur bas bsgrub mi dgos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid yin par skye bo thams cad kyi mngon sum du gyur bas bsgrub mi dgos so //
translated: Since the experience of pain is suffering in and of itself, it does not need to be established by reasoning.

original: tshor ba gnyis ni rgyu gnyis kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gnyis ni rgyu gnyis kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par yid ches par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the other two feelings are suffering because of two causes.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The experience of neither pleasure nor pain and the formative forces that are associated with it are suffering because they are impermanent.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because pleasant feeling and the formative forces that are favorable to it are subject to change.

original: rigs pa 'dis ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By this reasoning, whatever feeling there is, that is to be known as suffering here.

original: mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /üîΩgong ma mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la brten pas /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste / gong ma mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la brten pas /
translated: In brief, the pacification of feeling should be known as threefold:üîΩthe pacification of the feeling of a lower stage by means of the feeling of a higher stage that is, of a meditative concentration;

original: sa 'og ma'i tshor ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / re zhig kun du mi spyod pas rnam par zhi ba dang phyi ma la gtan du mi 'jug pas rnam par zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i tshor ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / re zhig kun du mi spyod pas rnam par zhi ba dang phyi ma la gtan du mi 'jug pas rnam par zhi ba'o //
translated: the pacification of feeling by the non-experience of feeling for the time being and the pacification of feeling by the non-occurrence of feeling in the future.

original: de la re zhig kun du mi spyod pa ni rnam par zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig kun du mi spyod pa ni rnam par zhi ba'o //
translated: The pacification of feeling by the non-experience of feeling for the time being is the pacification of feeling.

original: gtan du kun du spyod pa'i chos nyid kyi rnam par zhi ba ni med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan du kun du spyod pa'i chos nyid kyi rnam par zhi ba ni med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The pacification of feeling by the non-occurrence of feeling in the future should be known as the non-existence of the essential nature of feeling that is to be experienced in the future.

original: smra ba la dga' zhing smra ba la zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa can 'dod cing gcig la gcig kun du smra ba la ni ngag ces bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba la dga' zhing smra ba la zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa can 'dod cing gcig la gcig kun du smra ba la ni ngag ces bya ste /
translated: The afflicted fondness for and engagement in speech is called ‚Äúspeech‚Äù because it is the mutual expression of one to another.

original: de ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na rnam par zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters the first meditative concentration, that speech is pacified.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa rags pa rnams kyis ni ngag kun nas slong bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa rags pa rnams kyis ni ngag kun nas slong bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, gross investigation and analysis instigate speech.

original: de dag gis ni ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa las langs pa'i ngag kun nas slong bar byed do //üîΩsnyoms par zhugs pa'i ni mi byed de /
analyzed: de dag gis ni ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa las langs pa'i ngag kun nas slong bar byed do // snyoms par zhugs pa'i ni mi byed de /
translated: They instigate the speech of one who has not attained meditative concentration and of one who has arisen from meditative concentration.üîΩThey do not instigate the speech of one who is absorbed in meditative concentration.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams ni cha phra bar 'jug pa yin pas ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams ni cha phra bar 'jug pa yin pas ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The investigation and analysis of one who is absorbed in meditative concentration are subtle and do not instigate speech.

original: de bas na de la gnas pa'i ngag ni rnam par zhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de la gnas pa'i ngag ni rnam par zhi zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the speech of one who is absorbed in meditative concentration is called ‚Äúpacified.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second explanation.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug @299a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug @299a * //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusionüîΩ

original: rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing rnal 'byor spyod pa la gnas pa na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang bral ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing rnal 'byor spyod pa la gnas pa na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang bral ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one sees the faults of desire, hatred, and ignorance, and abides in the practice of yoga, one experiences feelings free from desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams yongs su shes shing yongs su shes pa dang / spangs shing spangs nas de'i sems 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de las chags par gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par grol bar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams yongs su shes shing yongs su shes pa dang / spangs shing spangs nas de'i sems 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de las chags par gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par grol bar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When desire, hatred, and ignorance are fully understood, and when they are abandoned, one‚Äôs mind is said to be free from desire, hatred, and ignorance, and to be liberated.

original: tshor ba'i rnam pa thams cad la ni rnam pa bdun gyis tshor ba brtags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rnam pa thams cad la ni rnam pa bdun gyis tshor ba brtags par rig par bya ste /
translated: All feelings should be understood as feelings in seven ways.

original: rang bzhin dang / da ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / tshe phyi ma la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / da ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / tshe phyi ma la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang /
translated: the cause of its present engagement and disengagement, the cause of its engagement in the next life, the cause of its non-engagement in the next life, the cause of the engagement of the afflicted, and the cause of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i sgo nas ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i sgo nas ni brtag pa'o //
translated: The investigation of the cause of purification is the supreme view.

original: sdom ni / tshor ba skye dang 'gag pa dang // chung sogs bye brag lta ba'i mchog / tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang // rab tu dbye bas lan gdab pa //
analyzed: sdom ni / tshor ba skye dang 'gag pa dang // chung sogs bye brag lta ba'i mchog / tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang // rab tu dbye bas lan gdab pa //
translated: The summary: The arising and cessation of feeling, the supreme view of the distinctions of weak, etc., the classification of feeling, and the reply by way of classification.

original: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba spang bar bya ba thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rkyen gsum gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba spang bar bya ba thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rkyen gsum gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: All the feelings of all sentient beings arise through three conditions.

original: 'dun pa'i rkyen ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rkyen ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten to //
translated: The condition of desire is based on the future.

original: rtog pa'i rkyen ni 'das pa'i dus la brten to //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rkyen ni 'das pa'i dus la brten to //
translated: The condition of conception is based on the past.

original: reg pa'i rkyen ni yul mngon sum du gyur ba'i da ltar gyi dus la brten to //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen ni yul mngon sum du gyur ba'i da ltar gyi dus la brten to //
translated: The condition of contact is based on the present, the object that is directly perceived.

original: sems can thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What are all sentient beings?

original: mdor bsdu na sems can gyi ris brgyad de /üîΩkhyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sems can gyi ris brgyad de / khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang / 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang /
translated: In brief, there are eight types of sentient beings:

original: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / de yan chad nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'di las phyi rol ba 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa log par lta ba nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / de yan chad nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'di las phyi rol ba 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa log par lta ba nas /
translated: householders, those gone forth, those not free from desire, those free from desire, those not free from the desire realm, those free from the desire realm, those free from the desire of the first absorption and so on up to those free from the desire of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and those who are outsiders who are mundane beings.

original: log par rnam par grol ba'i shes pa can gyi bar rnams dang / chos 'di ba'i 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag pa'i lta ba nas yang dag pa'i rnam @299b par grol ba shes pa dang ldan pa'i bar rnams dang / chos 'di pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams te /
analyzed: log par rnam par grol ba'i shes pa can gyi bar rnams dang / chos 'di ba'i 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag pa'i lta ba nas yang dag pa'i rnam @299b par grol ba shes pa dang ldan pa'i bar rnams dang / chos 'di pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams te /
translated: and those who are in the world and who are in the Dharma, who are in supramundane meditative equipoise.

original: ris brgyad po 'di rnams kyis tshor ba yongs su shes pa nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas sems can gyi ris thams cad bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ris brgyad po 'di rnams kyis tshor ba yongs su shes pa nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas sems can gyi ris thams cad bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all sentient beings are included in these eight categories, through the experience of fully understanding feeling.

original: de la khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba ni rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba ni rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: There, the defiled feeling of householders and renunciates who are not free from desire for sense objects arises through three causes:

original: lhag par zhen pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs so //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs so //
translated: the power of attachment, the power of attention, and the power of objects.

original: de la khyim pa 'dod pa yongs su tshol zhing longs spyod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa ni lhag par zhen pa'i stobs dang / de nyid sngon myong ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / yul mngon sum du gyur ba na yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'i yul gyi stobs kyis gang zag de'i 'dun pa dang rtog pa dang reg pa rnams ni kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas rnam par ma zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de la khyim pa 'dod pa yongs su tshol zhing longs spyod pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa ni lhag par zhen pa'i stobs dang / de nyid sngon myong ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / yul mngon sum du gyur ba na yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'i yul gyi stobs kyis gang zag de'i 'dun pa dang rtog pa dang reg pa rnams ni kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas rnam par ma zhi ba yin no //
translated: The desire, reflection, and contact of that person are not calmed in terms of their practice.

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang de'i tshor ba rnams pa gsum skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang de'i tshor ba rnams pa gsum skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And due to that, the three kinds of feeling arise as a condition for that.

original: de thog mar nyon mongs pa can gyi bdun pa dang rtog pa dang reg pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir de'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thog mar nyon mongs pa can gyi bdun pa dang rtog pa dang reg pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir de'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: First, due to the practice of the defiled seven factors, reflection, and contact, the feeling that arises from that condition is experienced.

original: gal te skyes zin par dang du len te spong bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin par dang du len te spong bar mi byed cing /
translated: If that which has arisen is accepted and not abandoned,

original: sel bar mi byed na ni de ltar de'i tshor ba rgyun du gnas pa rgyud dang 'brel bas rnam par zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sel bar mi byed na ni de ltar de'i tshor ba rgyun du gnas pa rgyud dang 'brel bas rnam par zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not eliminate it, then in that way its feeling would remain continuous and connected to the stream of consciousness, and would not be pacified.

original: de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis rgyun du gnas pa'i tshor ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis rgyun du gnas pa'i tshor ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And due to the condition of its non-pacification, feeling would also be experienced as continuous.

original: de thog mar 'dun pa la sogs pa rgyun du gnas pa rnams kun du spyod pa'i phyir de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyud la yod pa rnams ma spangs pa'i phyir de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de thog mar 'dun pa la sogs pa rgyun du gnas pa rnams kun du spyod pa'i phyir de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyud la yod pa rnams ma spangs pa'i phyir de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
translated: Because of the initial engagement of those continuous intentions, etc., feeling would be experienced as a condition of that, and because the defilements that are in accord with that would not be abandoned, it would be a condition of its non-pacification. This is the second alternative.

original: de la rab tu byung ba 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa yongs su brtan ba'i phyir lhag par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rab tu byung ba 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa yongs su brtan ba'i phyir lhag par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, the intention of a non-detached ordained person, which is included in the power of attachment due to the stability of desire, is pacified.

original: yid la byed pa dang yul gyi stobs kyis bsdus pa'i rtog pa rnams dang / reg pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba @300a * //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang yul gyi stobs kyis bsdus pa'i rtog pa rnams dang / reg pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba @300a * //
translated: The thoughts that are included by the power of attention and the power of the object, and the contact that is not calmed,

original: yin te ; des na de gcig pur 'dug cing rtog pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma bsgoms pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du skyo bar yang ma byas pas sngon myong ba'i yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtog pa rnams kun du spyod do //
analyzed: yin te ; des na de gcig pur 'dug cing rtog pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma bsgoms pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du skyo bar yang ma byas pas sngon myong ba'i yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtog pa rnams kun du spyod do //
translated: because of that, he dwells alone and does not cultivate the antidotes to the thoughts, and because he does not become disgusted with them in every way, he engages in improper attention to objects that were previously experienced.

original: yul la rags ba mngon sum du gyur ba la yang reg pa kun du spyod par byed do //
analyzed: yul la rags ba mngon sum du gyur ba la yang reg pa kun du spyod par byed do //
translated: He also engages in contact with objects that are coarse and manifest.

original: rtog pa nyes par lta ba'i ni de'i gnyen po bsgoms la thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa rnams rnam par zhi bar gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa nyes par lta ba'i ni de'i gnyen po bsgoms la thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa rnams rnam par zhi bar gyur ba yin no //
translated: For one with bad views, the thoughts are calmed because he cultivates their antidotes, but he is not completely free from desire.

original: 'dun pa ni snga nas kyang rnam par zhi ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dun pa ni snga nas kyang rnam par zhi ba'o ;
translated: Desire was previously calmed.

original: / reg pa gcig pu ni yul rags pa mngon sum du gyur ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa skye ba'i phyir rnam par zhi ba ma yin no //
analyzed: / reg pa gcig pu ni yul rags pa mngon sum du gyur ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa skye ba'i phyir rnam par zhi ba ma yin no //
translated: Only contact is not pacified, because defiled contact arises in the case of the manifest presence of gross objects.

original: 'dod pa'i chags dang bral ba yin na ni thams cad kyang rnam par zhi bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chags dang bral ba yin na ni thams cad kyang rnam par zhi bar rig par bya ste /
translated: But if one is free from attachment, all are pacified.

original: 'di ni rnam grangs gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam grangs gcig go //
translated: This is one way of explaining the terms.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kha cig ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa ma spangs pa dang / rtog pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ma spangs pa'i phyir thams cad rnam par ma zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kha cig ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa ma spangs pa dang / rtog pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ma spangs pa'i phyir thams cad rnam par ma zhi ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, some who are not free from attachment to the sense-pleasures have not abandoned the craving for sense-pleasures and have not abandoned defiled contact with conceptual thoughts, so for them all are not pacified.

original: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa spangs nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi la rtog pa rnams ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa spangs nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi la rtog pa rnams ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: But for those who have abandoned the craving for sense-pleasures and have entered the first meditation, the craving is pacified, but the conceptual thoughts are not pacified.

original: bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi 'dod chags dang ni bral ba 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang ni ma bral ba ni gnyis ni rnam par zhi la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi 'dod chags dang ni bral ba 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang ni ma bral ba ni gnyis ni rnam par zhi la /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the first absorption and above, but not free from attachment to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, have two that are pacified.

original: reg pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o ;
analyzed: reg pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o ;
translated: Contact is not pacified.

original: / srid pa las yang dag par 'das pas ni thams cad rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //üîΩde la phyi rol pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa log par lta ba nas /
analyzed: / srid pa las yang dag par 'das pas ni thams cad rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te 'di ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o // de la phyi rol pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa log par lta ba nas /
translated: When one completely transcends existence, all are pacified. This is the second enumeration.üîΩAmong those, the feeling that arises due to that condition of those who are outsiders, worldly beings, who have wrong view,

original: log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i shes pa can gyi bar gang yin pa de dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i shes pa can gyi bar gang yin pa de dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: up to wrong liberation and knowledge,

original: de yang dang yang du len pa de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang 'brel ba rnams kyi ni de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dang yang du len pa de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang 'brel ba rnams kyi ni de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and that feeling which is related to the afflictions that are concordant with that which is repeatedly appropriated, arises due to the condition of that which is not pacified.

original: chos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par 'grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i rnam @300b bar grol ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa de'i rkyen dang du len cing /
analyzed: chos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par 'grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i rnam @300b bar grol ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa de'i rkyen dang du len cing /
translated: The condition of the worldly meditative attainment of this Dharma is the knowledge of complete liberation and perfect liberation.

original: de'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang 'brel ba rnams kyi ni de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang 'brel ba rnams kyi ni de rnam par ma zhi ba'i rkyen gyis tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The condition of the afflictions associated with that side is the arising of feeling due to the condition of their non-pacification.

original: chos 'di pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug par zhugs pa'i lam la gnas la don ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis ma thob pa dang / ma rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir nam zhig bdag gis gnas de thob par gyur zhing gu snyam pa'i 'dun pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar te /
analyzed: chos 'di pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug par zhugs pa'i lam la gnas la don ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis ma thob pa dang / ma rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir nam zhig bdag gis gnas de thob par gyur zhing gu snyam pa'i 'dun pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar te /
translated: The condition of the path of entry into the supramundane meditative attainment of this Dharma is the desire to actualize what has not been attained, realized, or manifested by those whose purpose is not yet complete, as before in detail.

original: de ni rnam par ma zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par ma zhi ba yin te /
translated: That is non-pacification.

original: de'i rkyen gyis de'i tshe tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis de'i tshe tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, feeling arises due to that condition.

original: don yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: don yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'dun pa ni rnam par zhi ba yin te /
translated: The complete meaning of intention is peace.

original: de'i rnam par zhi ba'i rkyen des na mchog tu rab tu zhi ba bla na med pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par zhi ba'i rkyen des na mchog tu rab tu zhi ba bla na med pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that condition of peace, the supreme, most excellent, unsurpassed feeling arises.

original: des tshor ba de dag thams cad nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa nges par 'byung ba'i thabs dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: des tshor ba de dag thams cad nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa nges par 'byung ba'i thabs dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows all those feelings as they really are, together with their escape and together with the means of escape.

original: de bas na snga ma bzhin du yang dag pa'i dge sbyong rnams kyi nang du dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram ze rnams kyi nang du bram zer 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na snga ma bzhin du yang dag pa'i dge sbyong rnams kyi nang du dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram ze rnams kyi nang du bram zer 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, as before, he is held as a true ascetic among true ascetics and as a brahmin among true brahmins.

original: rab tu mi shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu mi shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not know this are not held.

original: de la tshor ba thams cad ni spyir na reg pa'i rkyen can yin no //üîΩrkyen de'i rkyen ni 'dun pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la tshor ba thams cad ni spyir na reg pa'i rkyen can yin no // rkyen de'i rkyen ni 'dun pa yang yin no //
translated: In general, all feelings have contact as their condition.üîΩIntention is a condition for that condition.

original: rtog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa yang yin no //
translated: Imagination is a condition for that condition.

original: yul la rmongs pas bsdus pa'i ma rig pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yul la rmongs pas bsdus pa'i ma rig pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the ignorance that is the cause of the confusion about objects.

original: de dag thams cad kyi kun 'byung ba'i gnas ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi kun 'byung ba'i gnas ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: The cause of all of them is incorrect mental attention and the afflictions that are its associates.

original: de 'gags na yang de rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'gags na yang de rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is stopped, they are stopped.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i lam ni 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i lam ni 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of right view, etc., should be known as the path of cessation.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
translated: The noble disciple, having made manifest the joy of solitude with his body,

original: gnas pa ni chos lnga ni spong la /
analyzed: gnas pa ni chos lnga ni spong la /
translated: abandons five things,

original: chos lnga bsgom pa ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos lnga bsgom pa ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: and completes the cultivation of five things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are extensively taught in the Stages of Meditation.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams kyi tha ma dang / 'bring dang mchog ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan @301a * //üîΩbzhi po rnams la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams kyi tha ma dang / 'bring dang mchog ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan @301a * // bzhi po rnams la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The last, the medium, and the best of the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain are in the desire realm and the four absorptions, respectively.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms ni skyon thams cad dang bral ba dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i phyir zang zing med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms ni skyon thams cad dang bral ba dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i phyir zang zing med pa'o //
translated: The equanimity of the fourth absorption is free of all faults and is completely pure, so it is free of materiality.

original: de yan chad kyi btang snyoms de ni ches zang zing med pa yin par rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: de yan chad kyi btang snyoms de ni ches zang zing med pa yin par rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: The equanimity of the higher levels is posited as being even more free of materiality.

original: / tshor ba rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / tshor ba rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: The specific attributes of feelings should be understood in terms of ten topics:

original: yang dag pa'i bye brag dang / 'jug pa'i rten gyi bye brag dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dang / ji snyed yod pa'i bye brag dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i bye brag dang / 'jug pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bye brag dang / 'jug pa'i rten gyi bye brag dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dang / ji snyed yod pa'i bye brag dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i bye brag dang / 'jug pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
translated: their correct classification, the specific basis of their engagement, their specific characteristics, the specific number of their types, the specific attributes of their characteristics, the specific door of their engagement, the specific basis of their engagement, the specific basis of their purification, the specific basis of their abandonment, and the specific basis of their complete abandonment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / skad cig pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'jug pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / skad cig pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'jug pa'i bye brag go //
translated: the specific doors of the defilements, the specific counteractions to the adverse elements, the specific times, and the specific moments that are linked and engaged.

original: de la kha cig blo ma rdzogs pa'i phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la kha cig blo ma rdzogs pa'i phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some think that there are only two feelings because their minds are not complete.

original: tshor ba ni gnyis kho nar zad de /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gnyis kho nar zad de /
translated: They think that there are only two feelings:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'o // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: pleasant and unpleasant.üîΩThe feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasantüîΩis distinguished by the mere absence of pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bde dang sdug bsngal ba med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye bar zad pa'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba nye bar zhi ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bde dang sdug bsngal ba med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye bar zad pa'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba nye bar zhi ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One has designated it as the mere pacification of pleasure and pain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis btags pa yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis btags pa yin no snyam ste /
translated: In order to communicate this, the Blessed One said:

original: de la brda sprad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la brda sprad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba ni gnyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are two feelings,

original: 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / dben pa'i bde ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / dben pa'i bde ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The pleasure of the desire realm and the pleasure of seclusion.

original: dben pa'i bde ba de yang tha ma dang / 'bring dang / gong na med pa ste /
analyzed: dben pa'i bde ba de yang tha ma dang / 'bring dang / gong na med pa ste /
translated: The pleasure of seclusion is also said to be inferior, middling, and superior.

original: tha ma ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad do //
analyzed: tha ma ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad do //
translated: The inferior is up to the base of nothingness.

original: 'bring ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The middling is the peak of cyclic existence.

original: mchog ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: The superior is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: de ltar yin pas na zhi ba'i bde ba yang tsho ba yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yin pas na zhi ba'i bde ba yang tsho ba yin par gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the pleasure of peace is also said to be a feeling.

original: dper na / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa rnams kyi lta bu'o // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: For example, it is like the first, second, and third concentrations.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa yang tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa yang tshor ba yin te /
translated: There is also a feeling that is neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: dper na bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad /
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad /
translated: For example, it is like the fourth concentration and above

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi lta bu'o //
translated: and the peak of cyclic existence and below.

original: zhi ba'i tshor ba thams cad kyi thams cad du med par yang gsungs te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i tshor ba thams cad kyi thams cad du med par yang gsungs te /
translated: It is also said that all feelings of peace are completely absent.

original: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: yang dag par na bcom ldan @301b 'das kyis zhi ba'i bde ba ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par na bcom ldan @301b 'das kyis zhi ba'i bde ba ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
translated: In reality, the BhagavƒÅn has taught three kinds of happiness.

original: 'di la dge slong gi sems 'dod chags las 'dod chags med pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong gi sems 'dod chags las 'dod chags med pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, a bhik·π£u‚Äôs mind is free from desire and is liberated from desire,

original: 'dod chags las ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug las kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags las ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug las kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: and it is the same with regard to anger and ignorance as with desire.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na bde ba gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na bde ba gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: When all of these are combined into one, they become three kinds of happiness.

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba'i bde ba dang / bsten par bya ba'i gnas pa'i bde ba gong na yod pa dang gong na med pa dang / gtan du mthar thug pa ste rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba'i bde ba dang / bsten par bya ba'i gnas pa'i bde ba gong na yod pa dang gong na med pa dang / gtan du mthar thug pa ste rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: They are the happiness that is to be abandoned, the happiness of abiding that is to be relied upon, which is both higher and not higher, and the ultimate, permanent happiness of liberation.

original: de la 'dod pa'i bde ba ni yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i bde ba ni yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, the happiness of the desire realm is to be abandoned.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ni bsten par bya ba gong na yod pa'i gnas pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ni bsten par bya ba gong na yod pa'i gnas pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: From the first concentration up to the peak of existence, it is the happiness of abiding that is to be relied upon, which is both higher and not higher.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsten par bya ba gong na med pa'i gnas pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsten par bya ba gong na med pa'i gnas pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is the supreme abode of bliss that is to be relied upon.

original: snga ma bzhin du bde ba gsum po rnams ni gtan du mthar thug pa'i rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'o ;
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bde ba gsum po rnams ni gtan du mthar thug pa'i rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'o ;
translated: The three types of bliss mentioned above are the bliss of liberation that is ultimate and eternal.

original: / tshor ba'i bde ba las dgongs te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bde ba'o zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / tshor ba'i bde ba las dgongs te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bde ba'o zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is said to be blissful not from the perspective of the bliss of feeling,

original: bde ba'i tshor ba chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dang / bde ba de ji lta ba'i mchog gi gnas pa'i bde ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa las dgongs te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dang / bde ba de ji lta ba'i mchog gi gnas pa'i bde ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa las dgongs te /
translated: but from the perspective of the bliss of the cessation of the bliss of feeling, the bliss of the supreme abode of bliss, and the bliss of experiencing bliss.

original: ji ltar kha cig snyoms par 'jug pa de las langs nas bdag ni 'di dang 'di lta bur mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas ring du gnas par gyur to snyam du nyams su tshor ba 'di ni dgongs nas bde ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig snyoms par 'jug pa de las langs nas bdag ni 'di dang 'di lta bur mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas ring du gnas par gyur to snyam du nyams su tshor ba 'di ni dgongs nas bde ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Some emerge from that meditative attainment and experience the thought, ‚ÄúI have abided for a long time in this and this type of supreme and excellent abode.‚Äù The Buddha spoke of bliss from the perspective of that experience.

original: dge slong gis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bde ba dang / 'du shes dang / srid pa ji lta bu la brten nas de'i rjes la zag pa zad pa 'thob pa de ni de'i bde ba'i mchog yin pa nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bde ba dang / 'du shes dang / srid pa ji lta bu la brten nas de'i rjes la zag pa zad pa 'thob pa de ni de'i bde ba'i mchog yin pa nas /
translated: The monk, in dependence on seeing, hearing, pleasure, discernment, and existence, obtains the destruction of the contaminants. That is the supreme pleasure.

original: srid pa rnams kyi bar gyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: srid pa rnams kyi bar gyi mchog yin no //
translated: ... up to... That is the supreme existence.

original: de la bdag med par mthong ba'i gong du mthong ba gzhan tshor bar mi byed da /
analyzed: de la bdag med par mthong ba'i gong du mthong ba gzhan tshor bar mi byed da /
translated: In regard to that, prior to seeing selflessness, he does not experience any other seeing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mi rtag par mthong ba las ni de'i rjes la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong ba las ni de'i rjes la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: in dependence on seeing impermanence, he obtains the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de bas na mthong ba rnams kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mthong ba rnams kyi mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the supreme seeing.

original: des mthong ba de la brten nas sgo bzhis zag pa med pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des mthong ba de la brten nas sgo bzhis zag pa med pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on that seeing, he obtains the destruction of the contaminants by means of the four doors.

original: gzhan las dam pa'i chos thob pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan las dam pa'i chos thob pa'am /
translated: He obtains the holy Dharma from another.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi la brten pa'am /üîΩ'du shes kyi @302a * //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi la brten pa'am / 'du shes kyi @302a * //
translated: He obtains the four bases of supernatural power.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: He obtains the three meditative attainments of discernment.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched yan chad ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad dam /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched yan chad ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad dam /
translated: The realm of infinite space is the first of the four formless meditative attainments. The realm of nothingness is the third of the four formless meditative attainments.

original: lhar gyur pa dang / mir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhar gyur pa dang / mir gyur pa'o //
translated: The realm of the gods and the realm of humans.

original: de bas na thos pa dang / bde ba de dang / 'du shes de dang / sred pa de ni thos pa rnams dang / bde ba rnams dang / 'du shes rnams dang / srid pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa dang / bde ba de dang / 'du shes de dang / sred pa de ni thos pa rnams dang / bde ba rnams dang / 'du shes rnams dang / srid pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this hearing, this happiness, this perception, and this craving are said to be the best among all the various kinds of hearing, happiness, perception, and craving.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The basis of complete understanding is complete understanding. One is liberated from the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is liberated from the truth of the arising of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
translated: One realizes the truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang sgom par byed do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang sgom par byed do //
translated: One cultivates the truth of the path.

original: de la yang dag pa kho nar sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las yongs su grol ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa kho nar sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las yongs su grol ba'o //
translated: One is liberated from the truth of suffering because one has reached the end of suffering in the correct way.

original: zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur bas na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur bas na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Since they attain the exhaustion of the contaminants, they are liberated from the truth of the origin.

original: skyo zhing ma chags la rnam par grol bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: skyo zhing ma chags la rnam par grol bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Since they are disgusted, unattached, and liberated, they manifest the truth of cessation.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rjes su mthong bas gnas pas na lam gyi bden pa sgom mo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa rjes su mthong bas gnas pas na lam gyi bden pa sgom mo //
translated: Since they abide by seeing impermanence, etc., they cultivate the truth of the path.

original: shes bya'i gzhi'i bye brag ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i gzhi'i bye brag ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: The basis of the knowable should be understood as having ten aspects:

original: srog gi dbang po dang 'brel pa'i 'du byed skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu'i bye brag dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gcig la gcig brten cing 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i 'du shes rnams mi rtag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang 'brel pa'i 'du byed skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu'i bye brag dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gcig la gcig brten cing 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i 'du shes rnams mi rtag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
translated: the particular cause of the duration of conditioned states connected with the faculty of life, the particular mutual support and engagement of conditioned states with form and without form, the particular door of engagement with impermanence of conditioned states without form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states with form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states without form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states with form and without form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states without form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states with form and without form, the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states with form, and the particular engagement with the object of conditioned states without form.

original: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang gnas kyi bye brag dang / 'du byed rnam pa thams cad du bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang gnas kyi bye brag dang / 'du byed rnam pa thams cad du bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa'i sgo'i bye brag dang /
translated: the various bases and locations of the mental afflictions, the various types of suffering that are included in all the formations, the various doors of experiencing the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyu ba'i mtha'i bye brag dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnas kyi bye brag dang / sems can mngon par dga' ba dang / zhen pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nas gnas pa'i mtha'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyu ba'i mtha'i bye brag dang / rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnas kyi bye brag dang / sems can mngon par dga' ba dang / zhen pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nas gnas pa'i mtha'i bye brag dang /
translated: the various limits of the movement of consciousness that is accompanied by delight, the various objects of attachment and aversion, the various locations of the birth and death of beings who are delighted and attached,

original: bag med pa rnams ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i gnas kyang mtha'i bye brag go //
analyzed: bag med pa rnams ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i gnas kyang mtha'i bye brag go //
translated: and the various limits of the locations of the heedless who go to the lower realms.

original: gzhan @302b yang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa thob par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba'i gzhi'i sgo nas bye brag bcur yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan @302b yang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa thob par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba'i gzhi'i sgo nas bye brag bcur yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the factors that contribute to enlightenment should be understood as being of ten types on the basis of their being the bases that are to be attained and relied upon.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed pa'i sgo nas bag yod pa'i bye brag dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i gnas kyi bye brag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa thams cad la sems 'dogs pa'i mtha'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa rtag tu byed pa'i sgo nas bag yod pa'i bye brag dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i gnas kyi bye brag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa thams cad la sems 'dogs pa'i mtha'i bye brag dang /
translated: the specific aspects of carefulness through always cultivating virtuous dharmas, the specific aspects of the basis of liberation of mind and liberation of wisdom, the specific aspects of the culmination of samadhi, the specific aspects of the culmination of the mind being attached to all objects of meditation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i thabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam par thar pa'i bye brag dang / de kho na'i don yang dag par rtogs pa'i bya brag dang / de kho na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i 'og tu bslab pa gsum la slob pa'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i thabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam par thar pa'i bye brag dang / de kho na'i don yang dag par rtogs pa'i bya brag dang / de kho na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i 'og tu bslab pa gsum la slob pa'i bye brag dang /
translated: the specific aspects of the means of liberation, the specific aspects of liberation, the specific aspects of the realization of the meaning of thatness, the specific aspects of training in the three trainings after directly and fully awakening to thatness,

original: slob cing 'dug pa dang / bslab zin pa tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bye brag dang / 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul rgya chen po'i dbang phyug gi bye brag go //
analyzed: slob cing 'dug pa dang / bslab zin pa tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bye brag dang / 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul rgya chen po'i dbang phyug gi bye brag go //
translated: the specific aspects of abiding in training and of abiding in the bliss of abiding in this life after training, and the specific aspects of the power of the great miracles of the aryas.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i bye brag 'di rnams las brtsams te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i bye brag 'di rnams las brtsams te /
translated: In this way, the questions are based on the distinctions that have been taught.

original: 'dri ba yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dri ba yang yod do //
translated: There are also questions.

original: nges pa'i don ma yin pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ma yin pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also teachings that are not of definitive meaning.

original: nges pa'i don gyi tshul gyis lan gdab pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi tshul gyis lan gdab pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also answers that are of definitive meaning.

original: de la 'dri ba'i gang zag la rgyu bzhis lan mi glan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de la 'dri ba'i gang zag la rgyu bzhis lan mi glan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also four reasons why a questioner should not be answered.

original: lan 'debs par byed pas lan mi 'debs pa yang bzhi yod do //
analyzed: lan 'debs par byed pas lan mi 'debs pa yang bzhi yod do //
translated: There are also four reasons why an answerer should not answer.

original: gtan tshigs yod pa dang gtan tshigs med pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan zhing rigs par gyur pa legs par bsten kyang mi nyan pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / ldan pa'i yongs su brtag pa byed na yang mi nyan pa dang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod pa dang gtan tshigs med pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan zhing rigs par gyur pa legs par bsten kyang mi nyan pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / ldan pa'i yongs su brtag pa byed na yang mi nyan pa dang /
translated: Even if a reason is present and a reason is used, if the answerer is not listened to, even if the answerer is endowed with valid knowledge and is reasonable, and even if the answerer is well-versed, and even if the answerer is endowed with inference, and even if the answerer is endowed with investigation, if the questioner does not listen, then the answerer should not answer.

original: nan tan sgrubs shig dang / bdag nyid kyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes byas na yang mi nyan pa dang / shes pas smra ba yid ches su rung bas 'di skad gsungs so zhes byas kyang yid ches pa'i lung yang mi nyan pa ste /

translated: And even if he is told, The words of a trustworthy person who knows how to speak are to be believed, he does not listen to the trustworthy scripture.

original: de bas na 'dri ba po la lan mi glan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dri ba po la lan mi glan pa yin no //

original: mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are without self.

original: skye ba'o gnas thams cad la dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'o gnas thams cad la dga' bar mi bya'o //

translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous actions do not perish even after hundreds of millions of eons.

original: pa med do //
analyzed: pa med do //
translated: But there is no categorical answer to the question, If one acts with full awareness, one will experience suffering.

analyzed: btang snyoms thob pa ni tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang mgo gcig tu chad pa med do //

original: las byas na bde 'gror 'gro'o zhes zer ba la ni las gang zhes de nyid la 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: las byas na bde 'gror 'gro'o zhes zer ba la ni las gang zhes de nyid la 'dri bar bya'o //

analyzed: / de las bzlog pa ni lan mi 'debs pa yin no //

original: 'di gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: sred pa cha phra mo dang / ming dang gzugs rags pa'o //
translated: The subtle part of craving and the gross part of name-and-form.

original: de la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyis su ni srid pas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rgyus tshe'i tshad ji srid kyi bar du gnas te /

translated: In the formless realm, consciousness generated by craving remains for as long as life lasts, focusing on life itself.

analyzed: 'di ni tshe 'di'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste dang po'o //
translated: This is the first proximate affliction of this life.

analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa 'byung ste /

analyzed: rgyas par sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig gi bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di ni tshe phyi ma'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste gnyis pa'o //

original: 'di las phyi rol pa de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis blo tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir gzhan dag ni gzhan dag dang mi mthun la /

analyzed: de dag kyang de dag dang phyir mi mthun pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum pa'o //

original: de las chos 'di pa rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de las chos 'di pa rnam par grol lo //

original: 'di las phyi rol pa'i slob ma rnams 'byung bar lta ba rtag pa'i mthar gyur pa'am med par lta ba chad pa'i mthar gyur pa la yun ring por 'dris par byas pas na zhen par 'gyur ba dang / thos pa las byung bas khas len pa dang /

translated: The disciples of the outsiders, because of their long habituation to the view of origination, to the extreme of eternalism, and to the view of annihilation, to the extreme of nihilism, become attached to them, and they accept them through the knowledge derived from listening.

original: bsams pa las byung bas lhag par zhen pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung bas lhag par zhen par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung bas lhag par zhen pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung bas lhag par zhen par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams ni dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis spangs pa la zhugs pa yin no //

analyzed: de la shes pa gang zhe na /

original: rtogs pa gang zhe na /

original: slob pa'i sa la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa la 'jug pa'am /
translated: The stage of learning is entered.üîΩüîΩ

original: yang na shes rab gang la gnas nas dgra bcom pa mi slob pa'i sa las zad pa shes pa thob pa'i phyir bdag gi ni zad do snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i phyi nas byung ba'i 'jig rten pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //

original: bden pa'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the defilements by one who has attained the Noble Path of the eight-fold Path.

original: gang la gnas nas phyi ma la gtan du sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas phyi ma la gtan du sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in it, suffering does not arise in the future.

original: de bas na de ni gtan du brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir bden pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni gtan du brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir bden pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the basis of truth, because it is the basis of the absence of forgetfulness.

original: gtong ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtong ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of renunciation?

original: gang gis dngos po spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po spangs pa ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the object.

original: gang la gnas nas spangs pa'i dngos po la spyod kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur bar tshe 'di la yid bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas spangs pa'i dngos po la spyod kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur bar tshe 'di la yid bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of ease in this life, in which one can enjoy the objects of abandonment without being defiled by them.

original: nye bar zhi ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the state of complete peace?

original: lam ji ltar thob pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i dngos po'i lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam ji ltar thob pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i dngos po'i lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ste /
translated: It is the cultivation of the path in order to abandon the remaining fetters and the remaining objects of abandonment.

original: gang la gnas nas kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma rnams dang dngos po'i lhag ma ma lus par spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma rnams dang dngos po'i lhag ma ma lus par spong ba'o //
translated: It is the state in which one abandons without remainder the remaining fetters and the remaining objects of abandonment.

original: de dag thams cad bsdus pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i shes pa yin no //
translated: All of these are the knowledge that is to be realized.

original: rtogs par gyur na nyon mongs pa dang dngos po spangs pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyi sgo nas 'phags pa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur na nyon mongs pa dang dngos po spangs pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyi sgo nas 'phags pa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: de la gcig gis ni ma rtogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the first, one realizes what has not been realized.

original: gnas gnyis pas ni ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas gnyis pas ni ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the second state, one abandons suffering in the future.

original: gsum pas ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pas ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the third, one abides in the happiness of this life.

original: bzhi pas ni spong ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pas ni spong ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By the fourth, the abandonment that is not complete is completed.

original: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa'i rnal 'byor du bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na rnal 'byor pa'i rnal 'byor du bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Just by this, all the yogas of the yogi are completed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: ma rtogs pa dang po rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa dang po rtogs pa'am /
translated: First, the non-realized is realized.

original: ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Or, in the future, suffering is abandoned.
