analyzed: @306a * // tshe 'di'i bde ba la gnas pa'am gong du spong ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Or, one abides in the happiness of this life. Or, the abandonment that is not complete is completed.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gnas bzhi las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gnas bzhi las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these arise from the four abodes.

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam thob pa ni zhi ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam thob pa ni zhi ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the attainment of the noble path is called the path of peace.

original: de'i gong du nyon mongs pa dang / dngos po spang pa'i phyir bsten pa na dngos po spong ba'i phyir zhing rgyas par 'thob bar bya ba'i phyir 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba yang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gong du nyon mongs pa dang / dngos po spang pa'i phyir bsten pa na dngos po spong ba'i phyir zhing rgyas par 'thob bar bya ba'i phyir 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba yang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Before that, when one relies on the path in order to abandon the defilements and the things, one increases the path in order to abandon the things and to obtain them in abundance, and one guards the path so that one does not lose the acquisition of the abandonment of the defilements.

original: de la ji ltar na shes pas shes bya la nye par rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na shes pas shes bya la nye par rtogs pa na /
translated: How does one understand the object of understanding through understanding?

original: rtogs par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one understand the object of understanding through understanding?

original: so so'i skye bo yang dag par brtson pas so so'i skye bo'i sa las khams lnga la nye bar rtog pa na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yang dag par brtson pas so so'i skye bo'i sa las khams lnga la nye bar rtog pa na /
translated: The ordinary man who is truly engaged in the investigation of the five elements in the stage of the ordinary man,

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi bye brag gis lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas gnas te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi bye brag gis lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas gnas te /
translated: dwells in the contemplation of the body by way of the body, through the distinction of internal and external.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i don du de ltar tshul bzhin du brtson pa de khams rnams la khams tsam du 'du shes pas gnas la khams tsam la bdag med par mthong bas /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i don du de ltar tshul bzhin du brtson pa de khams rnams la khams tsam du 'du shes pas gnas la khams tsam la bdag med par mthong bas /
translated: In order to liberate the mind and liberate wisdom, they apply themselves properly in this way. Since they perceive the elements as merely elements, they see that the elements are devoid of self.üîΩ

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten nas gzugs kyi khams thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten nas gzugs kyi khams thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, he is liberated from the form realm by the power of thorough analysis, because he perceives the elements as mere elements and sees the absence of self in mere elements.

original: dmigs pa de yan chad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de yan chad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is liberated from the form realm, but not from the higher objective supports.

original: ma 'ongs pa la mi 'dod pa dang / da ltar la lhag par zhen pa med pa'i sgo nas kyang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la mi 'dod pa dang / da ltar la lhag par zhen pa med pa'i sgo nas kyang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is liberated from the form realm by not desiring the future and by not clinging to the present.

original: bag la nyal bcom pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal bcom pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not liberated by destroying the latent propensities.

original: de 'dod chags dang bral bas sems rnam par grol ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dod chags dang bral bas sems rnam par grol ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is liberated from attachment, his mind is liberated. Therefore, his mind is purified from attachment.

original: dmigs pa ma chad pas ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i lhag ma yod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma chad pas ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i lhag ma yod do //
translated: Since he has not eliminated the objective supports, he has the remainder of the latent propensities that have not been eliminated.

original: gong du rnam par dag par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gong du rnam par dag par bya dgos so //
translated: It should be purified further.

original: de gong du reg pa'i skye mched drug gis bsdus pa'i shes bya la nye bar rtog pa na tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta bas gnas so //
analyzed: de gong du reg pa'i skye mched drug gis bsdus pa'i shes bya la nye bar rtog pa na tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta bas gnas so //
translated: When he investigates the objects of knowledge included in the six sense spheres, he abides in the contemplation of feelings, observing feelings.

original: de snga ma bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas /
analyzed: de snga ma bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas /
translated: As before, on the basis of the power of discernment,

original: tshor ba'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes free from attachment to the element of feeling.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas mi rtag par brtags nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas mi rtag par brtags nas /
translated: Having investigated the arising of feeling as dependently originated and impermanent,

original: snga ma bzhin du de'i dmigs pa de ma chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de'i dmigs pa de ma chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: as before, his object of meditation becomes uninterrupted.

original: de ma rig pa dang bral bas shes rab rnam par grol ba'i phyir rig @306b pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i tshor ba thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lhag pa'i btang snyoms nye
analyzed: de ma rig pa dang bral bas shes rab rnam par grol ba'i phyir rig @306b pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i tshor ba thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lhag pa'i btang snyoms nye
translated: Since he is free from ignorance, his wisdom is liberated. Therefore, all wholesome feelings that arise from contact with awareness are accompanied by the proper mental activity of one who is aware. He is indifferent to the remaining defilements.

original: bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen las byung ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The middle one is pure because it is free from attachment that arises from contact with ignorance and from the feeling that is its condition.

original: bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir ni lhag ma yod de gong du rnam par dag par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir ni lhag ma yod de gong du rnam par dag par bya dgos so //
translated: The remaining one is not pure because the latent dispositions have not been eliminated, and it must be purified further.

original: de de'i gong du yid 'jug par byed pa bco brgyad la nye bar rtog pa na cig car sems dang chos kyi rjes su lta bas gnas so //
analyzed: de de'i gong du yid 'jug par byed pa bco brgyad la nye bar rtog pa na cig car sems dang chos kyi rjes su lta bas gnas so //
translated: When he investigates the eighteen mental activities above that, he abides in the contemplation of mind and mental activities in relation to the form realm.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks to himself:

original: yid 'jug par byed pa bco brgyad po 'di rnams kyi nang na ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid 'jug par byed pa bco brgyad po 'di rnams kyi nang na ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAmong these eighteen mental activities,

original: gzugs rnams las 'das pa gzugs med pa'i zhi ba dang / rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag mchog yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams las 'das pa gzugs med pa'i zhi ba dang / rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag mchog yin no //
translated: the most excellent are those that are peaceful and liberated from form, and that transcend form.

original: btang snyoms dang mthun pa'i chos de dag la la ni yid 'jug par byed pa yod de /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mthun pa'i chos de dag la la ni yid 'jug par byed pa yod de /
translated: Some of these mental activities that are in conformity with equanimity

original: de ltar 'jug par byed pa gya nom pa de la yang /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug par byed pa gya nom pa de la yang /
translated: And in this way, he enters into this sublime equanimity.

original: bdag gis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa 'di gtad par byas na ni de'i rgyus kyang bdag gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas gtod par mi byed de /
analyzed: bdag gis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa 'di gtad par byas na ni de'i rgyus kyang bdag gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas gtod par mi byed de /
translated: He does not give himself over to the equanimity of meditative absorption or the equanimity of birth, thinking, ‚ÄúIf I were to give myself over to this, my mind would become afflicted.‚Äù

original: de ni de'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba yin no //
translated: This is his observation of the mind with respect to the mind.

original: de skyed mched de dag la yang mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni de'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de skyed mched de dag la yang mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni de'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba yin no //
translated: His observation of the mind with respect to phenomena is his observation of the impermanence of the sense sources.

original: de de'i tshe 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gsum dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang yang bral bas na /
analyzed: de de'i tshe 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa gsum dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang yang bral bas na /
translated: At that time, he is free from the three meditative absorptions of perception and the peak of existence, which is the remainder of the formative forces and is free from attachment to the base of neither perception nor no perception.

original: 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is free from attachment to the element of perception and the element of formative forces.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before.

original: de nyid kyis yang dag pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sa la sems rnam par dag par byas nas slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyis yang dag pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sa la sems rnam par dag par byas nas slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya bar 'dod de /
translated: Having purified the mind on the stage of the common person by means of right practice, he wishes to manifest the mind of the disciple who is liberated by means of insight.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos tsam du zad de /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos tsam du zad de /
translated: He sees that the body, feeling, mind and dharmas are merely dharmas.

original: bdag med par mngon nas srid pa thams cad las sems lhag par btang snyoms su bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med par mngon nas srid pa thams cad las sems lhag par btang snyoms su bya ste /
translated: Having realized selflessness, he becomes indifferent to the whole of existence.

original: bdag ni yod par 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag ni yod par 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: He does not form the idea that he will become existent or

original: med par 'gyur @307a * //üîΩro snyam du mngon par 'du mi byed do //üîΩ'di la gang su yang yod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: med par 'gyur @307a * // ro snyam du mngon par 'du mi byed do // 'di la gang su yang yod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: non-existent.

original: med par 'gyur ba med do snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba med do snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows reality just as it is, thinking that there is no one here who will become existent or non-existent.

original: des de ltar shes pas rim gyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnam pa gsum las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de ltar shes pas rim gyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnam pa gsum las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing thus, he gradually becomes liberated from the three kinds of defilements which are to be abandoned by means of insight and meditation.

original: des zad pa shes pa thob pas lus 'di zhig nas phyi ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du tshor ba rnams mi 'byang bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: des zad pa shes pa thob pas lus 'di zhig nas phyi ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du tshor ba rnams mi 'byang bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of elimination, he sees that after the destruction of this body, all feelings will be completely eliminated in the future.

original: de'i tshe zag pa zad pa de la de'i zad pa shes pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi gnas rnams kyi nang na mchog yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zag pa zad pa de la de'i zad pa shes pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi gnas rnams kyi nang na mchog yin te /
translated: At that time, the knowledge of elimination in that elimination of defilements is the supreme among the bases of wisdom.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni dri ma dang bcas pa yin la de'i ni gcig tu nges par dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni dri ma dang bcas pa yin la de'i ni gcig tu nges par dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For ordinary beings and trainees, it is accompanied by defilements, but for him, it is definitely undefiled.

original: de'i shes rab de yang nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de yang nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: His wisdom is also taught through the object of observation of the aspect of peace of the truth of cessation that abandons all afflictions.

original: brjed ngas pa tsam gyis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa tsam gyis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be disturbed even by mere forgetfulness.

original: de'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: His mind and wisdom are liberated in this way.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi gnas skabs ltar brjed ngas pa tsam gyis zad par byed mi nus te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi gnas skabs ltar brjed ngas pa tsam gyis zad par byed mi nus te /
translated: It is not like the state of ordinary beings and learners, which can be exhausted by mere forgetfulness.

original: de dag ni brjed ngas pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni brjed ngas pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are characterized by forgetfulness, it is not a complete truth.

original: mi slob pa de'i ni rtag tu ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'i bden pa yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa de'i ni rtag tu ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'i bden pa yin te /
translated: For the non-learner, it always remains as it is, so it is a complete truth.

original: de bas na de ni bden pa'i gnas kyi mchog dang ldan pa dang / phung po'i dngos po thams cad gtod pa'i phyir gtod pa'i gnas kyi mchog dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni bden pa'i gnas kyi mchog dang ldan pa dang / phung po'i dngos po thams cad gtod pa'i phyir gtod pa'i gnas kyi mchog dang yang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, it possesses the supreme basis of truth, and because it relinquishes all the entities of the aggregates, it also possesses the supreme basis of relinquishment.

original: de'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma lus par yang dag par grub pas na /
analyzed: de'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma lus par yang dag par grub pas na /
translated: Because the result of his path is completely accomplished,

original: lam shin tu bsgoms pa yin te /
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgoms pa yin te /
translated: it is the well-cultivated path.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that for ordinary beings and learners.

original: de bas na de'i de ni nye bar zhi ba'i gnas kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i de ni nye bar zhi ba'i gnas kyi mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the supreme basis of complete peace.

original: ci'i phyir mi slob pa 'ba' zhig gi gnas bzhi ni mchog yin la so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi slob pa 'ba' zhig gi gnas bzhi ni mchog yin la so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the four abodes of the non-learner alone supreme, and not those of the ordinary man and the learner?

original: de la gnas pa de'i ni nyes 'jag rdul tsam yang med la so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i ni mang du yod pa dang / slob pa'i ni nyung ngu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa de'i ni nyes 'jag rdul tsam yang med la so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i ni mang du yod pa dang / slob pa'i ni nyung ngu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who abides in that has not even the slightest impurity, while the one who abides in the stage of the ordinary man has many, and the one who is a learner has few.

original: nyes 'dzag rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes 'dzag rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the impurities?

original: snga ma bzhin du g-yo ba dang rlom pa la sogs pa @307b yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du g-yo ba dang rlom pa la sogs pa @307b yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as the movements, the conceits, etc., as above.

original: de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin thob pas na thub pa zhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin thob pas na thub pa zhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has completely abandoned all of them, he has attained the nature of the Muni, and so he is called the Muni who is peaceful.

original: phyi ma'i rgyu bsal ba dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma rnams su skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / tshe 'di la rgyu zhing 'gro ba na 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi la rjes su chags pa nye bar zhi ba dang /
analyzed: phyi ma'i rgyu bsal ba dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma rnams su skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / tshe 'di la rgyu zhing 'gro ba na 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi la rjes su chags pa nye bar zhi ba dang /
translated: the four worldly dharmas are pacified when one travels and goes in this life,

original: bzhi la ni khong khro ba nye bar zhi ba dang / gnas shing 'dug pa na yang 'dre ba rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi la ni khong khro ba nye bar zhi ba dang / gnas shing 'dug pa na yang 'dre ba rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the four worldly dharmas are pacified when one stays and sits.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu bdun gyis dam pa'i chos ba dun rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu bdun gyis dam pa'i chos ba dun rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The seven causes for the completion of the cultivation of the dharmas that are concordant with enlightenment should be understood as the presentation of the seven good qualities of the Dharma.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: thos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa gsum po de dag nyid kyi sbyor ba'i tshe yang zang zing gi longs spyod kyi zang zing gi longs yongs su spyod pa khong du chud pa dang zang zing dang chos kyi longs spyod gzhan las dus dus su 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa gsum po de dag nyid kyi sbyor ba'i tshe yang zang zing gi longs spyod kyi zang zing gi longs yongs su spyod pa khong du chud pa dang zang zing dang chos kyi longs spyod gzhan las dus dus su 'thob pa dang /
translated: When one is engaged in the three kinds of attention, one understands the enjoyment of material things, and from time to time one obtains the enjoyment of material things and the enjoyment of the Dharma from others.

original: mthar thug pa'i che yang bdag nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas chud za bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i che yang bdag nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas chud za bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the end, one does not waste one‚Äôs own efforts because one is free of pride, and one does not waste the efforts of others because one is free of pride toward others.

original: de la zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams la bsgom pa'i phyir dus shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams la bsgom pa'i phyir dus shes pa ste /
translated: Here, knowing the time is for the sake of cultivating the signs of serenity, complete acceptance, and equanimity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: As in the S≈´tra on the Levels of the Disciples.

original: zos pa dang 'thungs ba la sogs pa'i don kyang nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zos pa dang 'thungs ba la sogs pa'i don kyang nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúeating, drinking, etc.‚Äù should be understood as in the S≈´tra on the Levels of the Disciples.

original: de la zang zing gi longs spyod kyi phyir rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gi 'khor rnams dang / chos kyi longs spyod kyi phyir dge slong gi 'khor rnams su bdag gis 'di ltar bgrod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la zang zing gi longs spyod kyi phyir rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gi 'khor rnams dang / chos kyi longs spyod kyi phyir dge slong gi 'khor rnams su bdag gis 'di ltar bgrod par bya ste /
translated: There, for the sake of material goods, I should go among the retinue of the warrior-noble class, the priest class, and the merchant class; and for the sake of the enjoyment of the Dharma, I should go among the retinue of monks.

original: lus shin tu bsrungs ba dang / dbang po rnams shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa la shin tu gnas pas sgo drung du 'greng bar bya ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu bsrungs ba dang / dbang po rnams shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa la shin tu gnas pas sgo drung du 'greng bar bya ste /
translated: I should stand at the door, with my body well guarded, my senses well restrained, and well established in mindfulness.

original: ma gnang gi bar du nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma gnang gi bar du nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Until I am invited, I should not go inside.

original: nang du 'ongs na yang ma gnang gi bar du stan gyi drung du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nang du 'ongs na yang ma gnang gi bar du stan gyi drung du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even if I have gone inside, until I am invited, I should not go near the seats.

original: 'dug na yang drag tu ljid kyis dbab par mi @308a * //
analyzed: 'dug na yang drag tu ljid kyis dbab par mi @308a * //
translated: Even if I am sitting, I should not sit too comfortably.

original: bya'o snyam pa nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya'o snyam pa nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The same is true of the other four types of speech.

original: smra bar bya ba yang tshig rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba yang tshig rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Speech is of five types:

original: dus dang / rigs pa dang / ran pa dang / zhi ba dang / drang por smra ba'o //
analyzed: dus dang / rigs pa dang / ran pa dang / zhi ba dang / drang por smra ba'o //
translated: timely, true, gentle, beneficial, and peaceful.

original: dus lngar ni kha rog par 'dug par bya ste /
analyzed: dus lngar ni kha rog par 'dug par bya ste /
translated: One should remain silent in five situations:

original: yengs pa dang / 'gog pa dang / thab mo snyogs pa dang ; klan ka tshol zhing 'dug pa dang / g-yar 'dren pa dang / smra ba'i tshe ste /
analyzed: yengs pa dang / 'gog pa dang / thab mo snyogs pa dang ; klan ka tshol zhing 'dug pa dang / g-yar 'dren pa dang / smra ba'i tshe ste /
translated: when one is distracted, when one is in a state of absorption, when one is arguing, when one is seeking a pretext, and when one is speaking.

original: gtam gyi mjug rdzogs pa bsdad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtam gyi mjug rdzogs pa bsdad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not speak when the conversation is over, because one is then trying to have the last word.

original: de la dus dus su smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dus dus su smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is timely speech?

original: yengs pa'am / mi brel ba'am /
analyzed: yengs pa'am / mi brel ba'am /
translated: One should not speak when one is distracted or in a hurry,

original: nyan par mi 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: nyan par mi 'dod pa'am /
translated: when one is not willing to listen,

original: spyod lam 'tsham pa ma yin pas gnas pa la mi smra ba dang / sngar bya ba bstan zin nas khyad par dang ldan pa ston pa dang / gtam gyi mjug rdzogs pa bsdad nas gzhan dag la tshig smra ba ste /
analyzed: spyod lam 'tsham pa ma yin pas gnas pa la mi smra ba dang / sngar bya ba bstan zin nas khyad par dang ldan pa ston pa dang / gtam gyi mjug rdzogs pa bsdad nas gzhan dag la tshig smra ba ste /
translated: when one is in an unsuitable location, when one is teaching a special point after having already taught the preliminary points, and when one is trying to have the last word in a conversation.

original: 'di dang de dang mthun pa rnams ni dus dus su smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang de dang mthun pa rnams ni dus dus su smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these and other similar qualities are the characteristics of timely speech.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas bden pa'i tshig dang don dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtshig dang yi ge ran pa dag gis tshig ci tsam mi brjod du mi rung ba de tsam zhig smra bar byed de /
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas bden pa'i tshig dang don dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa zhes bya'o // tshig dang yi ge ran pa dag gis tshig ci tsam mi brjod du mi rung ba de tsam zhig smra bar byed de /
translated: The speech of bodhisattvas is reasonable in that it is consistent with the four principles for attracting disciples.üîΩ It is appropriate in that it is neither too brief, leaving the listener to ask, What does this mean?

original: mi nyung ba mi mang pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / don med pa ma yin pa'i tshig 'di ni ran par smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi nyung ba mi mang pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / don med pa ma yin pa'i tshig 'di ni ran par smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: nor too long, leaving the listener to think, What is the point?

original: rgod pa med pa'i tshig smra ba dang / lab lab po ma yin pa dang / lus kyi nyes rtsom med pa dang / ngag gi nyes rtsom med pa 'di ni zhi bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa med pa'i tshig smra ba dang / lab lab po ma yin pa dang / lus kyi nyes rtsom med pa dang / ngag gi nyes rtsom med pa 'di ni zhi bar smra ba'o //
translated: It is peaceful in that it is not agitated, not rambling, and not accompanied by physical or verbal distraction.

original: tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ma bcos pa'i tshig dang g-yo dang bral ba'i phyir thad kar smra ba 'di ni drang por smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ma bcos pa'i tshig dang g-yo dang bral ba'i phyir thad kar smra ba 'di ni drang por smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is honest in that it is free of hypocrisy and guile.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams bdag la med bzhin du yod do snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi byed la chung ngu dag la yang lhag par sgro 'dogs par mi byed de ci yod pa dang / ci tsam yod pa de nyi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams bdag la med bzhin du yod do snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi byed la chung ngu dag la yang lhag par sgro 'dogs par mi byed de ci yod pa dang / ci tsam yod pa de nyi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: One does not falsely project oneself as having the virtues of faith, etc., when one does not have them. One does not falsely project oneself as having a small amount of them when one has only a small amount. One knows exactly what one has and what one does not have.

original: de bas na bdag shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one is called a person who knows himself.

original: de la dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i nyes pa gtong ba dang / yo byad thams cad dang lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba dang /üîΩde sngon du 'gro ba'i sems mnyam par gzhag @308b na yang dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i nyes pa gtong ba dang / yo byad thams cad dang lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i sems mnyam par gzhag @308b na yang dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The five qualities are: the acceptance of the morality preceded by faith, the search for learning preceded by the acceptance of morality, the abandonment of faults preceded by learning, the lack of concern for all material things and even for one‚Äôs body and life, preceded by the abandonment of faults, and the meditative concentration of the mind preceded by lack of concern for material things.

original: chos lnga po de dag kyang rgyu bzhis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: chos lnga po de dag kyang rgyu bzhis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The five qualities are also distinguished by four causes:

original: gzhan gyi lung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lung ste /

translated: The other's natural eloquence is the natural eloquence of another school.üîΩThe other's natural qualities are the natural qualities of another school.

analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi nang na 'di ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: dam pa'i chos bdun bsgoms pa'i phan yon ni gnyis te /
translated: The other's natural qualities are the natural qualities of another school.üîΩThe other's natural application is the natural application of another school.üîΩThe other's natural conduct is the natural conduct of another school.üîΩThe other's natural lineage is the natural lineage of another school.üîΩThe other's natural understanding is the natural understanding of another school.üîΩThe other's natural teaching is the natural teaching of another school.üîΩThe other's natural scripture is the scripture of another school.üîΩThe other's natural realization is the realization of another school.üîΩThe other's natural eloquence is the natural eloquence of another school.üîΩThe other's natural qualities are the natural qualities of another school.üîΩThe other's natural application is the natural application of another school.üîΩThe other's natural conduct is the natural conduct of another school.üîΩThe other's natural lineage is the natural lineage of another school.üîΩThe other's natural

analyzed: tshe 'di la shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba dang / shes bya'i de kho na mngon par rtogs pa las byung ba'i yid bde bas bde ba dang / yid bde bas shas cher gnas pa dang / de'i gnas pa de nyid ni zag pa zad par 'gyur ba'i tshul bzhin no //
translated: The happiness of the bodhisattva is fivefold: the happiness of physical pliancy, the happiness of mental pliancy, the happiness of the superior attitude, the happiness of the superior mind, and the happiness of the superior practice.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The happiness of the bodhisattva is fivefold: the happiness of physical pliancy, the happiness of mental pliancy, the happiness of the superior attitude, the happiness of the superior mind, and the happiness of the superior practice.

original: bslab pa rnams dang / bslabs pa'i 'bras bus chos thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams dang / bslabs pa'i 'bras bus chos thams cad bsdus te /
translated: In brief, the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya includes the trainings and the results of the trainings.

original: bslab pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the trainings?

original: bslab pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum ste /

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo /
translated: the training in superior morality, the training in superior mind, and the training in superior wisdom.

original: bslabs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslabs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the results of the trainings?

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: They are the nirvana with remainder and the nirvana without remainder.

original: de la chos thams cad ni 'di rnams yin te /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ni 'di rnams yin te /
translated: The following are all the dharmas:

original: rab tu 'byung bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir chos la 'dun pa dge ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir chos la 'dun pa dge ba ste /
translated: The wholesome aspiration for the Dharma, for the sake of going forth and attaining nirvana.

original: thog ma kho nar tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: First of all, one takes up the precepts.

original: gang gi phyir mthar gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthar gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one will eventually attain complete nirvana, they are called ‚Äúrooted in aspiration.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang tshul khrims la brten nas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang ldan pa'i thos pa bzung nas /
analyzed: de dag kyang tshul khrims la brten nas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang ldan pa'i thos pa bzung nas /
translated: Moreover, based on morality, one listens to the true Dharma and retains what one has heard.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i tshig bla dags dang / rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i tshig bla dags dang / rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of listening to the true Dharma, one attains the understanding that arises from the contact of the three.

original: de bas na reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúhaving contact as their cause.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams @309a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams @309a * //
translated: Moreover, the feelings that arise from the contact of the three are the cause of craving.

original: de'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la bzhi la lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dran pas lhag mthong la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la bzhi la lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dran pas lhag mthong la brten nas /
translated: At that time, the four foundations of mindfulness are the basis for insight, because mindfulness is in accord with insight.

original: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyi dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyi dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: The internal mental state of calm abiding is under the control of insight.

analyzed: dran pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i zhi gnas de yang phyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa shes bya'i gtso bor 'dug ste /
translated: That calm abiding which arises through the power of mindfulness is later the foremost of the wisdoms that directly realize the truths.

analyzed: de bas na shes rab bla ma zhes bya'o //

original: de ltar sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de dang / bslab pas bsdus pa'i chos de dag dang / rten du gyur pa'i phung po dang bcas par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rang gi ngang gis gtan du 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de dang / bslab pas bsdus pa'i chos de dag dang / rten du gyur pa'i phung po dang bcas par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rang gi ngang gis gtan du 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the extremely liberated mind, that feeling which arises from the contact of cognition, those dharmas included in the training, and the aggregates which are the basis, all cease forever by their own nature in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ultimate nirvana.

original: de la @309b 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa gang yin pa 'di ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de la @309b 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa gang yin pa 'di ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the training in superior morality is the taking up of morality that is governed by aspiration.

original: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten gyi gzhi'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sbyor ba dang bcas pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten gyi gzhi'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sbyor ba dang bcas pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The training in superior mind is the mental attention, mindfulness, and samadhi, together with their application, in the form of the basis of the support for contact, feeling, superior mind, and superior wisdom.

original: shes rab bla ma ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab bla ma ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
translated: The guru of wisdom is the training in higher wisdom.

original: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag ni gzhi dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po 'di dag ni gzhi dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three trainings should be understood as having a basis.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslab pa'i 'bras bu dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslab pa'i 'bras bu dang po'o //
translated: The first result of the trainings is nirvƒÅ·πáa with remainder,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslab pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bslab pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa'o //
translated: and the second result of the trainings is nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder, the final nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bslabs pa rnams dang bslabs pa'i 'bras bu de rnams bsdus pa ni chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: bslabs pa rnams dang bslabs pa'i 'bras bu de rnams bsdus pa ni chos thams cad yin no //
translated: All phenomena are included in the trainings and their results.

original: bslab pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa de dag yang dag par 'grub pa'i tshogs su gyur pa ni nyes pa rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen por 'du shes rnam pa dgu 'dris par bya ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa de dag yang dag par 'grub pa'i tshogs su gyur pa ni nyes pa rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen por 'du shes rnam pa dgu 'dris par bya ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The collection that perfectly accomplishes the trainings and their results is the familiarization with the nine kinds of perception that are the antidotes to the eight faults.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yongs su zhen pa dang / yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed la 'chums pa dang / le lo dang / snyom las dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / rol sred pa dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su chags pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yongs su zhen pa dang / yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed la 'chums pa dang / le lo dang / snyom las dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / rol sred pa dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su chags pa dang /
translated: 1) attachment to gain and honor, 2) craving for the formations that lead to rebirth, 3) laziness and indolence, 4) the afflicted view of the perishable composite, 5) delight in social interactions, 6) attachment to the desire for various worldly things,

original: bag med pa la gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i sbyor ba dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa la gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i sbyor ba dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: 7) lack of mindfulness, 8) engagement in misconduct, and 9) the aspiration to remain in celibacy.

original: 'du shes 'dris par bya ba rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes 'dris par bya ba rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ninefold familiarization with perceptions?

original: 'di ltar rab tu 'byung ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu 'byung ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang /
translated: It is the familiarization with the perception of going forth, the familiarization with the perception of the danger in all formations, the familiarization with the perception of impermanence, the familiarization with the perception of suffering in what is impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mthun pa dang /üîΩmi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang kun 'byung @310a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang kun 'byung @310a * //
translated: The perception of the absence of self in those who are suffering, the perception of food as repulsive, the perception of the whole world as not to be enjoyed, the perception of what is agreeable and disagreeable in the world, the perception of the arising, passing away, convergence,

original: ba dang nub pa dang ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba dang nub pa dang ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes 'dris par bya ba'o //
translated: disappearance, danger, and defilement of things, and the perception of the deliverance and peacefulness of things.

original: de la chos mthun par spyod pas bsdus pa'i bde 'gror 'gro ba'i dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos mthun par spyod pas bsdus pa'i bde 'gror 'gro ba'i dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind that lead to good rebirth through being included in the practice of the Dharma are called ‚Äúagreeable.‚Äù

original: chos ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i spyod pas bsdus pa ngang 'gror 'gro ba mi dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i spyod pas bsdus pa ngang 'gror 'gro ba mi dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unwholesome actions of body, speech, and mind that lead to bad rebirth through being included in the practice of non-Dharma are called ‚Äúdisagreeable.‚Äù

original: 'di na gnas pa skyes shing byung ba'i phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di na gnas pa skyes shing byung ba'i phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
translated: The suffering of birth in the future is birth, which occurs and arises here in this life.

original: sngon gyi mtha' las byung bas tshe 'di la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' las byung bas tshe 'di la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: The suffering of death in this life is destruction, which occurs from the prior limit.

original: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis rab tu dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩ'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i 'du shes la brten nas /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis rab tu dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o // 'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i 'du shes la brten nas /
translated: The remaining aspects of the truths of origination, etc., should be understood as before.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas, who are outside this teaching, give rise to feelings that arise from contact with ignorance, on the basis of incorrect ideation that occurs due to listening to false doctrines.

original: de la brten nas zag pa rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas zag pa rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of that, the contaminants arise.

original: phyi rol ba de ni zag pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: phyi rol ba de ni zag pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: Those non-Buddhists do not understand the contaminants as they are in reality.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i log pa'i 'du shes kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i log pa'i 'du shes kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: He does not understand as it really is the feeling that arises from the contact of ignorance, nor the false perception that arises from hearing what is not the true Dharma.

original: des gnas gsum po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: des gnas gsum po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Because he does not understand as it really is these three things, he seeks pleasure.

original: srid pa yang tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: srid pa yang tshol bar byed do //
translated: He seeks existence.

original: log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas 'jig pa yang tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas 'jig pa yang tshol bar byed do //
translated: He seeks destruction by seeking a false purity.

original: des ni 'dod pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: des ni 'dod pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: He does not understand as it really is the pleasures.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i las byas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i las byas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: He does not understand as it really is the action that produces rebirth in a new existence.

original: sdug bsngal yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: He does not understand as it really is suffering.

original: de la snga ma lnga ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la snga ma lnga ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The first five are the basis of the truth of origination.

original: tha ma ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: tha ma ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: The last is the basis of the truth of suffering.

original: de ltar na phyi rol pa de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol pa de ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: Thus, the outsider does not know the truth of origination and the truth of suffering as they really are.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de yang mdor bsdu na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba @310b rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de yang mdor bsdu na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba @310b rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: Moreover, the truth of origination and the truth of suffering are not known as they really are in brief through the two aspects of defilement and purification.

original: da la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: da la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, defilement is fourfold:

original: rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: by nature, cause, result, and classification by cause and result.

original: de la rnam par byang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, purification is twofold:

original: kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam mo //
translated: the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path that leads to cessation.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la shes pa med pa de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ma bsgoms pa'i rgyus gtan du mthar thug pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ma yin to /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la shes pa med pa de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ma bsgoms pa'i rgyus gtan du mthar thug pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ma yin to /
translated: Those who do not know the four noble truths in this way do not practice the factors that contribute to awakening. For this reason, their practice of pure conduct is not ultimate and final.

original: des na nges par 'byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na nges par 'byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúnot leading to penetration.‚Äù

original: zag pa rnams ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa rnams ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not bring about the exhaustion of the outflows.

original: de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that

original: chos 'di pa'i gtan du mthar thug pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ni nges par 'byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i gtan du mthar thug pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ni nges par 'byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: is the practice of pure conduct that is ultimate and final for those who belong to this spiritual system. It should be understood that this is ‚Äúleading to penetration.‚Äù

original: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it brings about the exhaustion of the outflows.

original: gang zag rnam pa drug po kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i dbang po'i ye shes dang / phyi ma la chos yang dag par skye ba'i ye shes 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa drug po kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i dbang po'i ye shes dang / phyi ma la chos yang dag par skye ba'i ye shes 'jug go //
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagatas penetrates the knowledge of the great being and the knowledge of the future arising of the Dharma with regard to the six types of persons, by way of the reality of the defilement and purification.

original: gang zag rnam pa drug po rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa drug po rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six types of persons?

original: 'di ni gang zag kha cig gis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu chos 'dul ba'i 'di la dad pa thob pa nas /üîΩrgyas par lta ba dang po'i bar du byas nas de da ltar nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag kha cig gis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu chos 'dul ba'i 'di la dad pa thob pa nas / rgyas par lta ba dang po'i bar du byas nas de da ltar nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa la brten nas /
translated: Some persons, in other previous lives, have obtained faith in this Dharma and Vinaya,üîΩup to the first view, as explained at length.

original: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas tshe 'di la thog ma kho nar lta ba dang / sred pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas tshe 'di la thog ma kho nar lta ba dang / sred pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed do //
translated: Then, in this life, they first produce the defilements of view, craving, and action, by means of hearing the non-Dharma and incorrect mental application, in dependence on the non-Dharma Vinaya of the bad teacher.

original: de de'i tshe sngon gyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: de de'i tshe sngon gyi dge ba'i chos de dag dang yang ldan la /
translated: At that time, they possess those former virtuous qualities

original: tshe 'di'i mi dge ba de dag dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i mi dge ba de dag dang yang ldan te /
translated: and also possess those nonvirtuous qualities of this life.

original: de de'i 'og tu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la skyes bu dam pa bsten pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de de'i 'og tu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la skyes bu dam pa bsten pa la brten nas /
translated: After that, they rely on the holy being who is well-versed in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar dag gi sgo nas /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar dag gi sgo nas /
translated: Up to properly bringing to mind,

original: sngon gyi rgyu de kho nas nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba de las phyir ldog ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu de kho nas nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba de las phyir ldog ste /
translated: by means of those very former causes, they turn away from that poorly-taught Dharma and Vinaya.

original: nyes par bshad pa yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes kyis mi dge ba'i chos de dag dang du mi len cing sel bar byad do //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes kyis mi dge ba'i chos de dag dang du mi len cing sel bar byad do //
translated: With the perception that it is poorly taught, they do not accept those nonvirtuous qualities and eliminate them.

original: de yang phyi ma @311a * //
analyzed: de yang phyi ma @311a * //
translated: Moreover, in the future

original: la 'dir rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba 'di ni gang zag dang po'o //
analyzed: la 'dir rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba 'di ni gang zag dang po'o //
translated: they will become pure in this life. This is the first person.

original: gzhan yang gang zag kha cig ni sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu chos 'dul ba gnyi ga la spyad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag kha cig ni sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu chos 'dul ba gnyi ga la spyad par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, some people in other previous lives practiced both the well-taught and poorly-taught Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de de'i rgyus tshe 'di la dge ba'i chos rnams dang yang ldan la mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: de de'i rgyus tshe 'di la dge ba'i chos rnams dang yang ldan la mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang yang ldan te /
translated: Due to that, in this life they possess virtuous phenomena and also possess nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: de de ltar yang thog ma kho nar snga ma bzhin du legs par gsungs pa nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar du 'thob ste /
analyzed: de de ltar yang thog ma kho nar snga ma bzhin du legs par gsungs pa nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar du 'thob ste /
translated: As before, they first obtain the well-proclaimed Dharma and so on up to proper mental contemplation.

original: tshe 'di la de'i mi dge ba de dag gsar du ma skyes pas nub par 'gyur la dge ba rnams gsar du skyes pas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la de'i mi dge ba de dag gsar du ma skyes pas nub par 'gyur la dge ba rnams gsar du skyes pas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this life, their nonvirtuous phenomena subside because they do not newly arise and their virtuous phenomena arise because they newly arise.

original: de'i sngon gyi mi dge ba'i rtsa ba bag la nyal gyi tshul gyis gnas pas chad par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de yang de ltar bag yod par gnas pas thams cad kyi thams cad du chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi mi dge ba'i rtsa ba bag la nyal gyi tshul gyis gnas pas chad par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de yang de ltar bag yod par gnas pas thams cad kyi thams cad du chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the nonvirtuous roots that remain in the form of dormant tendencies are severed because they abide heedfully and they are completely severed.

original: de ltar na 'di yang phyi ma la rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di yang phyi ma la rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, they become pure in the future.

original: 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second person.

original: gzhan yang kha cig ni sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu gcig tu nges par phyi rol spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig ni sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu gcig tu nges par phyi rol spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, some people in other previous lives definitely practiced only external conduct.

original: de ni da ltar yang de'i rgyus rab tu 'byung ba la goms pa dang / log par lta ba la goms pas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rkyen tshogs pa dang phrad nas rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni da ltar yang de'i rgyus rab tu 'byung ba la goms pa dang / log par lta ba la goms pas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rkyen tshogs pa dang phrad nas rab tu byung ngo //
translated: Now, due to that cause, they are accustomed to going forth and accustomed to wrong views. Having met with the assembled conditions in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, they go forth.

original: de ltar rab tu byung nas kyang log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung nas kyang log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Having gone forth like that, they will only have wrong views.

original: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pas gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pas gnas so //
translated: They abide in holding their own view as supreme.

original: de'i mtshams med pa'i las kyang byed la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i mtshams med pa'i las kyang byed la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang gcod par byed do //
translated: They also commit the crime of immediate retribution and sever their roots of virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams su gcig tu nges par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams su gcig tu nges par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will definitely become those with non-virtuous qualities.

original: ngan song du 'gro bar nges par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bar nges par yang 'gyur te /
translated: They will definitely go to the lower realms.

original: 'di ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third person.

original: gang zag gsum po de rnams kyi nang na dang po ni sngon 'di'i rgyu la spyod par 'gyur la tshe 'di la ni sngar bag med par 'gyur ba las phyis bag yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gsum po de rnams kyi nang na dang po ni sngon 'di'i rgyu la spyod par 'gyur la tshe 'di la ni sngar bag med par 'gyur ba las phyis bag yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these three types of persons, the first one previously practiced the cause of this life, but later he becomes heedless.

original: gang zag gnyis pa ni sngon 'di dang phyi rol gnyis ka'i rgyu la spyod par gyur la ;
analyzed: gang zag gnyis pa ni sngon 'di dang phyi rol gnyis ka'i rgyu la spyod par gyur la ;
translated: The second one previously practiced the cause of this life and the cause of the next life,

original: tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: but in this life he is definitely heedful.

original: gsum pa ni sngon yang gcig tu nges par phyi rol spyod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sngon yang gcig tu nges par phyi rol spyod par 'gyur la /
translated: The third one previously definitely practiced the cause of the next life,

original: tshe 'di la yang gcig tu nges par bag med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang gcig tu nges par bag med par rig par bya'o //
translated: and in this life he is definitely heedless.

original: gang zag gsum po de dag gi zla yang gang zag gzhan gsum yod de /üîΩde las @311b bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gsum po de dag gi zla yang gang zag gzhan gsum yod de / de las @311b bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: There are three other persons who are the opposites of these three.

original: de la dang po ni sngon phyi rol spyod par gyur la tshe 'di la ni sngar bag yod par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la dang po ni sngon phyi rol spyod par gyur la tshe 'di la ni sngar bag yod par gyur nas /
translated: The first one previously practiced the cause of the next life, but in this life he is heedful.

original: phyis bag med par gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis bag med par gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: Later he becomes heedless.

original: gnyis pa ni sngon 'di dang phyi rol gnyis ka'i rgyu spyod par gyur la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sngon 'di dang phyi rol gnyis ka'i rgyu spyod par gyur la /
translated: The second is one who previously practiced both internal and external causes,

original: tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag med par rig par bya'o //
translated: but in this life is known to be completely heedless.

original: gsum pa ni sngon gcig tu nges par phyi rol gyi rgyu spyod par gyur la tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sngon gcig tu nges par phyi rol gyi rgyu spyod par gyur la tshe 'di la ni gcig tu nges par bag yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The third is one who previously practiced only external causes, but in this life is known to be completely heedful.

original: de la sngon gyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: The internal causes of former virtue and nonvirtue are like seeds.

original: de la sngon gyi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni chos 'dul ba 'di da ltar gyi zhing gshin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni chos 'dul ba 'di da ltar gyi zhing gshin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The present field of the Dharma and Vinaya is like a fertile field for the seeds of former virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni zhing ngan pa lta bu'o //üîΩde las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni zhing ngan pa lta bu'o // de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The field of nonvirtue is like a bad field.üîΩThe opposite is the case for the seeds of former nonvirtue.

original: sngon gyi mi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni da ltar gyi nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba zhing gshin pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: sngon gyi mi dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni da ltar gyi nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba zhing gshin pa lta bu yin la /

original: dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni zhing ngan pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sa bon gyi ni zhing ngan pa lta bu yin no //

original: 'dir dge ba'i chos skye ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i dbang gis byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dge ba'i chos skye ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i dbang gis byung ba yin te /
translated: Here, the arising of wholesome dharmas is due to the power of previous causes.

analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa lta bu'i mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po'i tshul gyis snang ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag ni snang ba lta bu'i dge ba'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These unwholesome dharmas should be known as the adverse side to the wholesome dharmas, which are like light.

original: de ltar na sngon gyi mi dge ba'i chos de dag ni lus dang / sems yongs su gdung ba'i don gyis ma dag me lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon gyi mi dge ba'i chos de dag ni lus dang / sems yongs su gdung ba'i don gyis ma dag me lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, those previous unwholesome dharmas are like fire, in the sense of tormenting the body and mind.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba ni da ltar gyi 'dam bu skam po'i khyim lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba ni da ltar gyi 'dam bu skam po'i khyim lta bu'o //
translated: The badly taught Dharma and Vinaya is like a house of dry reeds in the present.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i sgo nas ma dag med lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i sgo nas ma dag med lta bu'o //
translated: Previous wholesome dharmas are like fire, in the sense of burning afflictions.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba ni de rnams kyi rdo'i sa gzhi dang / ro skam lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba ni de rnams kyi rdo'i sa gzhi dang / ro skam lta bu'o //
translated: The badly taught Dharma and Vinaya is like the rocky ground and dry corpses for those.

original: sngon gyi mi dge ba spangs pas sol ba lta bur gyur ba'i ni chos 'dul ba 'di rdo'i sa gzhi dang / ro skam lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mi dge ba spangs pas sol ba lta bur gyur ba'i ni chos 'dul ba 'di rdo'i sa gzhi dang / ro skam lta bu'o //
translated: The one who has abandoned past nonvirtue is like a burnt seed, and this Dharma-Vinaya is like a dry field.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bla na med pas /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bla na med pas /

original: sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu las yang dag par grub pas dbang po de yang ci rigs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen la /üîΩtshe 'di la rnam par dag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa de dag gi phyi ma la rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon @312a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu las yang dag par grub pas dbang po de yang ci rigs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen la / tshe 'di la rnam par dag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa de dag gi phyi ma la rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon @312a * //
translated: knows those faculties as they are in reality, in accordance with their causes, which are past virtue and nonvirtue.

original: mongs pa'i chos yang dag par skye ba gang yin pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mongs pa'i chos yang dag par skye ba gang yin pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He also knows as it is in reality the future arising of purified and defiled phenomena in those who abide in this life through purification and defilement.

original: de bas na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is said to possess the marvelous and wondrous.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa la ni rnam grangs lnga yod par rig par bya ste /üîΩrnam grangs gang dag gis rang gis yang dag par 'das pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa la ni rnam grangs lnga yod par rig par bya ste / rnam grangs gang dag gis rang gis yang dag par 'das pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: The path that completely transcends the paths that lead to unfortunate realms and the paths that lead to fortunate realms should be known as having five categories.

original: gzhan dag gi yang dag par 'das pa yang rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang dag par 'das pa yang rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: By means of these categories, one should know the path that completely transcends one's own path and the path that completely transcends the paths of others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so //
translated: They are the Buddhas and the Buddhas' disciples.

original: de la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path that leads to unfortunate realms?

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur ba dmigs pa dang bcas shing rten dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la brten nas sdig pa 'dod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur ba dmigs pa dang bcas shing rten dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la brten nas sdig pa 'dod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang /
translated: It is the sinful views that arise from the root of the perishable collection view, which are accompanied by a reference point and accompanied by attachment.

analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams rnam pa du ma nas /
translated: The many kinds of sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas such as killing,

original: mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin du /
translated: as they are described in the sutras,

original: chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang / mi mthun pa spyod pa yan chad kyi bar gyi ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa dang / sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar byad ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang / mi mthun pa spyod pa yan chad kyi bar gyi ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa dang / sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar byad ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: up to the practice of what is not Dharma, the practice of what is not in accord with Dharma, and so on, lead to the lower realms, lead to rebirth in the hells, lead to rebirth in the evil destinies.

original: de la brten nas de dag ngan 'gro rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la brten nas de dag ngan 'gro rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on them, one is born in the lower realms.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni ngan 'gror gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni ngan 'gror gro ba'i lam mo //

original: de la thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni dmigs pa gang las lta bar gyur ba de dag skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi gnas la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa'i gnas sdig pa 'dod pa la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni dmigs pa gang las lta bar gyur ba de dag skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rang gi gnas la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa'i gnas sdig pa 'dod pa la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dang /
translated: any attachment to one‚Äôs own abode, any unwholesome factors such as the desire for evil that lead to the lower realms,üîΩand any abode that, when one dwells in it, will cause one to experience the unpleasant and the karmic maturation of the lower realms‚Äî

original: mi mthun par spyod pa yan chad gang la gnas na mi sdug pa dang / ngan song gi rnam par smin pa de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad la 'di ni bdag gi yang ma yin no //üîΩ'di ni bdag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun par spyod pa yan chad gang la gnas na mi sdug pa dang / ngan song gi rnam par smin pa de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad la 'di ni bdag gi yang ma yin no // 'di ni bdag kyang ma yin te /

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag kyang ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag kyang ma yin no zhes /
translated: They are not the self‚Äôs self.

original: de ltar de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong bas bden pa @312b mngon par rtogs pa'i mod la lta bar gyur ba'i bag la nyal de dag gi rtsa ba yang yang dag par bcom zhing spong bar 'gyur la de dag
analyzed: de ltar de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong bas bden pa @312b mngon par rtogs pa'i mod la lta bar gyur ba'i bag la nyal de dag gi rtsa ba yang yang dag par bcom zhing spong bar 'gyur la de dag
translated: Since they see this correctly and just as it is, the moment they realize the truth, they will destroy and abandon the latent tendencies of the views.

original: kyang gtan du nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyang gtan du nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos de ni lta bar gyur ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de dag gis bar du gcod par 'gyur ba dang / ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin te /

translated: Thus, for noble listeners, these views that arise from the roots of views and that lead to the lower realms are not causes for the lower realms, nor do they create obstacles for them.

analyzed: 'di ni de'i ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i lam bsal bar bya ba'i rnam grangs dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first way to clear the path to the lower realms.

original: des na bdag nyid shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bdag nyid shes par 'gyur te /
translated: They will know themselves:

original: 'di ltar bdag cag la sogs pa 'phags pa nyan thos rnams las gzhan so so'i skye bo 'di dag 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mi dge ba ngan song du 'gro ba'i gnas la yang dag par 'das nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi thob ste /

translated: Thus, ordinary beings other than noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on transcend the worldly path and attain the four abodes of bliss in this life.üîΩ
