analyzed: 'das nas kyang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams kyi zhi ba dang / rnam par grol ba thob mod kyi ;
translated: Thus, ordinary beings other than noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, having transcended the worldly path, attain the four abodes of bliss in this life and having transcended nonvirtue that leads to lower rebirths, they attain peace and liberation of the form and formless realms.

original: de dag ni gtan du ngan 'gro bsal ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de bas na gzhan de dag ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral du zin kyang /

analyzed: re zhig bde bar gnas pas khyad par du 'phags par zad de /
translated: they are superior only in terms of temporary bliss.

original: phyi ma la srog gcod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyi ma la srog gcod par 'gyur la /
translated: In the future, they will kill,

analyzed: bdag cag ni srog gcod par mi 'gyur ba nas de dag gi chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i bar du spyod par 'gyur la /

analyzed: bdag cag ni de ltar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i lam bsal ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚Äúthe path that leads to the lower realms has been removed.‚Äù

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang ; sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis kyang rnam grangs des na bsal ba de de ltar yang dag par mkhyen to //
translated: The Buddhas and the ≈õrƒÅvakas of the Buddhas know this to be so by means of this synonym.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos de'i ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba lus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos de'i ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba lus te /
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvaka has only the path that leads to good rebirths to transcend.

translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvaka does not consider that to be enough. He generates enthusiasm and makes a special effort to eliminate the contaminants.

analyzed: phyir sems bskyed pa'i rnam grangs dang po'o // des sems ched du gtad nas bde 'gro'i srid pa'i ro myang ba de dag thams cad la de nyid nyes dmigs su mthong nas /
translated: This is the first type of generation of the mind that transcends the path leading to good rebirths.

analyzed: mu stegs ya nga las ji lta ba bzhin du sems bzlog nas /

translated: The objects of the experience of pleasure are the cause of the arising of covetousness; the objects of the experience of pain are the cause of the arising of malice; the objects of the experience of neither pleasure nor pain are the cause of the arising of the error of ignorance.

translated: Having accomplished that state, I am able to attain abiding. The cultivation of faith in the path of preparation, which arises with such confidence, is called correct faith in the sense bases.

analyzed: bdag ni snyoms par zhugs so snyam du shes rab kyis mos so //

analyzed: gal te tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ram /

analyzed: mdor bsdu na cung zad la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba'i phyir na mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, it is called unshakable because the meditative stabilization that has a small object is unshakable.

original: de yang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du mthar thug pas na de'i phyir de man chad mi g-yo bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du mthar thug pas na de'i phyir de man chad mi g-yo bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is the culmination of the sphere of infinite consciousness, it is to be known as unshakable from that point on.

original: cung zad la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thams cad kyang gong nas yod pa'i 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag thams cad kyang gong nas yod pa'i 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: All those meditative attainments that have a small object are meditative attainments that have the perception of existence above them.

original: de yan chad ni ci yang med pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa @315a * //
analyzed: de yan chad ni ci yang med pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa @315a * //
translated: From that point on, they are meditative attainments that have the perception of non-existence as their object.

original: yin te ; gong na med pa'i 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yin te ; gong na med pa'i 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is to be known as a meditative attainment that has the perception of non-existence above it.

original: de yan chad ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan chad ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The meditative attainment of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is beyond that.

original: de bas na sgo gsum las lam gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sgo gsum las lam gsum du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the three paths are taught as the three doors.

original: gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kyi sgo gsum nas 'dod pa rnams sun 'byin par byed de sun phyung nas kyang mthar gyis rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du snyoms par 'jug pa de'i phyir yang mi g-yo ba'i skye mched du 'gro ba'i lam gsumüîΩrnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kyi sgo gsum nas 'dod pa rnams sun 'byin par byed de sun phyung nas kyang mthar gyis rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bar du snyoms par 'jug pa de'i phyir yang mi g-yo ba'i skye mched du 'gro ba'i lam gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because the noble disciples, through the three doors, repudiate the sensual desires, and after repudiating them, enter into meditative attainment up to the sphere of infinite consciousness, therefore, the three paths leading to the imperturbable are also established.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du shes ni sa 'og ma thams cad la sun phung nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du shes ni sa 'og ma thams cad la sun phung nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The perception of form and the perception of the imperturbable repudiate all lower levels and enter into meditative attainment in the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'di ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched du 'gro ba'i lam dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched du 'gro ba'i lam dang po'o //
translated: This is the first path leading to the sphere of nothingness.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa'i mtha' ni skye mched de la thug go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam bsgom pa'i mtha' ni skye mched de la thug go //
translated: The end of cultivating the uncontaminated path is reached in that sphere.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam de la yang 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du gong na yod pa dang / gong na med pa yod do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam de la yang 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du gong na yod pa dang / gong na med pa yod do //
translated: That uncontaminated path also exists as higher and as not higher, like the meditative attainment of the summit of existence.

original: de la gong na yod pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gong na yod pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Higher is associated with the aspect of impermanence.

original: gong na med pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Not higher is associated with the aspect of selflessness.

original: de la gong na yod pa'i rnam pas ni sa 'og ma sun phung nas de'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de la gong na yod pa'i rnam pas ni sa 'og ma sun phung nas de'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Through the aspect of higher, one enters meditative attainment on the base of infinite space by denigrating the lower level.

original: gong na med pa'i rnam pas ni 'og ma dang / gong ma dang / de nyid dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par yid la byed pas zag pa med pa'i ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i rnam pas ni 'og ma dang / gong ma dang / de nyid dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par yid la byed pas zag pa med pa'i ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Through the aspect of not higher, one enters meditative attainment on the uncontaminated base of infinite consciousness by mentally engaging in the selflessness of all phenomena of the lower, higher and the same level.

original: gong na med pa'i rnam pa de ni lam gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: gong na med pa'i rnam pa de ni lam gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: That aspect of not higher should be known as the second path.

original: / lam gnyis pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: / lam gnyis pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: That second path is also classified as two types and is posited as two types.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: brten pa dang / rten gyi shes bya'i bye brag go //üîΩde la brten pa'i bdag med pa'i shes pa ni sems can gyi khams gang yang rung ba dang / bdag gang yin pa 'di la bdag gi yul ga ge mo dang / sems can che ge mo dang / pha'am /üîΩma'am / grogs sam /
analyzed: brten pa dang / rten gyi shes bya'i bye brag go // de la brten pa'i bdag med pa'i shes pa ni sems can gyi khams gang yang rung ba dang / bdag gang yin pa 'di la bdag gi yul ga ge mo dang / sems can che ge mo dang / pha'am / ma'am / grogs sam /
translated: the knowledge of the selflessness of the supported and the knowledge of the selflessness of the support.

original: rje bo la sogs pa cung zad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: rje bo la sogs pa cung zad kyang med pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of the supported is the knowledge that in any realm of sentient beings, there is no such thing as a self, or a self of any sentient being, or a self of any person, or a self of any master, or a self of any friend, or a self of any enemy, or a self of any being in any place whatsoever.

original: ji ltar bdag gi ga ge mo dang / che ge mo dang / cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang de rnams kyi ga ge mo dang / che ge @315b mo dang ; cung zad kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi ga ge mo dang / che ge mo dang / cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang de rnams kyi ga ge mo dang / che ge @315b mo dang ; cung zad kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Just as there is no such thing as a self of any person whatsoever, in the same way, there is no such thing as a self of any sentient being whatsoever.

original: rten gyi bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gis 'jig rten stong ste /
analyzed: rten gyi bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gis 'jig rten stong ste /
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of the support is the knowledge that the world is empty of a permanent self and of a self that is the owner.

original: 'di la rtag pa'am bdag gam bdag gi ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la rtag pa'am bdag gam bdag gi ci yang med de /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is permanent, or a self, or the self of anything.

original: chos tsam du zad do //
analyzed: chos tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just a collection of phenomena.

original: de ltar 'jig rten stong pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten stong pa yin na /
translated: If the world is empty in this way,

original: 'di la gang na su zhig ci zhig ga la yod de /
analyzed: 'di la gang na su zhig ci zhig ga la yod de /
translated: What is there? Who is there? Where is there?

original: de bas na shes pa snga ma ni brten pa yin la phyi ma ni rten du gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa snga ma ni brten pa yin la phyi ma ni rten du gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the former cognition is the basis, and the latter is what becomes the basis.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ni zag pa med pa'i lam med de /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ni zag pa med pa'i lam med de /
translated: In the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, there is no uncontaminated path.

original: de bas na ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes sun phyung nas de'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste ;
analyzed: de bas na ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes sun phyung nas de'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug ste ;
translated: Therefore, after refuting the perception of the sphere of nothingness, one enters into the meditative concentration of that sphere.

original: de la ni lam de gcig pu yin no //
analyzed: de la ni lam de gcig pu yin no //
translated: In that case, that is the only path.

original: de la bdag ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la bdag ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: There, May I not become refers to the suffering of suffering such as birth.

original: bdag gir yang ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: bdag gir yang ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: May I not become mine refers to the suffering of suffering such as birth.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par 'dun pa bskyed nas brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par 'dun pa bskyed nas brtson par byed do //
translated: Having generated such a desire, one makes effort.

original: yang dag par brtson na snga phyir khyad par shes nas nges par 'thob par 'gyur te bdag mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par brtson na snga phyir khyad par shes nas nges par 'thob par 'gyur te bdag mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one makes effort, having understood the difference between former and later, one definitely attains I will not become.

original: bdag gir mi 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: I will not have a self.

original: de bas na da ltar gyi tshe 'di la gsar du las byas shing bsags pa ci yod pa dang / las rnying ci byung ba de dag thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de bas na da ltar gyi tshe 'di la gsar du las byas shing bsags pa ci yod pa dang / las rnying ci byung ba de dag thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, whatever new karma I have created and accumulated in this present life, and whatever old karma has arisen, I do not desire the ripening of any of it.

original: mi lta ba'i phyir thams cad spong ba'o //
analyzed: mi lta ba'i phyir thams cad spong ba'o //
translated: I will abandon all of it because I do not look at it.üîΩThe summary:üîΩPresentation, culmination,üîΩunmixed, proper,üîΩdependent origination,

original: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang mthar thug dang // ma 'dres pa dang tshul bzhin dang // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang // bsgom dang dus dang bar du gcod //
analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang mthar thug dang // ma 'dres pa dang tshul bzhin dang // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang // bsgom dang dus dang bar du gcod //
translated: meditation, time, obstacles,

original: rang bzhin bstan dang spong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin bstan dang spong ba'i phyir //
translated: nature, teaching, and abandoning,

original: rtsom dang sgom pa tha ma yin ;üîΩ/ de la rnam par gzhag pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rtsom dang sgom pa tha ma yin ; / de la rnam par gzhag pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: beginning, and meditation are the end.

original: lam gyi yan lag la thug pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi mdo dang rgyas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag la thug pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi mdo dang rgyas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The presentation is the brief and extensive sutras of the thirty-seven factors conducive to awakening, from the four establishments in mindfulness up to the branches of the path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as they are in the Sravakabhumi.

original: shes bya'i gzhi thams cad ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi mthar thug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i gzhi thams cad ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi mthar thug par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the basis of all that is to be known.

original: shes bya'i gzhi'i mthar thug pas ni shes bya'i gzhi mthar thug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i gzhi'i mthar thug pas ni shes bya'i gzhi mthar thug par rig par bya'o //
translated: The basis of all that is to be known is the limit of what is to be known.

original: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi 'grub par bya ba'i @316a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi 'grub par bya ba'i @316a * //
translated: The application to the cultivation of will, vigor, etc. is for the sake of accomplishing the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: phyir yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ma gtogs par de dang mi 'dra ba'i lam mam /
analyzed: phyir yin par rig par bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ma gtogs par de dang mi 'dra ba'i lam mam /
translated: The path is the foundation of all that is to be known.üîΩThere is no other path or objective support on which one might rely in order to attain the extinction of the contaminants and the attainment of nirvana, apart from the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dmigs pa gang la brten na zag pa zad par 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / dmigs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i lam 'di zla med pa yin pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la brten na zag pa zad par 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / dmigs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i lam 'di zla med pa yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, this pure path is without peer.

original: lam 'di ni bgrod pa gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ni bgrod pa gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This path is called the single way.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam des kyang rgyu gnyis kyis sems can rnams rnam par dag par byed de /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam des kyang rgyu gnyis kyis sems can rnams rnam par dag par byed de /
translated: This path of single progress also purifies sentient beings by means of two causes:

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: the power of discernment and the power of cultivation.

original: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is a defiled mental dissatisfaction.

original: drod mi thub ces bya ba ni rgod par gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: drod mi thub ces bya ba ni rgod par gtogs pa ste /
translated: Heat is a mental dissatisfaction belonging to agitation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: It is a defiled mental dissatisfaction in the realm of desire.

original: mya ngan gyi gnas ni 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi gnas ni 'jig rten gyi chos bzhi'o //
translated: The basis of sorrow is the four worldly states.

original: drod mi thub pa'i gnas ni gzhan bzhi po nyid do //
analyzed: drod mi thub pa'i gnas ni gzhan bzhi po nyid do //
translated: The basis of heat is the other four.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brtson pa ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten pas mya ngan dang drod mi thub pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brtson pa ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten pas mya ngan dang drod mi thub pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is diligent in the four foundations of mindfulness, by relying on the power of discernment, will transcend sorrow and heat.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pas ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba spong bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pas ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba spong bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: By the power of mundane meditation, one attains freedom from the attachment of the desire realm, and thus abandons suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: /'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'jig tshogs thams cad las yang dag par 'das pas ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / lam gyi 'bras bu rig pa dang chos rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'jig tshogs thams cad las yang dag par 'das pas ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / lam gyi 'bras bu rig pa dang chos rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of supramundane meditation, one transcends all the perversions of the view of the transitory composite, and thus realizes the eightfold noble path and the knowledge and vision of the fruits of the path.

original: de yang sems can rnams kyi so sor rtogs pa'i stobs dang ; bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can rnams kyi so sor rtogs pa'i stobs dang ; bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should know that the power of discernment and the power of meditation of sentient beings are completely pure in every way.

original: lus la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhi la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nyams su len par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhi la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nyams su len par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one attends improperly to the four objects of observation such as the body, one does not practice the four right efforts.

original: de rnams nyams su mi len na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'phags pa'i rigs pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam skye ba yang nyams su mi len na /
analyzed: de rnams nyams su mi len na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'phags pa'i rigs pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam skye ba yang nyams su mi len na /
translated: If one does not practice those, one does not practice the noble path, the correct view and so on, which arise after the noble lineage and correct reflection.

original: de nyams su ma blangs pas 'phags pa'i lam yang nyams su ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyams su ma blangs pas 'phags pa'i lam yang nyams su ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not practice that, one does not practice the noble path.

original: de nyams su ma blangs pas de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das @316b pa'i bdud rtsi yang nyams su ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyams su ma blangs pas de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das @316b pa'i bdud rtsi yang nyams su ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not practice that, one does not practice the nectar of nirvana, which is the result of that.

original: rnal 'byor ba ni lus la sogs pa rgyu la brten te byung bar rig nas dus gsum gyi lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rtag par rjes su mthong bas gnas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ni lus la sogs pa rgyu la brten te byung bar rig nas dus gsum gyi lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rtag par rjes su mthong bas gnas te /
translated: The yogi, having understood that the body and so on arise in dependence on causes, abides in the view that the phenomena of the body and so on of the three times are impermanent.

original: mi rtag par rjes su mthong bas gnas na /
analyzed: mi rtag par rjes su mthong bas gnas na /
translated: If one abides in the view that they are impermanent,

original: yang na srid par skye ba la yang srid par skye ba'i srid pas rten cing mi gnas la tshe 'di la yang phyi nang gi 'du byed thams cad la bdag gam bdag gir cung zad kyang mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang na srid par skye ba la yang srid par skye ba'i srid pas rten cing mi gnas la tshe 'di la yang phyi nang gi 'du byed thams cad la bdag gam bdag gir cung zad kyang mi 'dzin to //
translated: Or else, he does not dwell in the rebirth process, because he is not reborn in the rebirth process. And in this life, he does not grasp as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine‚Äù any of the internal or external formative forces.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: With regard to those in the future, he sees them as having the nature of origination.

original: 'das pa rnams la ni 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams la ni 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: With regard to those in the past, he sees them as having the nature of destruction.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni byung ba dang de'i 'og tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong bas gnas te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni byung ba dang de'i 'og tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong bas gnas te /
translated: With regard to those in the present, he sees them as having the nature of origination and destruction, because they have originated and will subsequently be destroyed.

original: de thog ma kho nar lus la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams yang dag par rjes su mthong bas mi rtag pa nyid la 'jug go //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar lus la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams yang dag par rjes su mthong bas mi rtag pa nyid la 'jug go //
translated: He enters into the contemplation of impermanence by first correctly seeing the dependent origination of the body, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la zhugs nas sred pa dang lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyangs te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la zhugs nas sred pa dang lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyangs te /
translated: Having entered into impermanence, he purifies his mind from the defilements of craving and views.

original: de shas cher gnas pa 'di ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de shas cher gnas pa 'di ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the completion of proper mental attention.

original: de la brten nas zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la brten nas zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: On the basis of that, he attains the destruction of the contaminants.

original: / chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: / chos rnams ni mdor bsdu na dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: In brief, dharmas are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gang yin pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Among them, those that are favorable to the side of affliction arise from improper mental attention.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Those that are favorable to the side of purification arise from proper mental attention.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa la ni yid la byed pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa la ni yid la byed pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The combination of those two is called the mental attention that arises from both.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i mdo dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i mdo dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sutra on the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness and its extensive version should be understood in this way.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be known as the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i dang po ni da ltar bcom ldan 'das byung nas bstan cing de'i nyan thos rnams kyang sgom par byed pa 'di kho na ma yin te /üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni 'das pa'i dus na yang thog ma med pa'i dus nas byung la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mthar thug pa med @317a * //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i dang po ni da ltar bcom ldan 'das byung nas bstan cing de'i nyan thos rnams kyang sgom par byed pa 'di kho na ma yin te / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni 'das pa'i dus na yang thog ma med pa'i dus nas byung la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mthar thug pa med @317a * //
translated: The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is not only taught by the present Bhagavat and cultivated by his ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩIt should be known that the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness occurred in the past and will occur in the future,

original: par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: par rig par bya'o //
translated: without beginning or end.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshad med pa rnams skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshad med pa rnams skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness are called the ‚Äúcollection of merit‚Äù because they are the basis for the arising of immeasurable mundane and supramundane dharmas in the past, present, and future.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni dge ba'i tshogs de'i bar chad byed pas na mi dge ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni dge ba'i tshogs de'i bar chad byed pas na mi dge ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The five obscurations are called the group of nonvirtues because they obstruct the accumulation of the host of virtues.

original: lus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po rnams kyi bye brag gis mtha' yas pa dang / yul de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pas na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po rnams kyi bye brag gis mtha' yas pa dang / yul de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pas na /
translated: The four dharmas of body, etc., are infinite in their varieties, and the Tathagata's knowledge of them is unobstructed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma is immeasurable.

original: de yang tshig dang don rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: de yang tshig dang don rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu phye'o //
translated: Moreover, it is distinguished by two aspects, the verbal and the meaningful.

original: de la don gyi bye brag ni don de nyid kyang dag par bstan par bya ba la chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de la don gyi bye brag ni don de nyid kyang dag par bstan par bya ba la chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa'o //
translated: The meaningful is the Dharma, the words and letters of which are immeasurable in teaching that very meaning correctly.

original: tshig dang yi ge de yang zlos pa med pa'i phyir gong nas gong du spobs pa tshad med de /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge de yang zlos pa med pa'i phyir gong nas gong du spobs pa tshad med de /
translated: And that verbal expression is immeasurable in its eloquence, since it is without repetition.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma is endowed with the Dharma of wonders and marvels.

original: don gcig la yang tshig dang yi ge zlos pa med pa tshad med pa dag gis yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la yang tshig dang yi ge zlos pa med pa tshad med pa dag gis yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is the same, but the words and letters are not repeated, and because they are taught with immeasurable words.

original: bstan pa'i brda'i don rtogs pa'i shes pas na rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin no ;
analyzed: bstan pa'i brda'i don rtogs pa'i shes pas na rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin no ;
translated: He is endowed with understanding, because he has the knowledge that understands the meaning of the symbols of the teachings.

original: / rang bzhin dang thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi sgo nas ni blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / rang bzhin dang thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi sgo nas ni blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with intelligence, because he has the wisdom that arises from nature, hearing, and reflection.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir na dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir na dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with mindfulness, because he is in meditative equipoise.

original: bden pa khong du chud pas na shes rab dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa khong du chud pas na shes rab dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with wisdom, because he has realized the truths.

original: dang pos ni bstan to //
analyzed: dang pos ni bstan to //
translated: The first verse teaches the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gsum gyis ni bshad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni bshad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other three verses should be understood as explaining the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong sngon thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa tsam du lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong sngon thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa tsam du lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Because the monk, through proper mental attention arisen from previous hearing and reflection, views the body, etc. as just the body, etc. and establishes mindfulness in the body, etc.

original: chos rnams thams cad bdag med par shes nas thos pa dang bsams pa tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /üîΩsems mnyam par gzhag pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro snyam nas ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i phyir rab tu dben par gnas shing lus la sogs pa tsam du dmigs pa kho nas de sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus nang rnam par zhi ba 'ba' zhig
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bdag med par shes nas thos pa dang bsams pa tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te / sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro snyam nas ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i phyir rab tu dben par gnas shing lus la sogs pa tsam du dmigs pa kho nas de sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus nang rnam par zhi ba 'ba' zhig
translated: Having understood that all phenomena are selfless, he does not consider mere learning and reflection to be sufficient.üîΩHe thinks that the mind that is well-equipoised becomes liberated. Therefore, he abides in solitude in order to concentrate the mind.

original: tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the mere observation of the body, etc., his mind becomes completely pacified internally through the nine mental abidings.

original: de'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni rgyu @317b gnyis kyis brtsams pa dang / rab tu brtsams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni rgyu @317b gnyis kyis brtsams pa dang / rab tu brtsams par 'gyur te /
translated: His four applications of mindfulness are undertaken and well-undertaken due to two causes.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir de /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir de /
translated: He understands the correct mental attention and concentration just as they are.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, he reaches the culmination through the correct understanding of wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong ni gnyen po rnam pa gsum la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong ni gnyen po rnam pa gsum la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob par 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / byams pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / byams pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The perception of impermanence, loving-kindness, and the signless.

original: de yang gnyen po rnam pa gsum po des ci rigs par snga ma bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i lus la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i 'du shes dang / de gnyis ka nges par spangs nas /
analyzed: de yang gnyen po rnam pa gsum po des ci rigs par snga ma bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i lus la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i 'du shes dang / de gnyis ka nges par spangs nas /
translated: By means of these three counteragents, he obtains the perception of the unloveliness of the body, etc. as they are appropriate, without difficulty and without hardship.

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyi gnas te /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyi gnas te /
translated: He obtains the state of equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection.

original: des ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, he should be known as one who cultivates the applications of mindfulness.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / rtsa ba la sogs ro myang ba //
analyzed: sdom ni / rtsa ba la sogs ro myang ba //
translated: Tasting the root, etc.üîΩThe difference between the former and the latter,

original: snga ma phyi ma'i khyad par dang // mtshan mar 'dzin dang kun nas dkris //
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma'i khyad par dang // mtshan mar 'dzin dang kun nas dkris //
translated: grasping the sign, and entanglement.

original: 'bras bu yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: and the result is the last.

original: rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dge ba'i tshogs kyi bgegs kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i tshogs su gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dge ba'i tshogs kyi bgegs kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i tshogs su gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three roots should be known as the roots of nonvirtue because they are the basis for the hindrance of the accumulation of virtue, the foundations of mindfulness.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: phyi ma la ngan song gi sdug bsngal la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba dang / tshe 'di la sdug bsngal la gnas pa'i phyir rtog pa'i rtsa ba dang / rtsa ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma la ngan song gi sdug bsngal la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba dang / tshe 'di la sdug bsngal la gnas pa'i phyir rtog pa'i rtsa ba dang / rtsa ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The root of misdeed, because one is situated in the suffering of the unfortunate realms in the future; the root of discursive thought, because one is situated in the suffering of this life; and the root of the root,

original: nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba de dang / rtog pa'i rtsa ba de'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba de dang / rtog pa'i rtsa ba de'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that which is the root of the root of the root of misdeed and the root of discursive thought is called the root of the root.

original: de la chags pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: Among them, the three roots of nonvirtue, desire, etc., are the root of the misdeed of the body, etc.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes gsum ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes gsum ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The three notions of desire, etc. are the roots of the ideas of desire, etc.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni chags pa la sogs pa rtsa ba gsum dang / 'dod pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa'i rtsa ba gsum gyi rtsa ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni chags pa la sogs pa rtsa ba gsum dang / 'dod pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa'i rtsa ba gsum gyi rtsa ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three realms of desire, etc. are the roots of the three attachments, etc. and the roots of the three notions of desire, etc.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la brtson pa'i dge slong ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis @318a * //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la brtson pa'i dge slong ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis @318a * //
translated: The monk who is intent on the applications of mindfulness, by the mundane path,

original: 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par srid pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩdes de'i ro myong bar byang cing /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par srid pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so // des de'i ro myong bar byang cing /
translated: having practiced the separation from desire, etc. up to the attainment of the peak of cyclic existence, abides.üîΩHe relishes that,

original: de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
translated: and is satisfied with just that much.

original: ma thob par thob par bya ba'i phyir gong du rtsol bar yang mi byed pa de ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la skyes bu chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma thob par thob par bya ba'i phyir gong du rtsol bar yang mi byed pa de ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la skyes bu chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: He does not strive higher for the sake of attaining what has not been attained. He is not called a great man in the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is not completely liberated.

original: de las bzlog pa ni skyes bu chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni skyes bu chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the great man.

original: 'di la dge slong lus la sogs pa la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni nang du sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus sems rnam par sdud par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong lus la sogs pa la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni nang du sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus sems rnam par sdud par byed mod kyi /
translated: Here, a monk who dwells observing the body in the body, although he does gather the mind with the nine mental abidings,

original: de'i sems de yang zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lus dang sems kyi rmugs pa dang zhum pa las rnam par grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i sems de yang zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lus dang sems kyi rmugs pa dang zhum pa las rnam par grol ba ma yin no //
translated: his mind is not liberated from the hindrances to serenity, the dullness and agitation of body and mind.

original: rnam par grol bar ma gyur pa'i phyir de ltar mngon par bsdus pa'i sems la /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar ma gyur pa'i phyir de ltar mngon par bsdus pa'i sems la /
translated: Because it is not liberated,

original: lus kyi rmugs pa dang sems kyi zhum pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rmugs pa dang sems kyi zhum pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: dullness and agitation of body and mind arise in the mind that is thus concentrated.

original: gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sems shin tu brtan par gnas pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyas par rig nas /
analyzed: gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sems shin tu brtan par gnas pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyas par rig nas /
translated: If, through the firm abiding of the mind in the foundations of mindfulness, he recognizes the arising of the secondary afflictions,üîΩhe should withdraw the mind from that inward concentration

original: nang du mngon par bsdus pa de las sems de btang ste /
analyzed: nang du mngon par bsdus pa de las sems de btang ste /
translated: and,

original: phyi rol gyi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa'i dmigs pa la sems gtod par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sdug pa'i sdug pa'i mtshan ma de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa'i dmigs pa la sems gtod par byed de /
translated: He focuses his mind on the object that is the sign of external beauty that causes delight, such as the Tathagata, etc., and the aspects of his good qualities.

original: de dmigs pa des mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: de dmigs pa des mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: From that object, supreme delight arises for him, and so on up to:

original: rgyas par rab tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas par rab tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he attains mental equipoise on that object by way of complete attention. He is also liberated from that secondary affliction that is a hindrance to serenity.

original: de nas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de las sems rnam par grol bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de las sems rnam par grol bar rig nas /
translated: Then, knowing that his mind is liberated from that secondary affliction,

original: gang gi don du phyi rol du ched du gtad pa'i don de thob pas na /
analyzed: gang gi don du phyi rol du ched du gtad pa'i don de thob pas na /
translated: he obtains the object for which he directed his mind externally.

original: phyir yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par sdud par byed de /
analyzed: phyir yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par sdud par byed de /
translated: Then, as before, he withdraws his mind.

original: phyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, he is not afflicted by that secondary affliction.

original: des mngon par bsdus nas /
analyzed: des mngon par bsdus nas /
translated: Having withdrawn it,

original: phyi rol du ched du ma gtad par yang bdag ni rnam par grol lo snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: phyi rol du ched du ma gtad par yang bdag ni rnam par grol lo snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: Without deliberately focusing externally, one perfectly and precisely knows, ‚ÄúI am liberated.‚Äù

original: phyi rol du dmigs pa rnam pa la yongs su rtog pa /
analyzed: phyi rol du dmigs pa rnam pa la yongs su rtog pa /
translated: One thoroughly investigates the aspects of external objects.üîΩOne is endowed with effort.

original: 'bad pa dang bcas @318b pa ;
analyzed: 'bad pa dang bcas @318b pa ;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brtson pa'i dge slong lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas la sbyor bar 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brtson pa'i dge slong lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas la sbyor bar 'dod pas ni /
translated: A monk who is striving in the applications of mindfulness and who, on the basis of insight, wishes to cultivate serenity should do so as follows.

original: nang gi zhi gnas la rang gi sems gtad pa las mtshan ma 'di ltar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi zhi gnas la rang gi sems gtad pa las mtshan ma 'di ltar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: He should apprehend the following signs with regard to his own mind that is focused on internal serenity.

original: bdag gis ci zhig yid la byas shing /
analyzed: bdag gis ci zhig yid la byas shing /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat do I attend to?

original: bdag gis ji ltar yid la byas na sems zhi gnas la gtad pa na /
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar yid la byas na sems zhi gnas la gtad pa na /
translated: How do I attend to it?

original: zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi lus dang sems kyi rmugs pa dang zhum pas nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi lus dang sems kyi rmugs pa dang zhum pas nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: When I attend to it, does my mind become afflicted by mental afflictions that are associated with serenity, such as torpor or indolence?‚Äù

original: ci zhig ji ltar yid la byas na ni nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur snyam du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ji ltar yid la byas na ni nye bar nyon mongs par mi 'gyur snyam du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
translated: He should apprehend the signs of what and how he should attend to it so that his mind does not become afflicted.

original: gal te dge slong des de ltar rang gi sems la mtshan ma ma bzung nas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa des sems de nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rig nas /
analyzed: gal te dge slong des de ltar rang gi sems la mtshan ma ma bzung nas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa des sems de nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rig nas /
translated: If that monk does not apprehend the signs of his own mind in this way, then he should recognize that his mind is afflicted by that mental affliction.

original: phyi rol gyi dga' bar byed pa'i dmigs pa las mtshan mar 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dga' bar byed pa'i dmigs pa las mtshan mar 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He grasps the sign from an external object that causes delight.

original: de'i rgyus re zhig des nye ba'i nyon mongs 'byung zhing mngon sum du gyur ba de spong mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i rgyus re zhig des nye ba'i nyon mongs 'byung zhing mngon sum du gyur ba de spong mod kyi /
translated: Because of that, for a while he abandons the secondary defilement that has arisen and becomes manifest.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par bsdus pa na de de bzhin du yang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de nyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing mnyam par gzhog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe yang snga ma bzhin du mngon par bsdus pa na de de bzhin du yang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de nyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing mnyam par gzhog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But when he contracts it as before, he is again defiled by that same secondary defilement and cannot enter into concentration.

original: 'di ltar sngar rang gis sems la mtshan ma ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / bag la nyal ma bton pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar rang gis sems la mtshan ma ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / bag la nyal ma bton pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he did not previously grasp the sign in his mind and did not bring it to mind.

original: de rgyu de dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des phyir zhing bcom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rgyu de dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des phyir zhing bcom par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that cause and because of that secondary defilement, he is again defeated.

original: brod pa'i don ma thob po snyam nas yid mi bde bas phongs par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: brod pa'i don ma thob po snyam nas yid mi bde bas phongs par yang 'gyur la /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI have not attained the goal of delight,‚Äù and he is afflicted by mental dissatisfaction.

original: shin tu yun ring por yang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas de thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu yun ring por yang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas de thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For a very long time he does not attain the inner mental tranquility.

original: zhi gnas la brten pas sngar lhag mthong yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog kyang thob par mi nus te /üîΩnang gi sems kyi zhi gnas ma thob pas ni lhag pa'i sems las byung ba tshe 'di @319a * //
analyzed: zhi gnas la brten pas sngar lhag mthong yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog kyang thob par mi nus te / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas ma thob pas ni lhag pa'i sems las byung ba tshe 'di @319a * //
translated: And because of the power of the previously purified insight, one cannot attain the supreme mindfulness and vigilance that arise from the foundation of serenity.

original: la bde bar gnas bzhi thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la bde bar gnas bzhi thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one has not attained the serenity of the inner mind, one cannot attain the four excellent abodes of ease in this life.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog ma thob pas ni /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog ma thob pas ni /
translated: And because one has not attained the supreme mindfulness and vigilance,

original: sngon thob ma myong ba'i grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon thob ma myong ba'i grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one cannot attain the unsurpassed bliss of the accomplishment that one has not previously attained, which is nirvana.

original: de las bzlog pa thams cad ni dkar po'i phyogs kyis sngon ma thob pa'i grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa thams cad ni dkar po'i phyogs kyis sngon ma thob pa'i grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the attainment of the unsurpassed bliss of the accomplishment that one has not previously attained, up to nirvana.

original: de la g-yos mkhan lta bu'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la g-yos mkhan lta bu'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'o //
translated: In that, the yogƒÅcƒÅra is like the cook.

original: jo bo ji lta bu ni zhi gnas la gtad pa'i sems so //
analyzed: jo bo ji lta bu ni zhi gnas la gtad pa'i sems so //
translated: The lord is the mind focused on serenity.

original: tshod ma lta bu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshod ma lta bu ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The vegetables are like the grasping of signs.

original: zas dang gos rgya chen po lta bu ni nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zas dang gos rgya chen po lta bu ni nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive food and clothing are like the inner mental states of calm, etc.

original: nag po'i phyogs las ni byis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs las ni byis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The black side is to be known as the childish.

original: dkar po'i phyogs las ni mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dge slong so so'i skye bo ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul rgya chen po mngon sum du gyur ba 'am yang na gcig pus gnang ba thob pas na brjed ngas pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i 'du shes
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs las ni mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dge slong so so'i skye bo ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul rgya chen po mngon sum du gyur ba 'am yang na gcig pus gnang ba thob pas na brjed ngas pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i 'du shes
translated: The white side is to be known as the wise.

original: la brten nas 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa drag po skyed par byed do //
analyzed: la brten nas 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa drag po skyed par byed do //
translated: The monk who is an ordinary man and is striving to cultivate the applications of mindfulness, when he encounters extensive objects of attachment, or when he is alone, forgets himself and, on the basis of improper attention, generates a strong entanglement of passion.

original: de kun nas dkris pa de la ngo tsha bas gnas te /
analyzed: de kun nas dkris pa de la ngo tsha bas gnas te /
translated: He abides in shame with regard to that entanglement.

original: bdag nyid skobs su chud pa bzhin du sems pas 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir drag tu 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid skobs su chud pa bzhin du sems pas 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir drag tu 'bad par byed do //
translated: He strives with all his strength to be free from it, thinking of himself as one who is drowning.

original: de ltar byas nas kyang kun nas dkris pa de las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas kyang kun nas dkris pa de las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And by doing so, he becomes free from that entanglement.

original: grol nas kyang de yid bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: grol nas kyang de yid bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: And having become free, he becomes happy.

original: de'i 'og tu yang skyo ba drag por 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang skyo ba drag por 'gyur ro ;
translated: And after that, he becomes very weary.

original: / skyo ba thob nas kyang de'i 'og tu mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyi gshol chen po lta bus rmos shing 'du byed kyis rnam pa thams cad khag ma lta bur brlog  pa na /

translated: And having become weary, then with the great plow of the perception of impermanence, he plows and destroys all the aspects of the compounded into pieces the size of a mere fingernail.

original: bden pa'i tshul ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshul ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa gzhag ste /
translated: And having realized the way of the truth just as it is, he sets his mind on nirvana.

original: slob pa yang spyod pa'i yid la byed pas yul rgya chen po de sdug par yid la byed de /
analyzed: slob pa yang spyod pa'i yid la byed pas yul rgya chen po de sdug par yid la byed de /
translated: And the learner, with the attention of practice, attends to that vast object as pleasant.

original: 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal de ma spangs pas 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa de glo bur du skyes nas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal de ma spangs pas 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa de glo bur du skyes nas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: And because he has not abandoned the latent tendency to passion, that entanglement of passion arises suddenly and becomes manifest.

original: de de la nyes dmigs su lta bas kun nas dkris pa de bag la nyal dang @319b bcas par spang bar bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de de la nyes dmigs su lta bas kun nas dkris pa de bag la nyal dang @319b bcas par spang bar bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Since he views that as a disadvantage, he enters into the meditative absorption of signlessness in order to abandon that fetter together with its latent impressions.

original: de ltar na de lhag ma spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de lhag ma spong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, he abandons the remainder.

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs te spangs pa yang khong du chud nas rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang nyams su myong la /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs te spangs pa yang khong du chud nas rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang nyams su myong la /
translated: Having emerged from that meditative absorption and understood abandonment, he experiences the joy and pleasure of liberation.

original: bdag nyid ni ye shes kyi stobs chen po'i stobs dang ldan la bdud kyi phyogs ni stobs chung bar yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni ye shes kyi stobs chen po'i stobs dang ldan la bdud kyi phyogs ni stobs chung bar yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: He correctly sees that he himself possesses the power of the great strength of wisdom, while the side of Mara is weak.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa de ni mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtha'i 'bras bur 'grub pa yin pas na 'bras bu che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa de ni mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtha'i 'bras bur 'grub pa yin pas na 'bras bu che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the cultivation of the four close mindfulnesses is accomplished as the supreme, distinguished, ultimate result, it should be understood as having a great result.

original: mchog tu bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phan yon 'grub par 'gyur bas na phan yon chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phan yon 'grub par 'gyur bas na phan yon chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the benefits of the special, supreme bliss are accomplished, they should be known as the great benefits.üîΩThe summary verse:

original: sdom ni / slob dpon gangs ri 'dzud pa dang // brtun dang gnas dang rnam par dag / rim pa tshul khrims phun tshogs //
analyzed: sdom ni / slob dpon gangs ri 'dzud pa dang // brtun dang gnas dang rnam par dag / rim pa tshul khrims phun tshogs //
translated: The master, the snow mountain, the river, the diligent one, the place, the pure one, the stages, the morality, the complete one,

original: gra ma ldan pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: gra ma ldan pa tha ma yin //
translated: The one without the faults, and the last one.

original: phyi rol gyi mu stegs can ni rang gi slob ma rnams kyi nang du slob dpon du rnam par 'jig ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mu stegs can ni rang gi slob ma rnams kyi nang du slob dpon du rnam par 'jig ste /
translated: The non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas are destroyed as masters in the midst of their own disciples.

original: rnyed pa 'dod cing bkur sti 'dod nas /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod cing bkur sti 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring gain and desiring honor,üîΩif a son of noble family who desires to benefit himself encounters the conditions there and goes forth, he should say this:

original: rigs kyi bu bdag la phan par 'dod pa zhig der rkyen dang phrad nas rab tu byung ba la 'di skad du khyod tshur nga'i yo byad thams cad la thun mong du longs spyod cing 'dug la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu bdag la phan par 'dod pa zhig der rkyen dang phrad nas rab tu byung ba la 'di skad du khyod tshur nga'i yo byad thams cad la thun mong du longs spyod cing 'dug la /
translated: Come here, enjoy in common all my belongings, and stay.üîΩYou should also praise me to others.

original: khyod kyis nga'i bsngags pa yang gzhan dag la brjod cig / skyon yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis nga'i bsngags pa yang gzhan dag la brjod cig / skyon yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The faults are as follows:

original: bcab pa'i phyir srungs shig / ngas kyang khyod la de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bcab pa'i phyir srungs shig / ngas kyang khyod la de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will do the same for you.‚Äù

original: bdag cag gnyis gcig gis gcig bsrung na /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis gcig gis gcig bsrung na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf we protect each otherüîΩwe will obtain profit and respect from the king, the ministers, and the merchants.‚Äù

original: rgyal po rnams dang zhang blon rnams nas ded dpon rnams kyi bar dag las rnyed pa thob par 'gyur la bkur bar yang 'gyur ro zhes zer la de skad zer ba'i slob dpon de la bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i slob mas 'di skad du de ltar ni
analyzed: rgyal po rnams dang zhang blon rnams nas ded dpon rnams kyi bar dag las rnyed pa thob par 'gyur la bkur bar yang 'gyur ro zhes zer la de skad zer ba'i slob dpon de la bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i slob mas 'di skad du de ltar ni
translated: The disciple who wishes to benefit that teacher should say to him:

original: lta bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: lta bar mi bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not do that!

original: grogs pos bsrungs pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes pa de dag las bdag nyid bsrung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grogs pos bsrungs pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes pa de dag las bdag nyid bsrung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you are protected by a friend, you will not be protected from the faults that lead to the miserable realms.

original: de bas na khyod dang bdag gis kyang bdag nyid de ma yin pa zhig gis bsrung dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na khyod dang bdag gis kyang bdag nyid de ma yin pa zhig gis bsrung dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you and I must protect ourselves.

original: de ma yin pa bdag gis khyod bsrungs sam khyod kyis bdag bsrungs na ni bsrung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras na /
analyzed: de ma yin pa bdag gis khyod bsrungs sam khyod kyis bdag bsrungs na ni bsrung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras na /
translated: If you protect me and I protect you, we will not be protected.‚Äù

original: don de la ni slob ma de nyid rigs par smra ba dang / mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩtshe phyi ma @320a * //
analyzed: don de la ni slob ma de nyid rigs par smra ba dang / mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ste / tshe phyi ma @320a * //
translated: One should know that the disciple is a rational speaker and wise in this matter,

original: ched cher 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ched cher 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is intent on the future.

original: slob dpon gyis byis pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis byis pa yin te /
translated: The teacher is a fool,

original: tshe 'di la ched cher 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la ched cher 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is intent on this present life.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang bcas pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang bcas pas na /
translated: He is accompanied by the afflictions,

original: gzhan la tho 'tshams par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la tho 'tshams par byed do //
translated: and so he is hostile to others.

original: des na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang bsrung ba ma yin la ;
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang bsrung ba ma yin la ;
translated: Therefore, because he is accompanied by the afflictions, he does not protect himself.

original: de'i rgyus gzhan la rnam par mtho btsams pas gzhan dag kyang bsrung ba ma yin no //üîΩde la snga ma bzhin du kun du brten pa la sogs pas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyus gzhan la rnam par mtho btsams pas gzhan dag kyang bsrung ba ma yin no // de la snga ma bzhin du kun du brten pa la sogs pas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: And because he is hostile to others, he does not protect others.

original: bdag bsrung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, he protects himself by means of the prior practice of the virtues of abandoning the afflictions, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu de spang ba'i rgyu las byung ba gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa la sogs pas ni gzhan yang bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de spang ba'i rgyu las byung ba gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa la sogs pas ni gzhan yang bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: He protects others by means of the subsequent practice of the virtues of not being hostile to others, etc.

original: de la khro ba mi skyed pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba gnyis ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la khro ba mi skyed pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba gnyis ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The two, not being angry and not harming, should be known as the meaning of not being violent.

original: rjes su snying brtse ba ni phan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rjes su snying brtse ba ni phan pa'i sems so //

original: byams pa'i sems ni bde ba'i sems so //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems ni bde ba'i sems so //

original: rjes su snying brtse ba dang byams pa'i sems gnyis ni snying brtse ba'i don du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su snying brtse ba dang byams pa'i sems gnyis ni snying brtse ba'i don du rig par bya ste /
translated: The two, the thought of compassion and the thought of loving kindness, should be known as the meaning of compassion.

original: snying brtse na gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par mi 'gyur ta /
analyzed: snying brtse na gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par mi 'gyur ta /
translated: When one has compassion, one does not harm others.

original: de bas na 'di dag thams cad ni snying brtse ba'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag thams cad ni snying brtse ba'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all of these should be known as synonyms for compassion.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni gangs kyi ri lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni gangs kyi ri lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya should be known as being like the Himalayas.

original: de la yang cha gsum yod do //
analyzed: de la yang cha gsum yod do //
translated: And there are three parts to that.

original: mi slob pa'i sa dang / slob pa'i sa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sa dang / slob pa'i sa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of no-more-learning, the stage of learning, and the stage of ordinary beings.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni spre'u lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni spre'u lta bu'o //
translated: The mind that is associated with incorrect mental activity is like a monkey.

original: bdud ni rngon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdud ni rngon pa lta bu'o //
translated: The demon is like a hunter.

original: de la mi slob pa'i sa la ni gnyis ka'i gnas med do ;
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i sa la ni gnyis ka'i gnas med do ;
translated: On the stage of the adept, there is no place for either of them.

original: / slob pa'i sa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems spre'u lta bu gcig gi gnas ni yod la /
analyzed: / slob pa'i sa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yin la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems spre'u lta bu gcig gi gnas ni yod la /
translated: For the nonreturners on the stage of the adept, there is a place for the one-pointed mind like a monkey, which is associated with the activity of incorrect mental placement.

original: bdud rngon pa lta bu'i ni med do //
analyzed: bdud rngon pa lta bu'i ni med do //
translated: But there is no place for the demon like a hunter.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa la ni gnyis ka'i gnas yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa la ni gnyis ka'i gnas yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage of the ordinary person, there is a place for both of them.

original: de la byis pa ni yul gzhan gyis yul gzhan la sa nges par 'byung bar blta ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa ni yul gzhan gyis yul gzhan la sa nges par 'byung bar blta ste /

analyzed: yul gzhan yongs su tshol ba na yang yul gzhan gyis bcing bar 'gyur te /

original: de bas na yul las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yul las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he is not liberated from place.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / 'chad pa dang / don rtog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun @320b pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa rnams kyis ni 'dzud pa dang / 'dul ba dang / gzhag pa dang / dgod pa'i don du go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩchos gsum gyis ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa rgya chen po yang spong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / 'chad pa dang / don rtog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun @320b pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa rnams kyis ni 'dzud pa dang / 'dul ba dang / gzhag pa dang / dgod pa'i don du go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o // chos gsum gyis ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa rgya chen po yang spong bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / bag yod pa'i stobs dang / gnyen po'i stobs so //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni gus par bsgom par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no //

translated: The abode of MƒÅra is the desire realm,

analyzed: gang las phyir mi 'ong ba 'das par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: from which non-returners depart.

original: 'chi bdag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad de gang las dgra bcom pa 'das par 'gyur ba yin no /

original: gang las shes nas dad pa zhes 'byung ba ni sems can rnam par ma dag pa rnams rnam par dag par bya ba dang / rnam par dag pa rnams yongs su byung bar bya ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: gang las shes nas dad pa zhes 'byung ba ni sems can rnam par ma dag pa rnams rnam par dag par bya ba dang / rnam par dag pa rnams yongs su byung bar bya ba'i phyir te ;
translated: It is for the sake of purifying sentient beings who are impure and for the sake of liberating those who are pure.

original: de las slob pa gong ma ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de las slob pa gong ma ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The higher training in the latter is purification.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis rnam par dag pa'i slob pa de rnams kyi yin par rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis rnam par dag pa'i slob pa de rnams kyi yin par rig par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is for those who are training in purification by the path of meditation.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la ni rim pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la ni rim pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness should be known to have five stages:

original: dad pa'i sgo nas nges par 'byung ba dang / tshul khrims bsdams pa dang / dbang po bsdams pa dang / rab tu dben par gnas pa dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'o //
