analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la ni 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul bsgrub pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa med do //
translated: Those outside the noble path do not cultivate the bases of psychic power in order to attain the noble superknowledges.

original: 'phags pa ni 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs nas 'dod na tshe'i 'du byed rnams rnam par bskyed nas bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs nas 'dod na tshe'i 'du byed rnams rnam par bskyed nas bskal pa'am /
translated: The noble ones, having attained the noble superknowledges, if they wish, can extend the life-forming forces,

original: bskal pa las lhag pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag pa ste /
translated: either for an eon or more than an eon,

original: bskal pa de'i 'og tu yang gnas so //
analyzed: bskal pa de'i 'og tu yang gnas so //
translated: and they can remain for the remainder of that eon.

original: gang zag rigs shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa la ni dbyig tu gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag rigs shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa la ni dbyig tu gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have become very pure in their spiritual lineage are called ‚Äúthose who have become the essence.‚Äù

original: de yang chos 'di pa 'ba' zhig yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chos 'di pa 'ba' zhig yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being only of this Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i sprul pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang rnam pa ni sprul mi nus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sprul pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang rnam pa ni sprul mi nus te /
translated: The noble ones cannot manifest emanations by means of the superknowledge of supernormal powers.

original: dbang po dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / las dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / las dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: the faculties, the mind and mental factors, actions, and the results of actions.

original: de la las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin las gzhan du yongs su bsgrub ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bar gzhan du bsgyur mi nus @323b so ;üîΩ/ bde pa myong bar 'gyur ba sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bar bsgyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur bar bsgyur mi nus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin las gzhan du yongs su bsgrub ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bar gzhan du bsgyur mi nus @323b so ; / bde pa myong bar 'gyur ba sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bar bsgyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur bar bsgyur mi nus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the action that is to be experienced as pleasure cannot be transformed into the experience of pain by the power of magic or spells.üîΩJust as the action to be experienced as pleasure cannot be transformed into the experience of pain, so also the action to be experienced as pain cannot be transformed into the experience of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de ni gtan du sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de ni gtan du sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: The action to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain can be transformed into the experience of pleasure or pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin par myong bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin par myong bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur cig ce'am /
translated: But it cannot be transformed into the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba myong bar ma gyur cig ces bya bar yang byin gyis brlab pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlab par mi nus so //üîΩtshe 'di la myong bar gyur pa'i las gang yin pa de tshe phyi ma la myong bar gyur cing ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba myong bar ma gyur cig ces bya bar yang byin gyis brlab pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlab par mi nus so // tshe 'di la myong bar gyur pa'i las gang yin pa de tshe phyi ma la myong bar gyur cing ces bya ba'am /
translated: It is not possible to bless the experience of neither pleasure nor suffering by blessing it with the superknowledge of creative magical transformation.

original: yang na tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tshe 'di la myong bar gyur cig ces bya bar yang dus gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis yongs su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: yang na tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tshe 'di la myong bar gyur cig ces bya bar yang dus gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis yongs su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to transform the karma to be experienced in this life into karma to be experienced in the next life, or vice versa, by the superknowledge of transforming the time of experiencing karma.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang spyod yul gyi //
analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang spyod yul gyi //
translated: The best are those who are established in the object of wisdom,

original: yul dang shes rab dbang po gtso //
analyzed: yul dang shes rab dbang po gtso //
translated: the field of the highest wisdom,

original: phyi rol so so'i skye bo yi //
analyzed: phyi rol so so'i skye bo yi //
translated: who are not ordinary beings,

original: phyogs la gnas pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: phyogs la gnas pa tha ma yin //
translated: but abide in the stage of the noble ones.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni mdor bsdu na gnas drug gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩyul 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgyu gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba'i rgyur las kyi mtha' tha dad pa la sbyor ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i sngon gyi las byas pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni mdor bsdu na gnas drug gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste / yul 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgyu gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba'i rgyur las kyi mtha' tha dad pa la sbyor ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i sngon gyi las byas pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dang /
translated: The twenty-two faculties are to be understood as being established in six ways.

original: las gsar du byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: las gsar du byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are: the faculty of acquiring, the faculty of perfect knowledge, the faculty of having understood, the faculty of the knower, the faculty of the seer, the faculty of the hearer, the faculty of the thinker, the faculty of the knower, the faculty of the toucher, the faculty of the cognizer, the faculty of the male, the faculty of the female, the faculty of life, the faculty of suffering, the faculty of satisfaction, the faculty of dissatisfaction, the faculty of equanimity, the faculty of faith, the faculty of vigor, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom, the faculty of final and complete knowledge, and the faculty of final and complete knowing.

original: de la mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i dbang po rnams ni yul 'dzin pa la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i dbang po rnams ni yul 'dzin pa la dbang byed do //
translated: The five faculties of the eye, etc., are dominant in the apprehension of their respective objects.üîΩThe two faculties of male and female are dominant in the continuity of the family line through sons and daughters.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gnyis ni rigs kyi rgyud gnas pa la bu dang tsha bo'i sgo nas dbang byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gnyis ni rigs kyi rgyud gnas pa la bu dang tsha bo'i sgo nas dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty of life is dominant in maintaining the continuity of the aggregates.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni 'tsho ba'i rgyur 'tsho ba sgrub 'dod pa rnams kyi las kyi mtha' tha dad pa la sbyor ba la skyes bu'i byed pas dbang byed do //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa nas btang snyoms la thug pa'i dbang po rnams ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i sngon gyi las kyi @324a * //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni 'tsho ba'i rgyur 'tsho ba sgrub 'dod pa rnams kyi las kyi mtha' tha dad pa la sbyor ba la skyes bu'i byed pas dbang byed do // bde ba la sogs pa nas btang snyoms la thug pa'i dbang po rnams ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i sngon gyi las kyi @324a * //
translated: The faculty of life force is the controlling faculty of the person in the performance of various actions that are the cause of life, since it is the basis of the life faculty.

original: 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dang / las gsar du byed pa la dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la longs spyod pa dang / las gsar du byed pa la dbang byed do //
translated: The faculties of pleasure, etc., up to equanimity are the controlling faculties with regard to the enjoyment of the results of former actions that are agreeable or disagreeable, and with regard to the performance of new actions.

original: dad pa la sogs pa nas shes rab la thug pa'i dbang po lnga ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bal dbang byed do //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa nas shes rab la thug pa'i dbang po lnga ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bal dbang byed do //
translated: The five faculties beginning with faith are the controlling faculties with regard to the detachment of the world.

original: zag pa med pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa gsum ste /
translated: Three are pure.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gtan du mthar thug pa la dbang byed do //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gtan du mthar thug pa la dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty of producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge, and the faculty of possessing complete knowledge are the faculties that control the final, complete, and permanent separation from the passions in the supramundane path.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi don ni de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi don ni de tsam du zad de /
translated: The mundane goal of the world is just this:

original: de la 'jig rten snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the world is illuminated by this goal.

original: don de yang dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: don de yang dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: And this goal is completely fulfilled by the twenty-two faculties.

original: de bas na dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis dbang po thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis dbang po thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, all faculties are included in the twenty-two faculties.

original: kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some think that

original: gal te nang gi bdag gang dbang po 'di drug gi sgo nas yul la spyod pa de lta bu 'ga' zhig med de /
analyzed: gal te nang gi bdag gang dbang po 'di drug gi sgo nas yul la spyod pa de lta bu 'ga' zhig med de /
translated: if there were an inner self that experiences objects through the six faculties,

original: dbang po drug po de dag nyid spyod yul sna tshogs pa dang / yul sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin du zin na /
analyzed: dbang po drug po de dag nyid spyod yul sna tshogs pa dang / yul sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin du zin na /
translated: then the six faculties would have various domains and various objects.

original: de lta na ni gal te dbang po drug po rnams rang gi yul nyams su myong bar zad na /
analyzed: de lta na ni gal te dbang po drug po rnams rang gi yul nyams su myong bar zad na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf the six faculties only experience their own objects,

original: dbang po drug po 'di rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul sus nyams su myong bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dbang po drug po 'di rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul sus nyams su myong bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: then who experiences the objects that are the domain of activity of these six faculties?‚Äù

original: de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par mi shes pas 'du byed rnams la de ltar phyin ci log tu rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par mi shes pas 'du byed rnams la de ltar phyin ci log tu rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that this is a mistaken conception about formations due to not understanding dependent origination.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is dependent origination:

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa nang gi dbang po drug la tshul bzhin du dmigs pa bcas nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa nang gi dbang po drug la tshul bzhin du dmigs pa bcas nas /
translated: When a yogi properly focuses on the six internal faculties

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la zhugs na de'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gis dbang po drug po de rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la zhugs na de'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gis dbang po drug po de rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: and engages in cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness, then those four establishments of mindfulness experience the objects that are the domain of activity of those six faculties.

original: de dag kyang de rnams rnam par dag pa la brten nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de rnams rnam par dag pa la brten nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And they will certainly attain liberation by relying on the purification of those.

original: des dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag nyid bsgoms nas /
analyzed: des dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag nyid bsgoms nas /
translated: Having cultivated those four establishments of mindfulness,

original: bden pa khong du chud ma thag tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa khong du chud ma thag tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: immediately upon understanding the truths, they will attain the seven factors of awakening.

original: de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag de dag gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul bden pa yang dag par nyams su myong bar @324b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag de dag gis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de rnams kyi spyod yul gyi yul bden pa yang dag par nyams su myong bar @324b 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, through those factors of awakening, they will experience the objects that are the domain of those establishments of mindfulness, the truths.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag de dag kun du bsten pa'i rgyus rig pa dang rnam par grol ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag de dag kun du bsten pa'i rgyus rig pa dang rnam par grol ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the cause of fully relying on those factors of awakening, knowledge and liberation will arise.

original: da'i tshe rig pa dang rnam par grol ba des byang chub kyi yan lag de dag legs par bsgoms pas gong du bsgom par bya ba med do snyam du spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da'i tshe rig pa dang rnam par grol ba des byang chub kyi yan lag de dag legs par bsgoms pas gong du bsgom par bya ba med do snyam du spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, through that knowledge and liberation, they will experience the objects that are the domain of those factors of awakening, thinking, 'Since I have well cultivated those factors of awakening, there is nothing higher to cultivate.'

original: des nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par spangs pas na nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has completely abandoned all afflictions, he has no pride in that nirvƒÅ·πáa in which all afflictions have been abandoned.

original: de nga rgyal med pas rig pa dang rnam par grol ba yod pa de dag la rig pa dang rnam par grol ba de ni yod de /
analyzed: de nga rgyal med pas rig pa dang rnam par grol ba yod pa de dag la rig pa dang rnam par grol ba de ni yod de /
translated: Since he has no pride, he has knowledge and liberation. He experiences the object of the domain of that knowledge and liberation.

original: bdag gis thob po snyam du spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis thob po snyam du spyod yul gyi yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI have attained it.‚Äù

original: de yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rig pa dang rnam par grol ba las kyang nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rig pa dang rnam par grol ba las kyang nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: And since it is the definite emergence from all conditioned phenomena, it should be understood that it is also the definite emergence from knowledge and liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyi ga'i gdags pa med de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyi ga'i gdags pa med de /
translated: In nirvƒÅ·πáa, there is no designation of either the object apprehended or the subject that apprehends.

original: spros pa thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all conceptual elaborations have ceased.

original: de bas na 'dus byas ji srid yod kyi bar du gong nas gong du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa yod par 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas ji srid yod kyi bar du gong nas gong du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa yod par 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, as long as there is the conditioned, it is tenable that there is the higher and higher grasping and being grasped, the asking and answering.

original: 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But in the unconditioned, nirvana, it is only improper.

original: de bas na bdag gi ni med kyi /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, there is no self,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa tsam dang / rnam par byang ba tsam du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa tsam dang / rnam par byang ba tsam du bstan pa yin no //
translated: but only defilement and purification.

original: skyes bu gang zag shes rab dang ldan pa dbang po gsal ba'i rang bzhin can ni so sor brtags nas tshul bzhin du chos rnams yid la byas pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par yid ches pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag shes rab dang ldan pa dbang po gsal ba'i rang bzhin can ni so sor brtags nas tshul bzhin du chos rnams yid la byas pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par yid ches pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise person, the person of clear faculties, having examined, properly attends to the dharmas, and thus attains faith in nirvana.

original: de la brten nas brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la brten nas brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: On the basis of that, he exerts effort.

original: de la brten nas lus la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de la brten nas lus la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa 'jog par byed do //
translated: On the basis of that, he establishes mindfulness on the object, the body, etc.

original: de la brten nas sems kyi dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu byed do //
analyzed: de la brten nas sems kyi dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu byed do //
translated: On the basis of that, one-pointedly focuses the mind on the object of meditation.

original: de la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ste /
translated: On the basis of that, one knows and sees reality just as it is.

original: de nyid kyis mthar thug par 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mthar thug par 'gro'o //
translated: By that alone, one goes to the ultimate.

original: de bas na dang po nas kyang shes rab dben pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na dang po nas kyang shes rab dben pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, from the beginning, wisdom is secluded.

original: tha mar yang shes rab dben pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi dbang po gtso bo zhes bya'o //üîΩde bzhin gshegs @325a * //
analyzed: tha mar yang shes rab dben pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi dbang po gtso bo zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs @325a * //
translated: And in the end, wisdom is secluded. For that reason, the faculty of wisdom is called the principal one.

original: pa rnams kyi byang chub las brtsams te /
analyzed: pa rnams kyi byang chub las brtsams te /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, beginning with their enlightenment,

original: dad pa nas shes rab kyi bar dang / tha na 'jig rten pa'i thob pa gang yin pa de yang su la med pa de ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa nas shes rab kyi bar dang / tha na 'jig rten pa'i thob pa gang yin pa de yang su la med pa de ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: have faith up to wisdom, and even worldly attainments. Whoever does not have that should be known as abiding in the side of ordinary beings outside this [Buddhist] teaching.

original: gang la 'jig rten pa ni yod la /
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten pa ni yod la /
translated: Whoever has worldly [attainments] and

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni med pa de ni 'dir so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni med pa de ni 'dir so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The supramundane is not nonexistent. It is present in the stage of the ordinary man.

original: phyi rol pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not present in the heretic.

original: gang la 'jig rten las 'das pa yod pa de ni thams cad kyi thams cad du so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa ma yin pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten las 'das pa yod pa de ni thams cad kyi thams cad du so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa ma yin pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that whoever has the supramundane is not at all present in the stage of the ordinary man.üîΩThe summary verse:

original: sdom ni / so sor brtags dang blo dang ni //
analyzed: sdom ni / so sor brtags dang blo dang ni //
translated: The power of discernment, the power of mind,üîΩthe power of the king of the field,

original: yul 'khor rgyal por bcas pa dang // dgra bcom pa dang slob pa dang // drang po yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: yul 'khor rgyal por bcas pa dang // dgra bcom pa dang slob pa dang // drang po yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: the power of the arhat, the power of the learner,üîΩand the power of the straight one are the last.

original: mdor bsdu na tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes par spyod pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas so sor brtags te nye bar spyod pa las ldog pa dang / legs par spyod pa bsgoms pa ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes par spyod pa la nyes dmigs su mthong nas so sor brtags te nye bar spyod pa las ldog pa dang / legs par spyod pa bsgoms pa ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs yin no //
translated: In brief, the power of discernment is the turning away from evil conduct in this life and the next, through seeing the danger in it, and the cultivation of good conduct.

original: stobs de ni don gnyis sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: stobs de ni don gnyis sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This power accomplishes two aims.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: going to good destinies, and attaining complete nirvana in this life.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: The power of cultivation is the function of the basis for the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness that are included in the power of cultivation.

original: de la brten nas kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa'i stobs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni bsgoms pa'i stobs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And based on that, the power of cultivation should be understood as the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment such as the applications of mindfulness.

original: ngo tsha ba'i gnas rnam pa gsum ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs de'i grogs kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba'i gnas rnam pa gsum ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs de'i grogs kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The three bases of shame are the function of assisting that power of investigation.

original: 'jig rten na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams dang / bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i lha pha rol gyi sems shes pa dag yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams dang / bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i lha pha rol gyi sems shes pa dag yod de /
translated: In the world, there are the Blessed One's ≈õrƒÅvakas and gods who delight in the teaching and know the minds of others.

original: de rnams kyis bdag smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gzhan la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bdag smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gzhan la gnas pa ste /
translated: Thinking They will despise me, is shame based on others.

original: gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: gnas dang po'o //
translated: This is the first basis.

original: rkyen du ma bab pa kun du spyod pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kyis bdag smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gnas gnyis pa'o //üîΩlegs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa yod de /
analyzed: rkyen du ma bab pa kun du spyod pa'i rgyus bdag nyid kyis bdag smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gnas gnyis pa'o // legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa yod de /
translated: The second case is when one reproaches oneself because of having done something wrong, even though no one else has found out about it.üîΩThe third case is when one thinks, ‚ÄúIn this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, there is pure conduct;

original: chos 'di ni tshangs par spyod pa la bar du gcod pa yin no snyam pa ni gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di ni tshangs par spyod pa la bar du gcod pa yin no snyam pa ni gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: but this is an obstacle to pure conduct.‚Äù

original: ngo tsha ba de rnams kyi gnas gsum pa ni dbang gis byung ba @325b gsum yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba de rnams kyi gnas gsum pa ni dbang gis byung ba @325b gsum yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The third case of these three cases of conscience should be understood as being due to three kinds of power:

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang gis byung ba dang / bdag gi dbang gis byung ba dang / chos kyi dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang gis byung ba dang / bdag gi dbang gis byung ba dang / chos kyi dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: the power of the world, the power of oneself, and the power of the Dharma.

original: bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa dang // gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas stobs bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa dang // gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas stobs bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four powers should be understood as being established in terms of accomplishing benefit for oneself and accomplishing benefit for others.

original: blo dang brtson 'grus dang / nam thob pa med pa dang / bsdu ba'i stobs rnams so //
analyzed: blo dang brtson 'grus dang / nam thob pa med pa dang / bsdu ba'i stobs rnams so //
translated: They are the power of the mind, the power of striving, the power of obtaining, and the power of collection.

original: de la tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa yang rang gi don yin no //
analyzed: de la tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa yang rang gi don yin no //
translated: Nirvana in this life is also one's own aim.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba yang rang gi don yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba yang rang gi don yin no //
translated: Going to heaven is also one's own aim.

original: de la rang gi don dang po'i sgo na ni blo dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs gnyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi don dang po'i sgo na ni blo dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs gnyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Among these, the first kind of one's own aim is established as the power of mind and the power of effort.

original: de gnyis ka yang thabs dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang thabs dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that both of these are effort with means.

original: rang gi don cig shos kyi sgo nas ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i stobs rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rang gi don cig shos kyi sgo nas ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i stobs rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The other kind of one's own aim is established as the power of non-transgression.

original: stobs 'di gsum gyis rang gi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: stobs 'di gsum gyis rang gi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: By these three powers, all one's own aims are fulfilled.

original: gzhan la phan par 'dod pa rnams kyi ni gzhan gyi don lus te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par 'dod pa rnams kyi ni gzhan gyi don lus te /
translated: The aim of others is the aim of those who desire to benefit others.

original: de'i sgo nas ni bsdu ba'i stobs rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni bsdu ba'i stobs rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The powers of attraction are established by way of that.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The means of attraction are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are described in the Bodhisattva Stages.

original: yul 'khor rgyal po dang bcas pa /
analyzed: yul 'khor rgyal po dang bcas pa /
translated: the king and his retinue,

original: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang bcas pa /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang bcas pa /
translated: men and women, boys and girls,

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa dang bcas pa /
translated: the ignorant and the wise,üîΩthe laity and the ordained.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dang bcas pa'i sgo nas ni stobs bcu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dang bcas pa'i sgo nas ni stobs bcu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten powers are to be understood as being established in this way.

original: rgyal po rnams ni dbang phyug gi stobs can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po rnams ni dbang phyug gi stobs can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The sutra states that kings have the power of sovereignty, and so on.

original: stobs brgyad dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa ni /
analyzed: stobs brgyad dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa ni /
translated: The arhat who possesses the eight powers

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus bar zad pa dang nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus bar zad pa dang nyams su myong ste /
translated: experiences the complete exhaustion of all attachment, aversion, and ignorance.

original: sdig pa gang yin pa de ni mi byed la dge ba la ni brten to //
analyzed: sdig pa gang yin pa de ni mi byed la dge ba la ni brten to //
translated: He does not commit any evil, but relies on virtue.

original: dben pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems gzhol bas na /
analyzed: dben pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems gzhol bas na /
translated: Since his mind is directed toward solitude, emancipation, and nirvana,

original: yang srid pa'i skye ba la mi phyogs so //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i skye ba la mi phyogs so //
translated: he does not turn toward rebirth in any existence.

original: de la mi phyogs pas na de'i rgyus sdig pa'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: de la mi phyogs pas na de'i rgyus sdig pa'i las mi byed do //
translated: Since he does not turn toward them, he does not commit evil actions on their account.

original: 'dod pa me mdag dong lta bur mthong bas na 'dod pa la mi phyogs so /
analyzed: 'dod pa me mdag dong lta bur mthong bas na 'dod pa la mi phyogs so /
translated: Since he sees sense-objects as like a pit of burning embers, he does not turn toward sense-objects.

original: de la mi phyogs pas na de'i rgyus sdig pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de la mi phyogs pas na de'i rgyus sdig pa mi byed do //
translated: Since he does not turn toward them, he does not commit evil actions on their account.

original: de stobs de gnyis kyis sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed la mi @326a * //
analyzed: de stobs de gnyis kyis sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed la mi @326a * //
translated: By means of these two powers, he does not commit any evil action.

original: byed pas sgo drug nas dge ba la brten te /
analyzed: byed pas sgo drug nas dge ba la brten te /
translated: Since he does not commit them, he relies on the wholesome through the six doors.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: They are the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of spiritual success, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams dang nyid kyis bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa'i khyad par gleng bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams dang nyid kyis bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa'i khyad par gleng bar bzhed nas /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, wishing to teach the difference between the disciples and himself, in that he is engaged in benefiting himself and others,

original: de'i phyir slob pa rnams kyi stobs ni lnga po 'di dag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob pa rnams kyi stobs ni lnga po 'di dag go //
translated: said: ‚ÄúThe power of the disciples is these five.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ni bcu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ni bcu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The powers of the Tathagata are ten.

original: de la slob pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa dag la phan pa la zhugs pa'i nyan thos ni 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa thob ma thag tu rang gi don yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: de la slob pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa dag la phan pa la zhugs pa'i nyan thos ni 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa thob ma thag tu rang gi don yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: The Sravaka who is engaged in benefiting himself possesses the five powers of the trainee and, having attained the supreme fruit of Arhatship, he has completely fulfilled his own aim.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dgra bcom pa brnyes nas stobs bcus gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dgra bcom pa brnyes nas stobs bcus gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata, having attained Arhatship, is engaged in benefiting others through the ten powers.

original: gzhan la phan pa nyid de'i rang gi don yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa nyid de'i rang gi don yin no //
translated: Benefiting others is his own aim.

original: de ni gang gi tshe 'dul ba'i bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe 'dul ba'i bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: When he has completely fulfilled all the activities of disciplining,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de'i tshe /üîΩbya ba byas pa /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de'i tshe / bya ba byas pa /
translated: then he passes into final Nirvana in the element of Nirvana which leaves no aggregates behind.

original: don yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: At that time, he is to be known as one who has done his dutyüîΩand has completely fulfilled his aim.

original: de ni dgra bcom pa rang gi don la zhugs pa gang yin pa dang ; gzhan gyi don de nyid de'i rang gi don yin pa de'i phyir rgyu 'di gnyis kyis kyang nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom pa rang gi don la zhugs pa gang yin pa dang ; gzhan gyi don de nyid de'i rang gi don yin pa de'i phyir rgyu 'di gnyis kyis kyang nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Because the Arhats are intent on their own welfare, and the welfare of others is their own welfare. For these two reasons, they are superior to the Sravakas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rgyas par rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rgyas par rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata should be understood in detail as they are presented in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: gang zag bdag la phan par 'dod pa g-yo med pa sgyu can ma yin pa drang po rang gi don rtogs par 'dod pa'i rgyu bzhis nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la bslu par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //üîΩlegs par gsungs pa la ni slu ba med do //
analyzed: gang zag bdag la phan par 'dod pa g-yo med pa sgyu can ma yin pa drang po rang gi don rtogs par 'dod pa'i rgyu bzhis nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la bslu par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // legs par gsungs pa la ni slu ba med do //
translated: The four reasons why the Dharma and Vinaya are well-proclaimed should be understood as the four reasons why the Dharma and Vinaya are not deceptive to those who have entered on it.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four reasons?üîΩThe Dharma and Vinaya are well-proclaimed because it is not deceptive with regard to the goal, because it is not deceptive with regard to the path, because it is not deceptive with regard to the immediate experience of the attainments, and because it is not deceptive with regard to the distinctions within the attainments.üîΩThe Dharma and Vinaya that is badly taught is deceptive in four ways to those who have entered on it.üîΩWhat are the four reasons?

original: dam pa'i chos bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / rtogs pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the holy Dharma, the right advice, the right instruction, the right understanding, and the right realization.

original: de la mos pa'i gnas ni dam pa'i chos mnyan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i gnas ni dam pa'i chos mnyan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The basis of aspiration is the listening to the holy Dharma.üîΩIt is for the purpose of showing the cause of the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration, a cause that is not nonexistent, not contrary, not mistaken, and not wrong.

original: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa rnam par spangs pa dang / rig pa dang ldan pa dang / yang dag @326b pa'i rgyu yongs su bstan pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa rnam par spangs pa dang / rig pa dang ldan pa dang / yang dag @326b pa'i rgyu yongs su bstan pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma that is the basis of aspiration is the Dharma that is the basis of the right advice and instruction that is the practice of abandoning.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is included in the words and meanings that are the teaching of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.

original: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa spong ba'i sbyor ba ston pa dang ldan pa'i chos tshig dang don gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i mos pa'i bzhi dang gnas su gyur pa'i chos rnams mngon sum du byed parüîΩ'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa spong ba'i sbyor ba ston pa dang ldan pa'i chos tshig dang don gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i mos pa'i bzhi dang gnas su gyur pa'i chos rnams mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: It is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.üîΩIt is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.

original: / gal te bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu de /
analyzed: / gal te bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu de /
translated: It is the Dharma that is the basis of aspiration that is the cause of the right advice and instruction.

original: rgyud las su rung ba chos 'dul ba 'di la 'jug par byed na de ni yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par gdams ngag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyud las su rung ba chos 'dul ba 'di la 'jug par byed na de ni yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par gdams ngag bstan pa yin te /
translated: If one who is a fit vessel for the teachings enters into this Dharma-Vinaya, then it is a correct teaching and a correct instruction.

original: myur du khyad par du 'phags par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du khyad par du 'phags par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will quickly become superior.

original: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas /
translated: He, based on the four foundations of mindfulness,

original: khong du chud par bya ba tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / thob par bya ba thob par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / thob par bya ba thob par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: will understand what is to be understood, and will attain what is to be attained.

original: 'dus byas kyi sgo nas mkhas pa rnams kyis yod par 'dzin pa dang med par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang rab tu shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sgo nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi sgo nas mkhas pa rnams kyis yod par 'dzin pa dang med par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang rab tu shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sgo nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par /
translated: He will also understand the grasping of existence and non-existence by the wise through the conditioned, and he will understand the conditioned and unconditioned, that nirvana is superior up to the peak of existence, and that it is also superior in the unsurpassed.

original: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par rab tu shes pa 'di ni tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par rab tu shes pa 'di ni tshul bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: This is correct understanding.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pas sems mnyam par gzhag ste /üîΩbyang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms nas ;
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pas sems mnyam par gzhag ste / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms nas ;
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are the means by which the mind becomes concentrated.üîΩThe correct exertions are the means by which the branches of enlightenment are developed.üîΩThe bases of supernatural power are the means by which the branches of the path are developed.üîΩThe faculties are the means by which the path is made to arise.üîΩThe powers are the means by which the path is made to be irreversible.üîΩThe branches of enlightenment are the means by which the path is made to be without error.üîΩThe branches of the path are the means by which the path is made to be without confusion.üîΩThe realization of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is to be understood as the realization of the factors that contribute to enlightenment, which are the foundations of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the branches of the path.üîΩThe foundations of mindfulness are the means by which the mind becomes concentrated.

original: rig pa dang rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa 'di ni rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩgal te rigs kyi bu de nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jug na ni de gnas 'di dag ma thob pas bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa 'di ni rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o // gal te rigs kyi bu de nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jug na ni de gnas 'di dag ma thob pas bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The correct exertions are the means by which the branches of enlightenment are developed.üîΩThe bases of supernatural power are the means by which the branches of the path are developed.üîΩThe faculties are the means by which the path is made to arise.

original: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang bye brag dang // zas rnams dang ni go rims dang // reg par gnas dang rin chen dbye //
analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang bye brag dang // zas rnams dang ni go rims dang // reg par gnas dang rin chen dbye //
translated: The powers are the means by which the path is made to be irreversible.üîΩThe branches of enlightenment are the means by which the path is made to be without error.

original: bsgoms pa yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: bsgoms pa yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: The branches of the path are the means by which the path is made to be without confusion.üîΩThe realization of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is to be understood as the realization of the factors that contribute to enlightenment, which are the foundations of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the branches of the path.üîΩThe foundations of mindfulness are the means by which the mind becomes concentrated.üîΩThe correct exertions are the means by which the branches of enlightenment are developed.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang gnyis ka'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i bye brag gis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang gnyis ka'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i bye brag gis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The bases of supernatural power are the means by which the branches of the path are developed.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The faculties are the means by which the path is made to arise.üîΩThe powers are the means by which the path is made to be irreversible.üîΩThe branches of enlightenment are the means by which the path

original: rang bzhin gyi bye brag dang / dmigs pa dang / gzhi'i mtshan ma'i bye brag gis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bcu bzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bye brag dang / dmigs pa dang / gzhi'i mtshan ma'i bye brag gis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bcu bzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are to be understood as being fourteenfold, by way of their specific natures, their objects, and their specific characteristics as bases.

original: dmigs pa dang bzhi'i mtshan ma gnyis kyis rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa'i sa dang @327a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bzhi'i mtshan ma gnyis kyis rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa dang @327a * //
translated: The analysis by way of the two specific characteristics of object and basis is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are to be understood as they occur in the stage of meditative concentration and in the stage of the disciple.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas kyi chos rnams la ni yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis ril por byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi zas yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas kyi chos rnams la ni yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis ril por byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi zas yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of mental attention to the factors of enlightenment are the nourishment of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: phyin ci ma log pa yid la byed pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yid la byed pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //

original: de las bzlog pa ni zas ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni zas ma yin par rig par bya'o //

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su yan lag gang yang rung bam tshang na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i rten dang brten pa 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa las ni rim gyis 'byung bar bstan par rig par bya'o //

original: de la rten de lta bu ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten de lta bu ni dran pa'o //

original: brten pa de lta bu ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa de lta bu ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: ma goms pa'i lam la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ma goms pa'i lam la 'jug pa'o //

original: de las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhis ni rig par gnas par 'gyur ro //

original: yid la byed pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas na ha cang brtun ngas pa'i brtson 'grus yin no //üîΩmgo dang mjug tu lhag chad du gyur pas na ma snyoms pa ste /

translated: When one is mindful, one knows the time for the application of vigor

analyzed: de bas na rgyu 'di gnyis las ma goms pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the path of cultivation is due to these two causes.

analyzed: de las bzlog pa gnyis kyis kyang goms pa'i lam yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of cultivation should be understood as the opposite of those two.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi'i dbang phyug gi bdag po thob pa'i rin po che sna bdun dang 'dra bar sems kyi dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i yang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rin po che yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi'i dbang phyug gi bdag po thob pa'i rin po che sna bdun dang 'dra bar sems kyi dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i yang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rin po che yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The seven riches of the factors for enlightenment are like the seven jewels of the universal monarch, because they are the jewels of the great lordship of mind.

original: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong @327b dang gnyis ka'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'khor zhing kun du 'khor la nyon mongs pa las rnam par rgyal ba'i don gyis dran pa ni 'khor lo rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong @327b dang gnyis ka'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'khor zhing kun du 'khor la nyon mongs pa las rnam par rgyal ba'i don gyis dran pa ni 'khor lo rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, mindfulness is like the precious wheel, because it is the side that is concordant with both calm abiding and insight, and it is victorious over the afflictions through turning and completely turning.

original: shes bya mtha' yas pa shes pa'i lus che ba'i don gyis chos rnam par 'byed pa ni glang po rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' yas pa shes pa'i lus che ba'i don gyis chos rnam par 'byed pa ni glang po rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: The discrimination of phenomena is like the precious elephant, because it is the body of the knowledge of the infinite knowable objects.

original: ji srid bgrod par bya ba dang phyin par bya ba der myur du 'gro ba dang bar ma dor bar du gcod pa med pa'i don gyis brtson 'grus ni rta rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji srid bgrod par bya ba dang phyin par bya ba der myur du 'gro ba dang bar ma dor bar du gcod pa med pa'i don gyis brtson 'grus ni rta rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Vigor is like the precious horse, in the sense that one quickly goes to the place one should go and one goes without interruption in between.

original: mchog tu skyon med cing yid du 'ong ba'i don gyis dga' ba ni bud med rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: mchog tu skyon med cing yid du 'ong ba'i don gyis dga' ba ni bud med rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Joy is like the precious woman, in the sense that it is supremely faultless and delightful.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gyis shin tu sbyangs pa ni nor bu rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gyis shin tu sbyangs pa ni nor bu rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Calmness is like the precious jewel, in the sense that it is the fitness of body and mind, which is the nature of faith.

original: 'dod pa'i don thams cad sgrub pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin ni khyim bdag rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don thams cad sgrub pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin ni khyim bdag rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Samadhi is like the precious householder, in the sense that it accomplishes all desired aims.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sde 'joms pa'i don dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i don gyis chos kyi sde sgrub pa'i don dang mtshan ma med par gnas pa la ngal ba med par gnas pa sgrub pa'i don gyis btang snyoms ni blon po rin po cheüîΩlta bu'o / //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sde 'joms pa'i don dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i don gyis chos kyi sde sgrub pa'i don dang mtshan ma med par gnas pa la ngal ba med par gnas pa sgrub pa'i don gyis btang snyoms ni blon po rin po cheüîΩlta bu'o / //
translated: Equanimity is like the precious minister, in the sense that it destroys the army of addictions and it accomplishes the aim of the non-addicted, and it accomplishes the aim of abiding in signlessness without abiding in laziness.

original: / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /üîΩbam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba / bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi states:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi gos kyi za ma tog chen po thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rgyal po dang 'dra ba ni cha gsum gyi byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas pas gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi gos kyi za ma tog chen po thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rgyal po dang 'dra ba ni cha gsum gyi byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas pas gnas te /
translated: The yogin who has attained the great treasure chest of the seven factors of enlightenment, who is like a king, abides in the three parts of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / de gnyis ka'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / de gnyis ka'o //
translated: the factors of enlightenment that are conducive to ≈õamatha, the factors of enlightenment that are conducive to vipa≈õyanƒÅ, and both of those.

original: de dag ni de'i snga dro dang / nyi ma'i gung dang / phye ma red lta bu'i cha gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i snga dro dang / nyi ma'i gung dang / phye ma red lta bu'i cha gsum yin no //
translated: Those are the three parts of the morning, midday, and afternoon.

original: de la cha dang po la ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhis gnas so //
analyzed: de la cha dang po la ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhis gnas so //
translated: In the first part, he abides in four factors of enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa la yang bzhis gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang bzhis gnas so //
translated: In the second, he abides in four.

original: gsum pa la ni bdun po thams cad kyis gnas te /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bdun po thams cad kyis gnas te /
translated: In the third, he abides in all seven.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni nam yang byang chub kyi yan lag gcig pus mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni nam yang byang chub kyi yan lag gcig pus mi gnas so //
translated: The yogin never abides in just one factor of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de dag kyang mu stegs can gzhan rnams la zhe sdang gi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dgra zla'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de dag kyang mu stegs can gzhan rnams la zhe sdang gi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dgra zla'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang /
translated: These seven factors of enlightenment are called ‚Äúunshared‚Äù because they are not accompanied by the hostility of other tƒ´rthikas, because they do not abide in the manner of enemies, because they engage with the superior intention of benefit,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir na kho na med pa dang / 'gran zla can ma yin pa dang / gnod sems can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir na kho na med pa dang / 'gran zla can ma yin pa dang / gnod sems can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because they are not associated with any afflictions.

original: @328a * // gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des de dag mngon sum du byed pa dang / ji srid mngon sum du byas te gnas pa dang / gang gi tshe langs nas 'gag par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: @328a * // gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des de dag mngon sum du byed pa dang / ji srid mngon sum du byas te gnas pa dang / gang gi tshe langs nas 'gag par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: When the yogin makes them manifest, as long as he remains in their manifestation, and when he rises up from them and they cease, he knows all of that correctly and in actuality.

original: de ltar na de ni shes bzhin du gnas pa des kha na ma tho ba med par gnas pa dang / ro myang ba med pa dang / sems zang zing med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni shes bzhin du gnas pa des kha na ma tho ba med par gnas pa dang / ro myang ba med pa dang / sems zang zing med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he abides in full awareness, he abides without transgression, he abides without relishing, and his mind is not agitated.

original: 'du shes nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the branches of enlightenment endowed with the twenty-one kinds of perception should be understood in brief as twofold:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa'i don dang / de ma thag pa dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa'i don dang / de ma thag pa dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: as having the meaning of association and as having the meaning of immediate succession.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa nas 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i bar rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa nas 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i bar rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The perceptions of impermanence, etc., up to the perception of death have the meaning of association.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa nas stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i bar rnams ni de ma thag pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa nas stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i bar rnams ni de ma thag pa'i don to //
translated: The perceptions of the unattractive, etc., up to the perception of the investigation of emptiness have the meaning of immediate succession.

original: byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang de dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang de dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The perceptions of love, etc., should be understood as having the meaning of association.

original: 'du byed la 'chums pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed la 'chums pa ste /
translated: It is to be attached to formations.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la 'chums pa dang / le lo dang / snyom las dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs su zin kyang bag chags dang 'brel bas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod pa dang ro la sred pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la 'chums pa dang / le lo dang / snyom las dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs su zin kyang bag chags dang 'brel bas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod pa dang ro la sred pa dang /
translated: It is to be attached to past, future, and present formations. It is laziness, idleness, and the practice of pride, thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù due to the connection with the latent tendencies of the view of the transitory collection, even though it has been abandoned. It is craving for taste,

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su chags pa dang / nyon mongs pas lhag ma'i bag la nyal dang / rnyed pa'i bsam pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam pa dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su chags pa dang / nyon mongs pas lhag ma'i bag la nyal dang / rnyed pa'i bsam pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam pa dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang /
translated: being attached to the desire for the various things of the world, being attached to the desire for the remaining latent tendencies of the afflictions, the thought of gain, the thought of livelihood, craving for desire, craving for existence,

original: rtog pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: and the four types of desire realm attachment that are related to bad thoughts.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang bsnyen bkur gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang bsnyen bkur gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: They are the aspects of color, shape, touch, and service.

original: 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i skyon yin te /
translated: These are the faults of a yogin.

original: de rnams kyis sems lam log par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis sems lam log par 'jug par byed do //
translated: These cause the mind to enter the wrong path.

original: de dag gi gnyen por ni 'du shes nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag ci rigs par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por ni 'du shes nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag ci rigs par bsgom mo //
translated: The antidotes to these are the seven factors of enlightenment, which are associated with twenty-one kinds of ideation.

original: de la gzhi'i gnyen por ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzhi'i gnyen por ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed do //
translated: The antidote to the basis is the ideation of the aspect of wishlessness.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes nas bzung ste /
translated: The antidote to the sign is the ideation of impermanence,

original: @328b 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes kyi bar du bsgom mo //
analyzed: @328b 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes kyi bar du bsgom mo //
translated: up to the antidote to the sign of the world is the ideation of non-delight in the world.

original: gcig gi gnyen por ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: gcig gi gnyen por ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i 'du shes te /
translated: The antidote to the one is the ideation of the aspect of emptiness.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes te /
translated: The antidote to the sign of suffering is the ideation of selflessness.

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma'i bag la nyal spang ba'i phyir ni khams gsum la mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma'i bag la nyal spang ba'i phyir ni khams gsum la mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to the latent tendencies of the remaining afflictions is the ideation of the signlessness of the three realms.

original: rnyed pa'i bsam pa dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa'i gnyen por ni 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i bsam pa dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa'i gnyen por ni 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to the intention of gain and the craving for sensual pleasure is the ideation of the danger in sensual pleasures.

original: 'tsho ba'i bsam pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i gnyen por ni 'chi ba'i 'du shes so //üîΩrtog pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bsam pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa'i gnyen por ni 'chi ba'i 'du shes so // rtog pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes nas bzung ste /
translated: The perception of death is the antidote to the craving for life and to the craving for existence.

original: stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes kyi bar du bsgom mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes kyi bar du bsgom mo //
translated: The perception of the foul, etc. up to the perception of the investigation of emptiness are the antidotes to the four types of attachment associated with bad thoughts.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes nas stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes la thug pa de dag thams cad ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes nas stong pa nyid so sor brtag pa'i 'du shes la thug pa de dag thams cad ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: The perception of the foul, etc. up to the perception of the investigation of emptiness should be understood as the perception of the foul.

original: / de la rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa nas bam pa la thug pa rnams ni kha dog gi 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: / de la rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa nas bam pa la thug pa rnams ni kha dog gi 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: The perception of the foul, etc. up to the perception of a bloated corpse are the antidote to attachment to color.

original: rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes rnams ni dbyibs kyi 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'o //
