original: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba gnyis te /
translated: The two that are compatible with the lower and the two that are compatible with the higher, the two that are abandoned by insight and cultivation, and the two fetters of actualization and birth.

original: 'di rnams gcig tu bsdus pa ni drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams gcig tu bsdus pa ni drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: These are to be understood as six in total.

original: gom rims bzhin du 'bras bu'i phan yon gnyis dang bzhi dang bdun du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gom rims bzhin du 'bras bu'i phan yon gnyis dang bzhi dang bdun du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order, the benefits of the fruit are established as two, four, and seven.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgom pa ni 'di gnyis yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgom pa ni 'di gnyis yin te /
translated: The cultivation of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is twofold:

original: gong na yod pa dang gong na med ba'o //
analyzed: gong na yod pa dang gong na med ba'o //
translated: that which exists above and that which does not exist above.

original: de la gong na yod pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig gcig pu dben pa na 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la gong na yod pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig gcig pu dben pa na 'dug ste /
translated: For example, some people, while alone in a secluded place,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag nas srog gi dbang po'i dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dang 'brel ba tshul bzhin du mthong ste /üîΩgal te bdag gis dbugs rngubs nas phyi ma byung ngam /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag nas srog gi dbang po'i dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dang 'brel ba tshul bzhin du mthong ste / gal te bdag gis dbugs rngubs nas phyi ma byung ngam /
translated: having settled the mind, see correctly the in-and-out breathing connected with the life faculty.

original: yang na phyir byung nas nang du ma brngubs su zin na ni bdag gi srog 'gag pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: yang na phyir byung nas nang du ma brngubs su zin na ni bdag gi srog 'gag pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: If I inhale after exhaling, or if I exhale after inhaling, then my life will certainly cease.

original: gzhan yang 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la dbugs nang du rgyu ba chad nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la dbugs nang du rgyu ba chad nas /
translated: Moreover, with regard to impermanent formations,

original: ji srid du dbugs phyir 'byung ba skye ba de srid du srog gi dbang po gnas pa dang / dbugs phyir 'byung ba 'gags nas ji srid nang du dbugs rngub pa skye ba de srid du gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni ngo mtshar to snyam mo //
analyzed: ji srid du dbugs phyir 'byung ba skye ba de srid du srog gi dbang po gnas pa dang / dbugs phyir 'byung ba 'gags nas ji srid nang du dbugs rngub pa skye ba de srid du gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni ngo mtshar to snyam mo //
translated: as long as the in-breath ceases and the out-breath arises, the life faculty remains, and as long as the out-breath ceases and the in-breath arises, it remains. This is amazing!

original: de dmigs pa des yid yang dag par skyo bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de dmigs pa des yid yang dag par skyo bar gyur nas /
translated: By that object, his mind becomes truly weary.

original: dus gsum du rjes su chags pa dang khong khro'i sems rnam par sbyong ba 'di ni gong na yod pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du rjes su chags pa dang khong khro'i sems rnam par sbyong ba 'di ni gong na yod pa'o //
translated: This is the superior purification of the mind from attachment and hostility in the three times.

original: rnam pa bcu drug ni gong na med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug ni gong na med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The sixteen aspects should be understood as the superior.

original: rlung ni cha phra bar dmigs pa'i phyir gnas pa cha phra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rlung ni cha phra bar dmigs pa'i phyir gnas pa cha phra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù station is so called because one observes the wind as subtle.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the station of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du mchod pas na chog mi shes pa'o //üîΩlus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa rgya chen pos byed pas na skyo bar bya @331a * //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du mchod pas na chog mi shes pa'o // lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa rgya chen pos byed pas na skyo bar bya @331a * //
translated: The ‚Äúinsatiable‚Äù station is so called because it is not satiated by the investigation and analysis.

original: ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúnon-discursive‚Äù station is so called because it is not discursive due to the vastness of the body and mind.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgom pa'i lus ni ngal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgom pa'i lus ni ngal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The body of one who cultivates the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation does not become weary,

original: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults of the side of tranquility are removed.

original: mig kyang ngal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig kyang ngal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The eyes also do not become weary,üîΩbecause the faults of the side of insight are removed.

original: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to eliminate the minor defilements which are favorable to insight.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang bde bar mthong ba ni bde bar rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang bde bar mthong ba ni bde bar rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The view of happiness is the view of happiness in nirvana.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba ni bde ba nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba ni bde ba nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: The experience of happiness is the experience of the happiness of the third meditation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su yi 'chad pa med do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su yi 'chad pa med do //
translated: There is no discouragement, because he does not dwell in the afflicted view of a real self.

original: bde ba des gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba des gnas so //
translated: He dwells in this happiness.

original: 'di na kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi nang na tha ma dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig 'di snyam du sems te / de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi nang na tha ma dang khyad par med do //
translated: Here some think as follows:üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is not distinguished from all the arhats who are liberated by the liberation of discernment, because of the liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba gang yin pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis khyad par med na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba gang yin pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis khyad par med na /
translated: If the liberation of the TathƒÅgata and the liberation of the arhat who is liberated by the liberation of discernment are not distinguished,

original: ci 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgrib pa med par gnas pa gang yin pa dang las dang po pa thams cad kyi nang na tha ma slob pa so so'i skye bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis sgrib pa lnga spangs nas gnas paüîΩgang yin pa 'di la sgrib pa med par gnas zhes te /
analyzed: ci 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgrib pa med par gnas pa gang yin pa dang las dang po pa thams cad kyi nang na tha ma slob pa so so'i skye bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis sgrib pa lnga spangs nas gnas pa gang yin pa 'di la sgrib pa med par gnas zhes te /
translated: Is the state of abiding without obscuration of the tathƒÅgatas and the state of abiding without obscuration of all beginners, who are the lowest of trainees, who are ordinary beings, who abide by abandoning the five obscurations through the power of effort,üîΩthe same as the state of abiding without obscuration?

original: sgrib pa med pa gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa gnas par ci rnam par grol ba bzhin du khyad par med dam /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa gnas par ci rnam par grol ba bzhin du khyad par med dam /
translated: Is there no difference between them, as there is no difference between liberation?

original: 'on te khyad par yod snyam pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par yod snyam pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: Or is there a difference?

original: sgrib pa med par gnas pa 'di gnyis ni khyad par shin tu che bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa med par gnas pa 'di gnyis ni khyad par shin tu che bar rig par bya ste /
translated: These two states of abiding without obscuration should be understood to have a very great difference.

original: slob pa ni kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sems sgrib pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshungs mod kyi bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir yang dang yang du sems kyi rgyud sgrib pa rnams kyis 'dre bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob pa ni kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sems sgrib pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshungs mod kyi bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir yang dang yang du sems kyi rgyud sgrib pa rnams kyis 'dre bar 'gyur te /
translated: The learner, by way of his conduct, is similar to the TathƒÅgata in that his mind is free from obscurations. However, because he has not abandoned the latent afflictions, his mindstream is repeatedly defiled by the obscurations.

original: yang dang yang du spangs dgos so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du spangs dgos so //
translated: He must abandon them again and again.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa gtan du spangs pa'i phyir khyad par shin tu che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa gtan du spangs pa'i phyir khyad par shin tu che ba yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, because he has abandoned the obscurations forever, is vastly superior.

original: rnam par grol ba la khyad par med pa dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la khyad par med pa dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: This is not like the absence of difference in liberation.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba'i dran pa la brten nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba'i dran pa la brten nas /
translated: The yogi, in dependence on mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,

original: dran pa nye bar @331b gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar @331b gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
translated: when he cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs par yod pa la yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs par yod pa la yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: knows in accordance with reality that improper mental attention exists without abandoning internal improper mental attention.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par shes nas kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa spangs nas des spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'ba' zhig gcig tu nges par sgom par byed do
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par shes nas kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa spangs nas des spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'ba' zhig gcig tu nges par sgom par byed do
translated: Having understood that incorrect mental activity is incorrect, he abandons incorrect mental activity and cultivates only correct mental activity in order to abandon it.

original: // de la lam gyi bzhi mdo chen po lta bu ni lus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi'o //
analyzed: // de la lam gyi bzhi mdo chen po lta bu ni lus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi'o //
translated: The four crossroads is like the four dharmas of body, etc.

original: rdul gyi phung po lta bu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rdul gyi phung po lta bu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Incorrect mental activity is like a heap of dust,

original: mi brtan pa dang / snying po med pa dang / sems rmongs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi brtan pa dang / snying po med pa dang / sems rmongs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is unstable, worthless, and causes confusion.

original: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs nas 'ongs pa'i khyogs dang / bzhon pa dang / shing rta dang / shing rta phal pa lta bu ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste lus la sogs pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs nas 'ongs pa'i khyogs dang / bzhon pa dang / shing rta dang / shing rta phal pa lta bu ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste lus la sogs pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Correct mental activity is like a palanquin, vehicle, chariot, or carriage that comes from the east, south, west, or north, because it is stable, valuable, and causes understanding.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rdul gyi phung po lta bu'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de gzhom pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyud rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs so //
analyzed: rdul gyi phung po lta bu'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de gzhom pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyud rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs so //
translated: In order to destroy the improper mental activity that is like a mass of dust, and in order to purify the mindstream completely in every way,

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la brtson zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la ni lus kyi rgyu can dang / lus 'dzin pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis shin tu mnyam ste /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la brtson zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la ni lus kyi rgyu can dang / lus 'dzin pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis shin tu mnyam ste /
translated: one who is diligent in the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and who cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness, is very even-minded with regard to the mental activity that is the cause of the body and the mental activity that grasps the body, by means of the sameness of selflessness.

original: ji ltar lus bdag med pa bzhin du yid la byed pa de yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lus bdag med pa bzhin du yid la byed pa de yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the body is selfless, so too is mental activity.

original: de bas na lus dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lus dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be like the body.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa de ni gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa de ni gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: That cultivation of the establishment of mindfulness of the body does not apprehend anything at all.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness should be understood in detail in the same way as the four establishments of mindfulness of the body, up to the four establishments of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams la med de /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams la med de /
translated: Thus, this kind of teaching on the establishments of mindfulness of the buddhas does not exist for the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas.

original: de bas na mu stegs can thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: de bas na mu stegs can thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to surpass all tƒ´rthikas.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the establishment of mindfulness.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / tshul khrims lhur len tshul khrims 'byor /
analyzed: sdom ni / tshul khrims lhur len tshul khrims 'byor /
translated: The one who values morality, the one who is rich in morality,üîΩV·πõji, the benefits of training,üîΩthe divisions of training,

original: @332a * // lhag spyod bslab pa'i phan yon dang // bslab pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang // chos kyi gnas ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: @332a * // lhag spyod bslab pa'i phan yon dang // bslab pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang // chos kyi gnas ni tha ma yin //
translated: and the final point of the Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnams kyi bslab pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnams kyi bslab pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: The three trainings in superior morality, superior concentration, and superior wisdom are presented in detail as follows.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is explained in the Sravaka Levels.

original: bslab pa 'di rnams la ni mdor bsdu na log par sgrub pa yang yod la yang dag par sgrub pa yang yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa 'di rnams la ni mdor bsdu na log par sgrub pa yang yod la yang dag par sgrub pa yang yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, you should understand that there are two ways of practicing these trainings: incorrect practice and correct practice.

original: de la log par sgrub pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig rab tu byung ba na yang tshul khrims lhur len pa ma yin la tshul khrims kho na'i dbang du byas te rab tu byung ba yang ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de la log par sgrub pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig rab tu byung ba na yang tshul khrims lhur len pa ma yin la tshul khrims kho na'i dbang du byas te rab tu byung ba yang ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Incorrect practice is like the following cases: Some people do not take up the moral discipline when they go forth, and they do not go forth for the sake of the moral discipline alone.

original: shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that the same is true of meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: de la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang la skal ba med par gsungs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i nyes pa 'byung ba'i skabs yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang la skal ba med par gsungs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i nyes pa 'byung ba'i skabs yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Blessed One said that those who do not have the good fortune to practice these trainings will have no opportunity to avoid committing all the remaining faults.
